loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 55 years old and from Mahayag. He currently lives with his wife and four children. Renato earns a living through his farming activities.

Renato wants to double his sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to buy six bags of fertilizer. 

In the future, he wants to be rice supplier of his neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is 66 years old, a  farmer from Mahayag. He currently lives with his wife and children, and earns a living through his farming activities. 

Ephraim wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to buy four bags of fertilizer. 

Someday, he wants to purchase another riceland to cultivate to earn more for his family.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Starlah Jane

texts.en:
Starlah Jane studied at the University, for she wants to have a better career in the future. She currently lives with her family, and helps them in their business on weekends. She does household chores too. 

After she had joined GDMPC, she borrowed a new loan to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester of this school year. She is hopeful that with GDMPC, her financial needs will be easier.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees

loans.name: Julie Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Julie Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a rice mill operator business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Julie Fe is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her rice mill operator business.

Julie Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2014 and he appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. He is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.
He is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP30,000.00 This loan is intended to purchase spare parts for motorcycles.

Erwin dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Sri Amman Shg - Poonthottam Group

texts.en:
Poonthottam is a hamlet in Tamil Nadu. Lakshmithilagam, age 34, lives in this village with her husband who is a farmer by profession. They have two children. 

Lakshmithilagam is the featured borrower of Sri Amman Self Help Group, which includes six other women and is managed by the local NGO People's Action for Transformation (PAT). They have taken loans from PAT previously to improve their livelihoods and always repaid on time. 

Currently, all members are using mud cook stoves. Smoke emitted from these stoves is a major health hazard as burning wood contains fine particulate matter, carbon monoxide, formaldehyde, sulfur dioxide and various irritant gases, such as nitrogen oxides, that can scar the lungs. Wood smoke also contains chemicals known or suspected to be carcinogens, such as polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) and dioxin, which can lead to fatal lung diseases, such as lung cancer, pneumonia, bronchitis, etc. 

Hence, all the members need a loan to purchase smokeless stoves to be used in their kitchens. These stoves are more convenient for cooking, hardly emit any smoke, and help save on fuel.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Juraina

texts.en:
Juraina is 32 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Juraina has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from buying and selling dry goods.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Wilmer Joel

texts.en:
Wilmer Joel is  32 years old and lives with his wife. He has two children who depend on him.  For six years he  has had a business selling windows, balconies, metal and acrylic doors, making false roofs, sliding windows,and everything related to metal and glass.

Wilmer has his business located in the community where he lives in southern Honduras. His customers prefer him because of his good work and his punctualityin delivering it. He is a small businessman who provides work to people, and in this way is contributing to the development of his town.

Wilmer  he is requesting the loan in order to purchase the materials such as aluminum and other metals and glass which are the materials he needs for making his windows and doors.  With the support of this loan he wishes to improve his workshop and fill the orders he has. His dream is to have a good home and a good workshop in order to generate more jobs for people in his community.  It is the fourth loan he has requested from Prisma. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014.

loans.use: to buy glass, as well as aluminum and other metals for his business.

loans.name: Mhare Jhon

texts.en:
Mhare Jhon is 18 years old and from Aurora, Isabela. Despite the fact that they are struggling financially, he wanted to continue and finish studying to help his parents send his siblings to school. Mhare Jhon has seven siblings; five of them are younger than him. 

He is currently enrolled in ASKI’s Microfinance Technology course. That is why he wants to avail an educational loan of P40,000 from the Kiva lenders to be used for his tuition fee. He is hopeful that lenders will approve his loan for this will help him in achieving his goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee

loans.name: Anchel Russel Mae

texts.en:
Anchel Russel Mae is from Dingalan, Aurora. She is currently enrolled in a 9-month Microfinance Technology Course in ASKI. She wanted to graduate and have a stable job to help her family out of poverty. 

To accomplish this, she wants to ask for P40,000 financial assistance from the Kiva lenders. She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan so that she won’t have to stop schooling.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma has been helping her husband work on their own farm to make a living. It is their main source of income, and while waiting for the planting and harvest seasons, she keeps on selling snacks in their village to cover their daily expenditures. 

It is her plan to cultivate more and without hesitation, she joined GDMPC and is borrowing a loan to buy planting materials like seeds and fertilizer. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy planting materials like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Lily

texts.en:
In Sindangan, Maria Lily raises pigs. She is 60 years old, married and works hard for her family. She signed up  with PMPC to access capital. Recently, she applied for a loan to buy bags of feed. 

Maria Lily hopes to double her income so that she can save more for her family. She also wishes to build concrete pig pens for improved sanitation.

loans.use: to buy bags of feed

loans.name: Merejoy

texts.en:
Merejoy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell peanut business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of peanuts to sell for her buy and sell peanut business.

Merejoy has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

Susana has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Junery

texts.en:
Junery is married with 2 children.He is 40 years old and lives in Balangasan, Pagadian City Philippines.

     Junery operates a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 9 years. Each month he earns
PHP 15,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to restock the store with basic commodities.

     Junery has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future he hope to become successful businessman.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Lenny Jean

texts.en:
Lenny Jean is married with 1 child. She is 31 years old and lives in Navalan Tukuran, ZDS.

     She runs a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month she earns PHP 15,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

     Lenny Jean has been a member of PMPC for 3 months. In the future she hope to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities.

location.town: Pagadian - Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Henderina

texts.en:
Henderina, 61 years old, is married to 64-year-old Lodwik. They are blessed with four daughters, all of whom are housewives: Paulina is age 38; Rebeka is age 35; Marce is 33 and  Linda is 31. They also have two sons : Opa, age 29, is an eight-semester student of a private university majoring in agriculture; Marthen, age 28, is an eight-semester student of a Christian university majoring in theology. 

Henderina has been selling food and spices such as onions, garlic, chillies, potatoes and various kinds of seasoning powder since the 1980s in order to help her husband, who works as a repairman of electronic appliances.  Although Henderina and her husband are getting old, they still have enthusiasm for work. 

Currently, Henderina's stocks are running low. She has therefore requested a loan from TLM for IDR 3,000,000 to purchase several kilos of food spices.

loans.use: to purchase several kilos of food spices

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita raises and commercially sells her pigs in Sindangan. At the age of 66, she never gets tired providing for her family. Margarita signed up with PMPC to access funding. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase materials for pig pen construction. Margarita wants to build concrete, sanitary pig pens that help the environment.

loans.use: to purchase materials for pig pen construction

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya has been selling vegetables and fruits in her village to make a living. While her husband is farming, she is the one to sell their farm products and it brings a better source of income for the family. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods to sell. She is willing to sacrifice under the heat of the sun in order to augment their living situation. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional and more variety fruits and vegetables for resale in order to increase sales. She plans to use her generated income as additional capital for her business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional and more variety fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 53 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

Wilma has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a 43-year-old married mother of five children, two currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Antonieta has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Antonieta has been in this business for one year. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming citrus in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming citrus for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Suenie

texts.en: Suenie operates a transportation business while her husband works in the village for a living. Suenie has run her transportation business for three years, and was happy to say that this helps a lot to her family while waiting for the salary of her husband. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy new tires and cover maintenance costs. In the future, she wants to have a better living with her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires and cover maintenance costs

loans.name: Sinta

texts.en:
Sinta is applying for a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 29 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as soft drinks, fanta, coca cola, sprite, hard drinks, beer, candles, fish, water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, and noodles. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.
 
Sinta is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students. She is running a kiosk to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Sandrina

texts.en:
Sandrina works hard to support her family. Sandrina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Sandrina has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Sandrina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 56 years old and married with 12 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Beverly has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the vegetable business for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Beverly aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla works hard to support her family. Carla is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Carla requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell.

Carla has been in this business for one year now.

Carla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Gena

texts.en: Gena sells snacks, specializing in steamed rice cakes, to make a living. Her husband is a driver. She has been doing this business for over six years, earning well for the family. Her previous loan used for the business has been successfully repaid. She works with determination and she is saving her generated revenue to finance her children's education. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and an additional steamer.

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1955. She lives in Dong Anh - a small suburb of Ha Noi. She is the mother of four children; some of them are married. Dung and her husband have been selling beverages for 10 years.They also grow rice for living. By working hard, they earn VND 9,000,000 per month. 

Dung has been a member of SEDA program since 2004. She successfully repaid a loan of VND 11,118,000. This time, in her eighth loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 12,862,000 to buy more chairs and tables for her shop. Dung hopes that she could earn more money to improve the living standard for her family. 

Dung is a leader with 4 other members who are included in the following list.
• Van is 36 years old. She has three children. She would like to borrow VND 12,426,000 to sell dry food. 
• Hong has two children. She is 38 years old. She wants to borrow VND 12,426,000 to sell beverages. 
• Chung is a farmer who is 43 years old. She is requesting a loan of VND 11,118,000 to raise chickens.
• Duyen is a hairdresser. She is 37 years old. Duyen has two children. She is requesting a loan of VND 9,810,000 to buy new tools for her barber shop.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and tables for her shop

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia has been working with her husband in their own farm for many years to make a living. With her generated income from farm produce, she was able to repay successfully her previous loans used for farming. Planning to improve the farm, she took a new loan recently to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Letecia hopes to increase her harvest in order to take care of her family’s daily needs and to purchase additional farmland as well.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Carmel

texts.en:
Carmel is a 24-year-old married woman with two children, one currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Carmel has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Carmel requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Carmel has been in this business for one year. In the future, Carmel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and married with three children, all currently in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feed, detergent soap, canned goods, and shampoo. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gene works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending. Gene is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Gene has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Alfredo desea montar un negocio de comidas rápidas en su casa ubicada en el municipio de La Dorada.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le da su familia que lo impulsa para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 

Aunque el siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar todos los elementos necesarios para el montaje de su negocio tales como 1 congelador, nevera, 1 carrito de comidas con freidora, sillas, mesas, insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de un Padre colombiano!
texts.en:
With the hope of moving move forward and overcoming, Alfredo wants to start a fast food business in his home in the town of La Dorada. This idea stems from motivation from his family, which drives him to start this business and thus earn the necessary income to sustain his home.

Although he has always wanted to be independent, he has never had the courage to risk starting a business, but now, he feels the strength and ability to do so.

He's seeking a loan to buy all the necessary elements for the start of his business, such as a freezer, refrigerator, food trolley with a fryer, chairs, tables, inputs and ingredients for food preparation.

With these elements, he will be able to start with this project and will accomplish his dream of being independent. With your help to this loan, you will be encouraging entrepreneurial ideas of a Colombian father!

loans.use: to buy a freezer, refrigerator, food trolley with a fryer, chairs, tables, inputs and ingredients for food preparation to accomplish his goal of being independent.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina is taking a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as body lotion, shampoo, pencils, books, cigarettes, coffee and sugar. She opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $200.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She also has buffalo, pigs, chicken and mutton.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is requesting a loan of (USD) $800 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as  cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, noodles, bread, water, eggs and body lotion. Teresa opened her kiosk in 2014 with her own working capital of $250. She is happy with the loan offered from (Tuba Rai Metin) for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, noodles, bread, water, eggs and body lotion.

loans.name: Ade

texts.en: Meet Ade. Ade is a father of two who lives with four people in the family home in Cianjur, West Java. Cianjur is a small city situated at the foot of Mount Gede-Pangrango, about 103 km from Jakarta. Ade manages a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. His spouse is a fulltime housewife, taking care of their children who are going to school. He began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income. Since then, he became more aware of how mobile technology can support his business. He is really excited to expand his business with Ruma. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends, which is when people mostly buy mobile airtime. In the photo, Ade is sitting in his small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 29 years old and married with one child.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, sugar, vinegar, etc. to sell.

Elena has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Elena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ms Lutfi

texts.en: Meet Lutfi. Lutfi is a miner who lives in Serang, a small city located about two hours from Jakarta. Lutfi is married - his wife is a full-time mother taking care of the family and their little 2.5-year-old daughter. As a miner, Lutfi realized that he needs to find another source of income to support his family's needs. One day, he met one of Ruma's staff and was really interested to sell mobile airtime credits; he could see there's a market opportunity from his surrounding neighborhood who mostly have used mobile phones in their daily life. He joined Ruma 2.5 months ago and has started selling mobile airtime credits. As Lutfi's business continues, he needs a working capital loan from Kiva that will be useful to top-up more mobile airtime credits on the weekends - which is when people mostly buy mobile airtime. He hopes that he will be able to run the business sustainably as he is really excited and passionate in learning how to do business with support and assistance from Ruma.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credits transaction on weekends.

loans.name: Jewander

texts.en: To make a living, a young entrepreneur, Jewander, has been operating a general store for over four years. She earns well from it and is able to sustain the business. With her generated revenue, she was able to repay successfully her previous loan used for purchasing goods. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional variety of grocery goods to sell. She plans to expand her business using her generated revenue and hopes to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Sabali 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SABALI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJAN, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le mais  avec WARABA 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 120 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group SABALI 3 are married women who average 42 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in polygamous families in the commune of DJAN, prefecture KOLONDIEBA, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 7th loan cycle with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.

WARABA grows groundnuts, maize and rice. She is the member sitting first from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 2 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in Kolondieba to a clientele consisting of both men and women.  

Waraba expects to earn a profit of 120,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing for the agricultural season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for one year now.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, meat, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Betty has been in this business for 1 year. She earns additional income from selling fish.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, meat, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a retail dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Rowena is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of dry goods to sell for her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 61 years old and married with three children. Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years.  Josefina requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like detergent, soap, canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.


Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like detergent, soap, canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, firewood, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has been saving money for a long time in order to make home improvements, but most of the savings are spent on household expenses. Now she wants to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare more snacks to sell so she can improve sales and revenue. 

Therefore, Jocelyn has requested a loan from GDMPC micro credit so that she could earn more income and be able to repair her house with the contribution of savings.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare more snacks to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 41 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Amelita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming and selling vegetables.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 39 years old and married with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Patricia has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Patricia has been in this business for 1 year. Patricia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking utensils such as a pan, a pot, and a mill, and to also buy ingredients to continue making her recipes so that she can get her family ahead and give her children an education.

loans.name: Moises Elias

texts.es:
Moisés es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un pequeño negocio en el que vende productos de limpieza y desinfección como jabones, detergentes, desinfectantes, entre. Inicio el negocio hace 3 años con la esperanza de conseguirse un buen futuro después de verse obligado a desplazarse a causa de la violencia. 

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser más independiente y poder tener una vida más digna.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de productos de limpieza al por mayor como jabones y detergentes para abastecer su negocio.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Moisés is ready, willing, and able to face the world and have a full life. He has a small business where he sells cleaning products like soaps, detergents, and disinfectants. He started his business three years ago hoping to make a future for himself after being forced to move because of the violence.

He wants to offer a wider array of products and increase his sales by injecting capital into his business. That is the reason why he is requesting a loan, so that he can give himself the opportunity of becoming more independent and having a better life.

The money will be invested in buying wholesale cleaning products like soaps and detergents to stock his business.

He has great hopes for his business and believes that his future can improve substantially thanks to the support of organizations like this one, that are making it possible for people to aim for better, more stable lives.

loans.use: to buy products like soaps and detergents to stock his small business.

loans.name: Adna

texts.en:
Adna is a 50-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Adna has a direct-sales business offering personal care products in the Philippines. Adna has requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

Adna has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Adna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more personal care products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vannamalargal Shg-Sundaraperumalkovil Group

texts.en:
Vannamalargal Self-Help Group is managed by the local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT). This NGO helps people improve their livelihood in Tamil Nadu.   
 
Arokiyamary is the leader of this group, which consists of six more members. She lives in Sundaraperumalkovil village, Tanjore district, in her own house with her husband and a child. Her husband is a farmer. 

Arokiyamary is a regular customer of PAT. She has been taking loans for the last five years and has repaid the loans on time.

Arokiyamary wants to purchase a smokeless stove, which is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt., Ltd. Its cost is 1,400 INR. It is designed for daily use. The traditional stoves produce more smoke and are called kitchen killers. The smokeless stove emits less carbon dioxide and prevents household risk. It also promotes healthier lifestyles by limiting the toxic and hazardous effects of indoor pollution.

Arokiyamary and the other members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove to give a healthier life to their families.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Thulasi Shg - Neikunnam Group

texts.en:
“Thulasi” is a Self Help Group in Neikunnam village, Tamil Nadu, which is under the local NGO called “PAT”. The group has been in existence for more than six years. The total number of members in the group is 15. Vemba is the leader of this SHG (holding a board with the SHG name). She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have two children and the family is living in their own house.  

The members of the group have received loans from “PAT” for six years, one after another, repaying the loan amount regularly on time. They have taken loans to improve their livelihoods.           

Now the group members need a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is produced by Greenway Grameen Infra. This stove costs the very low price of INR 1,400, and the reduction in indoor air pollution means healthier women and healthier families. Healthier indoor air quality benefits young children and women who spend the maximum amount of time in and around the kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Sabali 4 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SABALI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJAN, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le mais  avec KARIDIA 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 130 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of Sabali 4 Group are married women with an average age of 39. They have an average of five children and all live in polygamous families in Djan, in the commune of Kolondieba, one of the prefectures in the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Karidia, standing at the far left in the photo, grows rice, groundnuts, and corn. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, and to pay for the labor costs of farming two hectares of land. After the harvest, the output is sold in Kolondieba to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn a profit of 130,000 FCFA that will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for inputs, seeds, and labor costs.

loans.name: Sabali 5 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SABALI  5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJAN, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide, de fonio et le mais  avec ARAMATOU 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 175 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of Sabali 5 Group are married women with an average age of 38. They have an average of three children and all live in polygamous families in Djan, in the commune of Kolondieba, one of the prefectures in the third largest administrative region of Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Aramatou, standing at the far left in the photo, grows rice, groundnuts, and fonio. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, and to pay for the labor costs of farming two hectares of land. After the harvest, the output is sold in Kolondieba to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn a profit of 175,000 FCFA that will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for inputs, seeds, and labor costs.

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  49 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MENA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le mais  avec SALIMATA 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 225 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of Benkadi 1 Group are married women with an average age of 49. They have an average of four children and all live in polygamous families in Mena, in the area of Kolondieba, one of the prefectures in the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Salimata, standing at the far left in the photo, grows rice, groundnuts, and corn. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, and to pay for the labor costs of farming of three hectares of land. After the harvest, the output is sold in Kolondieba to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn a profit of 225,000 FCFA that will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for inputs, seeds, and labor costs.

loans.name: Ngo's Group

texts.en:
Ngo is a hard working person who was born in 1953 in Dong Anh district. She is the mother of four children, some of whom  are married. Ngo is a farmer and her husband is a guard. Her family income is VND 6,500,000. Her challenge in life is the shortage of capital to expand her business. 

Ngo has been a member of SEDA program since 2004. This is her seventh cycle. She successfully repaid a loan of VND 6,322,000. Now she wants to borrow VND 8,502,000 to buy chickens and animal fodder.

Ngo is a leader of 4 members who are included in the following list:

• Thai is 37 years old. She has two children. She would like to borrow VND 12,426,000 to sell beverages and raise chickens. 
• Ha has two children. She is 44 years old. She wants to borrow VND 12,426,000 to sell cakes at the market. 
• Dan is 56 year old. She has two children. She is applying a VND 12,426,000 loan through SEDA’s program to raise childrens. 
• Lan is 40 years old. She has three children. She is requesting a loan of VND 9,810,000 to sell vegetables at the market.

loans.use: to sell beverages and raise chicken

loans.name: Lilis

texts.en:
Lilis is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  Lilis has been in this business for 1 year and earns additional income from selling firewood.

She is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, feeds, canned foods, noodles, spices, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Lilis has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, feed, canned foods, noodles, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lillymalar Shg-Malathangulam Group

texts.en:
PAT (People’s Action for Transformation) manages the Self-Help Group Lillymalar, which contains seven members in same locality in Tamil Nadu, India. PAT helps the members to improve the livelihood of the people. Pappa is the leader of the group, and she lives in Malathangulam village, Ariyalur district.
  
Pappa is married and lives in her own house with her child and her husband who is a farmer. Pappa has previously taken loans from PAT to improve her livelihood, and always repaid the loans on the time.

Pappa and the other members are requesting the loan to buy a smokeless stove, which costs 1,400 rupees. It is better than the traditional mud stove. The traditional stove creates more smoke and soot. Smokeless stoves are affordable and comfortable for cooking and produce less carbon dioxide compared to the traditional stoves.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 53 years old and married with five children, one of whom in school. Nida works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Nida has been in this business for 25 years.  In the future Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Semozhi Shg - Ammanpettai Group

texts.en:
Angelmary is leader of the Semozhi Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu. Angelmary lives in Ammanpettai village in Tamil Nadu. Angelmary lives in her own house with her two children and husband who is a driver. Angelmary has taken loans from the PAT previously and repaid it on time. She had taken loans to improve her livelihood and for cultivation of paddy, sugar cane, ragi etc.
 
Angelmary wants to buy a smokeless stove that is better than the traditional stove. The latter emits a lot of carbon dioxide and creates health and environment problems. The smokeless stove emits less smoke and reduces the risk of respiratory diseases. It is clean and easy to use.

Along with Angelmary, the other members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove to lead a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Roxanie

texts.en:
Roxanie is 30 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Roxanie works very hard to provide for them.

Roxanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Roxanie has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, etc. 

Roxanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jeanina

texts.en:
Jeanina is 45 years old and married with two children who are in school.  Jeanina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years.  Jeanina has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

In the future Jeanina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Devi

texts.en:
Devi is a housewife who lives with her husband in Cilegon, a major coastal industrial city located about three hours from Jakarta. 

Devi's husband owns and manages a car repair shop while Devi is running a small stall called 'Warung' that sells snacks, drinks, consumer goods products, and mobile airtime credits. She has started selling mobile airtime credits since she began working with Ruma. 

As the business continues, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable her process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help her in running the mobile airtime business and consequently supporting her plan to seek for more business opportunity in the future. 

In the photo, Devi is standing in front of her small stall.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credits transaction on weekends

loans.name: San Juanico El Alto Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes de San Juanico el Alto se caracterizan por ser muy alegres, pero sobretodo porque son personas emprendedoras. Ellos siempre buscan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Lorena, o Lore como le llaman, es la representante del grupo, tiene 25 años de edad y desde hace 6 vive en unión libre con su pareja Daniel quien trabaja en la compra y venta de desperdicio industrial.  Juntos han formado una familia con dos niños.
Hace 5 años Daniel se encontraba desempleado por lo que  él y Lore decidieron iniciar con el negocio de la compra y venta de chatarra y la actividad les dejó buenas ganancias. Poco después, Lore comenzó otro negocio: la venta de macetas y figuras de yeso. “Mis padres comenzaron a trabajar en esto, desde muy pequeña yo los acompañaba a vender pero ahora me siento muy contenta porque tengo mi propio negocio” 
Con el préstamo, Lore podrá comprar macetas de barro, figuras de yeso y pinturas. Ya en casa, ella se dedica a decorar todo con mucha imaginación, comenta que siempre trata de utilizar la mejor pintura para que duren por más tiempo y sus clientes regresen. Lore sabe que necesita invertir más dinero en la pintura pero no le gustaría que sus clientes se desilusionaran de la calidad de su trabajo. Una vez que Lore tiene suficientes macetas y figuras, sale a otros lugares a otros estados de la republica Mexicana situación que realmente disfruta pues tiene la oportunidad de conocer a otras personas y sus tradiciones.
En general los integrantes del grupo están muy contentos con sus negocios Guadalupe tiene una estética, Beatriz se dedica a la venta de lácteos, Adriana y Anahí a la venta de dulces dulces y Miguel a la compra y venta de tambos.
texts.en:
The members of San Juanico el Alto are all very cheerful and, above all, enterprising people. They are always finding ways to improve their families' quality of life.

Lorena, or Lore, as she is known, represents this group. She is 25 years old and has been living with her partner, Daniel, for six years. He works buying and selling industrial waste. Together they have formed a family and have two children.

Five years ago Daniel was unemployed, so he and Lore decided to start their own business buying and selling junk and they made good income from the business. Soon after, Lore started another business: selling planters and plaster figurines. “My parents started to do this work, and ever since I was little I would go with them to sell their products. Now I am very happy because I have my own business." 

This loan will allow Lore to buy clay planters, plaster figurines, and paint. At home, she always decorates everything very imaginatively. She says she always tries to use the best paint so things last longer and her customers keep coming back. Lore knows that she needs to invest more money in the paint and wouldn't want her customers to be disappointed in the quality of her work. Once she has enough planters and figurines, Lore goes out to other areas and states within Mexico, which she really enjoys because she likes having a chance to meet other people and learn about their traditions.

All in all, every member of the group is very happy with his or her business. Guadalupe has a beauty salon, Beatriz works selling dairy products, Adriana and Anahí sell sweets, and Miguel buys and sells bins.

loans.use: to buy clay planters and paint.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 54 years old and married with ten children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Carmelita has been in pig fattening for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Toaiga

texts.en: Toaiga is a 60-year-old, widow with nine children. She runs a small shop in her village and she gets the assistance of her children when needed. This is her second year with the SPBD program gaining access to financial assistance. She plans to use this loan to purchase sacks of sugar, rice, flour, onions, soaps, and a freezer to restock her shop. Toaiga hopes to continue the operation of her business so she is able to improve her large family's living standards without depending on others.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar, rice, flour, onions, soaps, and a freezer.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell firewood and charcoal business in the Philippines. Editha has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood and charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jonaisa

texts.en:
Jonaisa is 33 years old and married with two children, who are in school. Jonaisa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a nipa roof-making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa leaves, bamboo, etc.

Jonaisa has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Jonaisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa leaves, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Aifai

texts.en: Aifai is 41 years old and divorced with 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and yams that she can sell in her community or at the local market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Aifai needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers, new boots, overalls and a new spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Aifai will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, sprayers, new boots, overalls and a new spade

loans.name: Vasa

texts.en: Vasa is 46 years old and married with three children. She has a small farm where she raises pigs that she can sell in her community or to the public. She has been doing this for two years. Vasa needs a loan to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, pig food and a new wooden tub for water. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Vasa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, pig food and a new wooden tub for water.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 47 years old and single with two children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. Rita has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter.

loans.name: Faagase

texts.en: Faagase is a 48 year old unmarried woman with 2 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Faagase needs a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, coffee, a new boiler, a frying pan, paper plates and rubber gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faagase has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, coffee, a new boiler, a frying pan, paper plates and rubber gloves

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 20 years old and single with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Rachel needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, new gum boots, new overalls, a tiller and crops. She just joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Rachel will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, new gum boots, new overalls, a tiller and crops

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jocelyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is 33 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es:
Nubia, a sus 53 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. 

Ser madre de dos hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, comenzó a comercializar productos a través de catalogo como ropa, productos de belleza y artículos para el hogar, de muy buena calidad, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará mercancía como cosméticos al por mayor, así podrá mejorar su ventas.

Nubia manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de productos cosméticos y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
53-year old Nubia is a charismatic, active, and obliging woman. She is mother to two children who were the reason why she worked so hard day after day, looking for different ways to earn a living and put food on the table. About five years ago she started selling merchandise from a catalog, items such as good-quality clothing, beauty products, and housewares. She became well-known in the area and managed to start a career.

As a result Nubia is keen to seek help by applying for a loan and have a wider inventory. She plans to buy cosmetics in bulk and thus increase sales. She says that her age is not stopping her from doing what she loves. She is always setting herself new goals: among them becoming a big distributor of cosmetics and thus providing work opportunities for others. Then she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics in bulk to increase her inventory, increase sales, and improve her standard of living

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Iris works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Iris is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Iris has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: G.s San Jose De Oropoli Group

texts.es:
El señor Rafael se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de golosinas,  cuenta con 5 años de experiencia su negocio le ayuda  a salir adelante, junto con su familia,  contribuyendo al bienestar familiar.
Don Rafael su negocio lo atiende de manera domiciliar, sus principales clientes son personas que viven en su municipio de Oropoli, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de refrescos, aceite, gas, repollo, yuca, carnes, plátano, etc.
Don Rafael  sueña con surtir su y que este sea uno de los más grandes de su comunidad  está solicitando el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes persona.
Doña María su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de cosméticos, cuenta con 2 años de experiencia.
Don Denys tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas,  cuenta con 19 años de experiencia. 

Danlí, Honduras - Julio 2014
texts.en:
Rafael is a merchant. His main activity is selling candies. He has 5 years' experience. His business helps him get ahead with his family, contributing to the family's well being. Rafael's business is residential. His main customers are people who live in his town of Oropoli. He is asking for the loan to buy beverages, oil, natural gas, cabbage, yucca, meat, plantains, etc. 

Rafael's dream is to stock his store and for it to be one of the biggest ones in his community. He is asking for the loan in a group with the following people: 
María, whose main source of income is from her cosmetic selling business that she has been doing for 2 years, and Denys, who has a metallic structures workshop. He has 19 years' experience.  

Danlí, Honduras - July, 2014

loans.use: to buy beverages, oil, natural gas, cabbage, yucca, meat, plantains, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Dairon Andres

texts.es:
Dairon es un hombre con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de repuestos para carros y motos como adhesivos, adornos y elementos mecánicos, con este negocio podría obtener ingresos para poder mantener y sostener a su madre (Ver Foto).

Es un joven muy aplicado pues estudia y tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una vitrina, estantería y compra de inventario en productos mecánicos y decorativos para automóviles y motos..

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su madre todo lo que necesite, además de poder pagar sus estudios y progresar.

Apoya el proyecto de un joven emprendedor Colombiano!
texts.en:
Dairon is a man who uses all his energy and positive attitude to face the world and overcome any problems. He wishes to start a business selling spare parts for cars and engines, such as glue, decorative items, and mechanical parts. With the income from his business he will be able to look after and support his mother (see photo).

This hardworking young man still attends classes as he wishes to get ahead and get a good job. He is seeking a loan to buy a display cabinet, shelving, and merchandise such as mechanical parts and decorative items for cars and engines.

With the loan Dairon will achieve his dream of being independent and providing his mother with all that she needs, as well as paying for his classes and getting ahead in life.

Please help this enterprising young Colombian!

loans.use: Buy a display cabinet, shelving and vehicle spare parts so he can start his own business and support his mother

loans.name: Sari Rahayu Group

texts.en:
After a six-month loan period, Ni Made and the Sari Rahayu group managed to pay off the past loan without any problems. From the sale of four pigs, Ni Made managed a profit of 250,000 IDR per month. This result is far from the previous expectation where Ni Made was hoping to take advantage of 400,000 IDR per month. High feed prices and disease were the main factors that caused a drop in her profit making, but it did not dampen the spirit of Ni Made to run the business. She along with other members of the group will return to borrow capital to shore up their businesses. Ni Made has great hope for the future to benefit her greater, so as to assist her to improve the welfare of her family.

As a housewife who lives in the village, Ni Made is highly classified to pursue the pigs. In order to help her husband, who works as a laborer and to finance her children, Ni Made went back to MUK to borrow 3,000,000 IDR for her capital. Together with Sari Rahayu group, Ni Made plans to use this loan to buy four fattening piglets each 400,000 IDR to maintain for six months and she will use the rest for feed. Ni Made expects the price of pig’s feed to go down in the next six months, so that the benefits will be more than the previous period. The profits will be used to finance her children's schools fees and of course to raise the capital of pigs business.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed and piglets.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este grupo decidieron identificarse con el nombre La Esperanza porque cuando iniciaron su préstamo en VisionFund México no tenían ningún otro crédito en alguna en otra financiera y para ellas representaba la esperanza de sacar adelante sus y con ello, sus mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
Lucía es una de las integrantes, tiene 73 años de edad y está casada con el señor Teófilo, juntos formaron una familia con 10 hijos quienes ya son independientes. Algunos hijos de Doña Lucy, como le dicen de cariño, estudiaron enfermería o pedagogía, y como ella comenta: “eso no habría sido posible sin mi tiendita”. Lucy comparte que su esposo era comerciante de productos de plástico en los tianguis y lamentablemente el negocio fue decayendo, pero fue precisamente esa situación la que los impulsó a abrir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. El inicio fue complicado pues no tenían cantidad suficiente para invertir y vendieron todo el maíz que habían sembrado para su propio consumo. De esta manera pudieron comprar algunos litros de leche, refrescos, productos enlatados, etc. Actualmente, la pareja ya no tiene que vender más su maíz para reinvertir en el negocio, ahora con el préstamo de Kiva y VisionFund México pueden comprar sin ninguna dificultad. Es por esa razón que doña Lucy se muestra muy contenta y agradecida pues ha visto la evolución de su negocio.
A pesar de su edad y de que sus hijos ya son auto suficientes, Lucy aún quiere mantener su negocio y le encantaría que alguien de su familia de continuidad a lo que ella y su esposo comenzaron además de que sabe que la gente de su comunidad seguirá requiriendo el servicio. 
Las integrantes del grupo son Eugenia que tiene un taller de costura, Sara se dedica a la cría y engorda de borregos, Verónica se dedica a la cría y engorda de conejos.
texts.en:
The members of this group decided to call themselves La Esperanza [Hope], because when they started their loan with VisionFund México, they didn't have any other loans from other financial institutions, and it represented hope to get ahead and improve their families' quality of life.   

Lucía is one of the members. She is 73 years' old and married to Teófilo. Together they have a family of 10 children who are on their own. Some of Doña Lucy's children, as she is affectionately called, studied nursing or teaching. As she says: “it wouldn't have been possible without my little store." Lucy shares that her husband was a plastic products merchant  in the open air markets and unfortunately the business declined. It was precisely that that drove her to open her general store. At first it was complicated because they didn't have enough to invest and they sold all the corn they had grown for their own consumption. That was how they were able to buy some liters of milk, and beverages, canned products, etc. Now the couple doesn't have to sell their own corn anymore to reinvest in the business. With the Kiva and VisionFund México loan they can buy with no difficulties. That is why Lucy looks so happy and grateful, because she has seen how her business has evolved.  

Despite her age and the fact that her children are self sufficient, Lucy still wants to maintain her business and she would love for a family member to continue on with what she and her husband started. She also knows that the people in her community will keep needing the service.
 
The members of the group are Eugenia, who has a sewing shop, Sara, who raises and fattens sheep, and Verónica, who raises and fattens rabbits.

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs, sugar, beverages, etc.

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La señora Lucia, es una persona sencilla, mayor de edad de estado civil casada, por diversas circunstancias dsolo llego a estudiar  hasta el nivel primario, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos, ambos se dedican a la agricultura, su casa es de construcción rustica ubicada en la provincia Tiraque del departamento de Cochabamba. Tiene dos hijos pequeños que asisten a la escuela para tener una mejor educación. Su principal actividad económica es la producción agrícola, los productos que cultiva son papa, arveja en vaina verde, avena en seco, trigo en seco, maíz seco y cebada. Siembra en su propio terreno que compro con mucho esfuerzo. La señora es una persona responsable y trabajadora, para ampliar y mejorar su producción se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un credito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y abono orgánico, para así aumentar sus ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Lucia is a down-to-earth person.  She is married, and due to various circumstances she only completed elementary school.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their children.  They both work in agriculture.  Her house is made of rustic materials, and it is located in the Tiraque province in the Cochabamba department.  She has two small children who go to school in order to have a better education.

Her main business activity is agricultural production.  The products that she grows are potatoes, green pea pods, oats, wheat, corn, and barley.  She plants on her own land, which she bought with great effort.  She is a responsible and hard-working person.

In order to expand and improve her production, she sees the need to request a loan to buy agricultural supplies and organic fertilizer.  This way she will increase her income, which will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: José de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos una niña de 3 años y dos varones de 10 y 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre tenaz que desde hace 10 años se gana la vida como albañil, actividad que le ha permitido dar solidez económica a su familia. José desea cambiar el techo y encementar el piso de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, cemento, grava, lámina galvanizada y madera para cambiar el techo y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, age 36, lives in his own house with his life partner and their three children.  They have a three year old daughter and two boys, ages ten and five.  He is a tenacious man who has earned a living as a bricklayer for ten years.  This business activity has allowed him to provide his family with sound finances.

José wishes to change the roof and put down a cement floor in his house.  That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sand, cement, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting and wood in order to change the roof and cement the floor of his house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting and wood in order to change the roof and cement the floor of his house.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Del Algodonal Group

texts.es: RODOLFO, INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO " LOS GIRASOLES DEL ALGODONAL" ES UN HOMBRE TRABAJADOR Y MUY EMPRENDEDOR DE 52 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADO Y TIENE DOS HIJOS AUN  MENORES DE EDAD, CUENTA CON LA AYUDA DE SUS FAMILIA EN SU NEGOCIO PROPIO DE OLLAS, SARTENES,PLATOS Y ACCESORIOS. DE USO DOMESTICO AL CUAL APRENDIÓ POR SU PROPIA CUENTA Y ESTA MUY ORGULLOSO DE SU TRABAJO DESDE HACE 20 AÑOS, SOLICITO EL PRÉSTAMO PARA COMPRAR OLLAS AL POR MAYOR Y VENDERLO A SU PRINCIPALES CLIENTES Y PUBLICO EN GENERAL, SE SIENTE MUY AGRADECIDO CON LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA POR EL APOYO, ENVÍA SALUDOS CORDIALES Y PIDE SEGUIR AYUDANDO AL MICRO EMPRESARIO.
texts.en: Rodolfo, a member of the "Los Girasoles del Algodonal" group, is a hard-working and very enterprising 52-year-old man, who is married and has two children who are still minors. He has the help of his family in his own business of pots, frying pans, plates and accessories for household use, which he learned on his own, and he is very proud of his work for the past 20 years. He asks for a loan to purchase pots in bulk and sell them to his primary customers and the general public. He is very grateful to the Kiva investors for their support, he sends cordial greetings and asks that they continue supporting the small businessman.

loans.use: to purchase pots, frying pans, plates, and accessories.

loans.name: Grupo M (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del Grupo M viven en una comunidad muy tranquila donde aún se conserva su lengua materna, los habitantes son personas sencillas y las fiestas de la comunidad están llenas de alegría y atención a los invitados.
Los integrantes han solicitado ya dos préstamos a VisionFund México, los cuales han sido de gran ayuda para seguir impulsando sus negocios. Por ejemplo, Juan y Alejandra utilizarán su crédito para seguir criando borregos y mientras que Alicia y Elvia, lo invertirán en los cerditos que crían. 
Elvia tiene 28 años de edad y vive en unión libre con Jesús desde hace 11 años y juntos han formado una familia con tres niños que actualmente están estudiando. Elvia está solicitando un préstamo para comprar más cerditos y alimento. Comenta que inició la actividad después de ver que su suegra obtenía buenas ganancias tan sólo cuidando bien de los lechones. Elvia no tuvo ningún problema en adaptarse a las tareas y responsabilidades de cuidar a los cerditos: los alimenta tres veces al día y los mantiene en un corral. Cuando vende los animales, Elvia utiliza el dinero inmediatamente para solventar los gastos de educación de sus hijos. 
Elvia tiene el sueño de tener una casa propia para sus niños y su esposo, es por eso que no pretende abandonar su actividad.
texts.en:
The members of Group M live in a very quiet community where they still maintain their native language; the residents are simple people and the community festivals are full of happiness and attention to the guests.

The members have already asked for two loans from VisionFund México, which have been a great help to continue giving boosts to their businesses. For example, Juan and Alejandra will use their loan to continue raising sheep, while Alicia and Elvia will invest it in the pigs they raise.

Elvia is 28 years old and has lived in a common-law marriage with Jesús for the past 11 years and together they form a family with three children who are currently students. Elvia is asking for a loan to buy more pigs and feed.  She says that she began the work after seeing that her mother-in-law earned a good income just by taking good care of the piglets. She didn't have any problems getting used to the tasks and responsibilities of caring for the pigs. She feeds them three times daily and keeps them in a corral.  When she sells the animals, she immediately uses the money to pay off her children's school expenses.

Elvia has a dream of having her own house for her children and her husband, and for this reason she doesn't think of giving up the work.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 60 años de edad, vive en el caserio Yapana que pertenece al distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población es tranquila, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, esta comunidad está ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, realizando esta actividad desde hace 13 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de una destiladora a motor y asi moler más y lograr destilar mayor cantidad de aguardiente y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y asi también poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, age 60, lives in the Yapana village in the Callayuc district.  The community has a warm climate, and the people are serene.  They devote themselves to agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  This community is in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Juan distills ‘aguardiente’ [an alcoholic beverage].  He has been engaged in this business activity for 13 years.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 soles to buy a motorized distiller.  This way he will mill more and manage to distill a greater quantity of aquardiente.  This way he will generate greater income, increase his profits, and also be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorized distiller.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 3 años se viene dedicando a la venta de mercancía como peluches, juguetería y ropa de manera ambulante en el municipio de San Vicente con el afán de obtener ingresos para sostener a sus tres hijos y darles una educación de calidad.

Siempre prefirió ser independiente y obtener sus propios ingresos, es por eso que tuvo el valor de enfrentarse al mundo y comenzar con sus ventas.
