Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de mercancía como juguetería y ropa para abastecer su negocio, además necesita una maleta grande para poder transportar sus productos hasta sus clientes, así podrá mejorar su negocio y podrá trabajar cómodamente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Martha is a very enterprising woman with great desire to get ahead and progress.

For the past 3 years, she has worked selling merchandise such as dolls, toys, and clothing as a street vendor in the municipality of San Vincente with the goal of having income to support her three children and give them a quality education. 

She always preferred to be independent and earn her own income, and for this reason she had the courage to confront the world and begin with her sales.

She asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of merchandise such as toys and clothing to stock her business; in addition she needs a large backpack to be able to carry her products to her customers and, in turn, she will be able to improve her business and work comfortably. She has hopes of being able to get ahead thanks to the support of the good-hearted people who support this type of project.

loans.use: To purchase a backpack, an assortment of toys and clothing to expand her inventory and get her children ahead.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

Julia requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional tools and spare parts for her business. She has been in this business for 21 years now. Julia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and spare parts for her business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients needed like meat, vegetables, etc. Lolita has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed like meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Lourdisita

texts.en:
Lourdisita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lourdisita has been in this business for 40 years. She earns more income from vegetable vending.

Lourdisita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Luzviminda requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like seasonings, meat, hotdogs, etc., for her food vending business. She has been in this business for 1 year now.

Luzviminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like seasonings, meat, hotdogs, etc., for her food vending business

loans.name: Jam

texts.en:
Meet Jam. Jam lives by himself in Cilegon, a major coastal industrial city located about three hours from Jakarta. Jam is a single yet he is planning to marry in the near future. 

Jam runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone airtime credits, also serves drinking water refills for his customers. He began working with Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. 

In the photo, Jam is standing beside the drinking water refill depot in his small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for four years now.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is 63 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Aniceta has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer casada, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace 4 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00.  

Alba sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco y ha intentado mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is a married woman. She is a person who works hard and is very responsible. She acquired sales experience while working with her family in several businesses.

Four years ago, she opened her own business: a grocery store. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00.

Alba dreams of having a supermarket in the future. For the moment, with the loan she has requested, she wishes to buy a wide assortment of products in bulk such as vegetables, grains, fruits, and the like in order to provide her customers with excellent quality products.

With this business, she has been able to get ahead little by little and has tried to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of goods such as vegetables and grains, among others, to stock up her store and give her business a successful boost.

loans.name: Leidi Exelsa

texts.es:
Leidi es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 29 años de edad, madre responsable de 1 hijo de 10 años y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 8 años comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros de la universidad, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.


El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues se le presentó la oportunidad de abrir un local comercial para vender su mercancía, por lo que invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor como papelería, útiles escolares adornos, productos de belleza, entre otros.

Con este crédito podrá consolidar su negocio y podrá mejorar su nivel de ventas ya que tendrá mucho más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Leidi tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su hijo.
texts.en:
Leidi is an enterprising and dynamic young woman, 29 years old.  She is the responsible mother of a 10-year-old son and an independent businesswoman, since 8 years ago she began to sell merchandise to her family, friends and university classmates, with the goal to generate income to support the household economy and pay for her schooling.

The loan that she requests is a support to strengthen her business, since an opportunity to open a retail location to sell her merchandise presented itself, so she will invest the money in the purchase of an assortment of products in bulk, such as paper goods, school supplies, decorations, and beauty products, among others. 

With this loan, she will be able to consolidate her business and increase the level of sales since she will have many more products to offer her customers.

Leidi has a strong goal to get ahead with her productive project, since she wants to become a successful businesswoman and guarantee her son a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of paper goods and school supplies for her business and, so, to be able to offer her son a better quality of life.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 24 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Joyce has been in this business for three years. 

In the future Joyce would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El señor Ramiro de 42 años de edad está casado con Daily y tiene tres hijas en edad escolar, él y su familia viven en el departamento de Potosí, estudió hasta el bachillerato y trabaja en una unidad de la gobernación.  Con mucho trabajo  y a través de los años ha logrado ahorrar y comprar su terreno para construir poco a poco su casa y así darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, actualmente está en la etapa de conclusión de su casa pero como no tiene muchos recursos económicos, solicita un crédito para terminar la construcción de su vivienda con detalles de la obra fina.
texts.en: Ramiro, 42 years old, is married to Daily and has three school-aged daughters. He and his family live in the department of Potosí. He completed his secondary education and works in a government agency. With a lot of work and over the years, he has managed to save and purchase a plot of land to build his house little by little, and in this way provide his family with better living conditions. Currently he is in the final stages of his house but, as he doesn't have many resources, he asks for a loan to finish the construction of the house with the fine details.

loans.use: to build a home for himself, his wife, and three children

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 31 years old and a married woman with two dependent children who are enrolled in a local school. She lives in a small village in Pursat Province, Cambodia.

For the last fourteen years, she and her husband have managed a rice farming business which is the sole source of their income. They grow rice and sell the crop to the local dealers. The farmland is located near their house.

Srey wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its equipment. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es: Luis de 21 años de edad vive con su madre y su hijo de 1 año de edad. Él es un joven tenaz que desde hace 2 años se gana la vida como  ayudante de albañil, lo que le permite ayudar económicamente a su madre y sacar adelante a su hijo. Luis desea construir un muro de contención en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, hierro y pagar mano de obra necesaria para la construcción de un muro de contención en su propiedad y poder así proteger su vivienda y familia.
texts.en: Luis, 21 years old, lives with his mother and his 1-year-old son. He is a tenacious young man who, for the past 2 years, has earned a living as a construction assistant, which allows him to help his mother economically and to get his son ahead. Luis wants to construct a retaining wall for his house, so he asks for a loan from FUSAI to purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, and to pay the necessary labor costs to build the retaining wall on his property and, in turn, be able to protect his house and his family.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, and to pay the labor costs of building a retaining wall for his house.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y los 2 hijos que han procreado una niña de 2 años y un varón de 7 años de edad. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se gana la vida como empleada de un restaurante, además su esposo también trabaja en el restaurante. Rosa desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, además quiere reparar las paredes de su vivienda, porque se les filtra el agua. Por lo anterior Rosa solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, lámina, polines y pines para realizar el cambio de techo a su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa, 23 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their 2 children, a girl who is 2 years old, and a 7-year-old boy. She is an enterprising young woman who earns her living as an employee in a restaurant. In addition, her husband also works in the restaurant. Rosa wants to replace the roof on her house, in addition she wants to repair the walls of her house, since they let water in. For this reason, Rosa asks for a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, metal sheeting, purlins, and pins to replace the roof on her house.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, metal sheeting, purlins, and pins to replace the roof and repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and widowed with four children. Teresita works very hard to provide for the children.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, etc. 

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marites has been in this business for seven years now.

Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Anabel has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Anabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines.

Vicenta requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell.

Vicenta has been in this business for five years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI  2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MENA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le mais  avec FATOUMATA MOUSSA 1ère personne à droite sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 130 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women. On average, they are 41 years old and have two children. They all live in polygamous families in Mena, in Kolondieba Cercle, a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali. 

They work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their activities through the rainy season. This is their ninth loan with the institution and their previous loans have been repaid. 

They grow rice, peanuts, and corn with Fatoumata, who is standing at right in the photo. With her loan, she plans on paying for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for two hectares of land. After the harvest, they sell their crops to a clientele of men and women. She would like to earn 130,000 FCFA that will allow her to pay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for the farming season.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis, de 27 años, inicio con un negocio de mantenimiento de piscinas hace aproximadamente 8 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento en nació su hijo, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día su hijo tiene 4 años y se ha convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como cloro, ácidos, redes y otros elementos que le permitan mantener su servicio disponible y poder llevar el sustento para su hogar.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener  a su hijo y a su esposa brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Luis para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Luis, 27 years old, began a business in swimming pool maintenance 8 years ago, eager to find work that would provide him income to survive.  When Luis' son was born, he became motivated to work tirelessly to give him the best in life and education.  Today his son is 4 years old and has become the joy of this hard-working man's life.

Luis is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as chlorine, chemicals, nets and other tools to keep his services available and be able to support his household.  With this loan he can support his son and his wife, providing them a higher standard of living.  Support Luis so that he can continue with his work!

loans.use: to buy supplies such as chlorine, chemicals, nets, etc., to continue providing services and supporting his family

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Bernadeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Bernadeth is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Bernadeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Nyaung Pin Thar Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Magway township, this community currently has 35 village customers, including 4 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. In this village, about 90% of households own bulls that help on the farm with planting and harvesting. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist, so must invest in cultural ceremonies and provisions to monks.  They also struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

The new loan would help this community raise livestock, especially cows and pigs, which generate extra income.  Additionally, manure from the animals can be used as a natural fertilizer, thereby enriching plants without forcing farmers to spend money on expensive chemical fertilizers.  In addition to this farming and livestock raising, villagers generate income by tapping sugar from palm trees and working as road construction workers in other cities.

Pictured above are the committee members from the Nyaung Pin Thar Village CBO: U Win, U Than, U Kyi, and Daw San. Included in the photo (second from the left) is U Win, who is 41 years old.  His main businesses are farming, construction, and making teak furniture. He purchased fertilizer with his past loan and is saving money to purchase a bull, which will cost  about $600, with his next loan.

loans.use: to help 35 villagers raise livestock that will help with planting and harvesting

loans.name: Yoeng's Group

texts.en:
Yoeng is 63 years old, living with her husband and eight children in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district. Rice farming and grocery selling are the only main sources for her family’s income and she has been in these businesses for 38 years. The current business earns her family an income of about 20 USD per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Yoeng with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She will use her portion of the loan to spend on a solar panel for lighting her house. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To spend on a solar panel for lighting her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak (in photo), age 33, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has been married since 2010 and just has one young daughter. She also has her mother living with her.     

Sopheak and her husband are garment factory workers. Sopheak has some money that she plans to use to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work. Hence she decided to apply for a loan in order to add it to her own money and make the purchase.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 47 years old and married with six children.  

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Angelisa

texts.en:
Angelisa is 34 years old and married with two children who are in school, Angelisa  works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, soap, shampoo, etc.

Angelisa  has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 63 years old and widowed with seven children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Felipa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Felipa has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Jean Caryl

texts.en:
Jean Caryl is 26 years old and married with one child. 

Jean Caryl is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jean Caryl has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jean Caryl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 52 years old and married with seven children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cereals, soft drinks, beers, coffee, sugar, detergent soap and other groceries to sell.

Lilia has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Lilia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like cereals, soft drinks, beers, coffee, sugar, detergent soap and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Yone Taw Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Myothit township, this community currently has 41 village customers, including 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. Interestingly, there is a community foundation to support education, health, and social welfare for villagers. The whole village is very active in celebrating Buddhist cultural ceremonies and regularly offer provisions to monks, both of which are significant household expenses.

The new loan will help this village pay for laborers who will help with weeding and harvesting crops. Their crops, such as sesame and groundnuts, have been cultivated since April for this season. Thus, harvest is coming very soon, when the need for laborers will be high. An average of 80 laborers are needed to harvest and weed one acre. These laborers each charge $5 a day. Given that most young people have migrated to the cities in search of economic opportunities, farmers have to hire laborers from nearby villages when there is a shortage locally.  The extra income from crop sales will be contributed to other village developments. For instance, they are planning to build a brick tank to store water to protect the village against summer wildfires.

Pictured above are the committee members from the Yone Taw Village CBO: U Kyaw, U Myint, U Soe, U Than, and U Myo. Included in the photo (second from the left) is U Kyaw, who is 36 years old and the father of two children. His main businesses are farming and selling groceries at home. He plans to hire labor with his new loan.

loans.use: to help 41 villagers in Yone Taw Community to pay for labor fees to harvest and weed

loans.name: Iris Elizenda

texts.es: Iris de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y los 3 hijos que han procreado, un varón de 18 años de edad y 2 niñas de 16 y 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida como cocinera de un restaurante desde hace 10 años. Iris desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía este se encuentra bastante dañado, es por ello, que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada y madera para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Iris is 43 years old. She lives in a house that she owns, along with her husband and their three children. She has an 18-year-old son, and two daughters ages 16 and 10. Iris is a hardworking woman that has earned a living cooking in a restaurant for the last 10 years. 

Iris wants to replace the roof of her home because, as you can see from the photo, the current one is very damaged. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood to replace the roof of her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La señora Celia, vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente, trabajadora y responsable; se dedica al comercio de verduras, vende cebolla seca y verde, tomate, zanahoria, locoto, vaina, achojcha  y toda clase de verduras. Tiene un puesto de venta fijo en el mercado. La señora Celia tiene experiencia y una antiguedad de 30 años en su actividad, por lo tanto tiene mucho conocimiento en el manejo y administración de su negocio, actualmente requiere el crédito para la compra de mercaderia (verduras), de esta forma incrementará sus ventas y tendrá más utilidades que mejorará su nivel de vida y su situación social.
texts.en:
Celia lives and works in Colomi. She is financially independent, hardworking, and responsable. Celia makes a living selling dried onion, green onion, tomatoes, carrots, peppers, peas, locoto, vaina, and all kinds of other vegetables. She has a fixed spot from which to sell her vegetables at the local market. 

Celia has much experience and seniority with 30 years dedicated to this trade. She knows very much about business management and how to operate her business. Currently, she is in need of a loan to buy more merchandise (vegetables). This way, she will increase her sales and earnings so that she can improve her quality of life and social situation.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of delicious vegetables for her diverse vegetable stand

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 31 years old and has three children. Ludivina is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Ludivina is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Ludivina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ludivina has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fairoh

texts.en:
Meet Fairoh. Fairoh is a mother of five who lives in Cilegon, a major coastal industrial city located about three hours from Jakarta. Fairoh and her husband manage a local grocery shop together that sells many types of daily-consumption products.  She began working with Ruma six months ago because she wanted to expand her business and started out selling mobile phone airtime credits not long after. 

Fairoh and her husband are very excited about the new business, and they also now have become more aware of how mobile technology can support their business. As the business continues to grow, Fairoh hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends, which is when people mostly buy mobile airtime. In the photo, Fairoh is standing in front of her grocery shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transaction on weekends

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es: Alfredo de 46 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad desde hace 4 años. Alfredo desea construir una galera en el terreno que se observa en la fotografía, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, cemento, grava, madera y lámina para construir una galera en su terreno.
texts.en: Alfredo, 46 years old, lives in a house that he owns, along with his family. He is a hardworking man who has made a living working as a security guard for the last 4 years. Alfredo wants to build a galera (covered structure), as shown in the photo. This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sand, cement, gravel, wood, and metal to build a galera on his land.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, wood, and metal to build a galera (covered structure).

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Alona works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Alona is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Victoria has been in this business for 12 years now.

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Vilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Vilma has been in this business for three years. Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosalina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and a general store. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stcks of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 38 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Jenny is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenny has been pig fattening for 1 year and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and pre-paid mobile cards.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Bernard.  He is married and has 2 children aged 23 and 7 years. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him for schooling.

In 2008, Bernard established his pharmacy business. He began his business because he wanted to help with the smooth running of his home. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are people in the general community. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Bernard requires a loan in order to buy more drugs, cosmetics, etc., for resale. He hopes that this loan will help his business to grow through proper use.

In the future, Bernard plans to build a hospital, a house and to give a quality education to his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale

loans.name: Rhuhekekuguma Group

texts.fr: La cliente Atosha est conseillère au sein du groupe de crédit Rhuhekekuguma. Mariée à un agent de l'Administration. Elle est âgée de 57 ans et mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle exerce ses activités commerciales (vente des bidons vides et brassereaux) dans la rue depuis si peu. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour acheter  50 bidons vide et 20 brasereaux. Elle souhaite aller de l’avant dans ses activités et ainsi, remercie Hekima pour toutes les actions de crédit en faveur des femmes rurales.
texts.en: Atosha is an advisor with the Rhuhekekuguma Group. Married to an officer working as an agent in public service, she is a 57-year-old mother to six children, who have all received an education. She has only recently begun her street commerce activities (selling empty bottles and braziers). She is requesting a new loan in order to purchase 50 empty containers and 20 braziers. She hopes to be able to advance her business and would like to thank Hekima for the work they do with women in rural areas.

loans.use: to purchase 50 empty containers and 20 braziers

loans.name: Cinamula Group

texts.fr: Madame Nepanepa est trésorière du groupe de crédit Cinamula /Kavumu à l’âge de 52 ans. Mariée à conducteur des motos (motard), elle est mère de 7enfants tous empruntant le chemin de l’école. Elle est vendeuse ambulante des poissons depuis 2005. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 3 bassins de poissons frais en vue d’agrandir son entreprise et au fil de temps louer une table au marché. Elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes rurales.
texts.en:
Nepanepa is the treasurer of the Cinamula group in Kavumu. She is 52 years old, married to a driver, and a mother of seven children, who are all in school. 

Nepanepa has been traveling around selling fish since 2005. She is seeking a loan to buy three baskets of fresh fish in order to expand her business and, in time, rent a table at the market.

She thanks Hekima for their support of rural women.

loans.use: to buy three baskets of fresh fish

loans.name: Mot

texts.en:
Mot is aged 31 and the mother of two children who are in school. She earns a living rice farming as the main source of income which she has done for several years. 

This is not the first loan for Mot with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and now her living condition is better than before. 

Now, she wants to focus on her child’s education. Therefore, her new loan request for an education loan to cover the school fees for her child, who wants to pursue a short training course in English. 

She hopes that her children can pursue their academic skills until tertiary level.

loans.use: To cover the school fees for her child, who wants to pursue a short training course in English.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Juan monto un negocio de comidas rápidas en un local ubicado al frente de su casa en el municipio de Bello.

Decidió iniciar con este negocio para así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 

Siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y es por eso que siempre pone todo su empeño para sacar adelante su negocio.

Pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos para sus preparaciones como panes, salchichas, queso, entre otros, para poder solidificar su negocio y mejorar su producción de comidas.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a su familia por medio de su negocio y podrá darles a sus hijos una buena educación.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
With the dream of getting ahead and overcoming obstacles, Juan started his business selling ready-made foods in a location just in front of his house in the municipality of Bello. Juan decided to open this business in order to earn money necessary to take care of his household. He has always liked being independent. For this reason, he always gives his all to help his business succeed.

Juan is asking for some financial support that will help him to buy ingredients for his foods such as breads, sausages, cheese, etc. to stock his business and improve his food production. With this loan, Juan will be able to provide for his family through his business and he will be able to pay for a good education for his children. 

With the help this loan gives, you will be propelling the entrepreneurial ideas of a Colombian mother!

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as breads, sausages, cheese, etc. to stock his business and provide his children with an education.

loans.name: Chariya’S Group

texts.en:
Chariya was selected to be a group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are two members, Chariya and Sechka, who live in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chariya, age 21, raises cow at home. She has been married since 2012 and has one young son. Her husband is a wooden house constructor. She plans to fill in the land around of house which would make it easier for her family to live because there are small ponds.

Chariya is on the right, Sechka is on the left.

loans.use: To fill in the land around her house.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJANTOYERELA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fala Koulikoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de condiments. 
Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leur  vingt sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente Mamine, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter du poisson fumé, de l’oignon, du cube Maggi, de la chou fleur et du poivron chez les grossistes à Dioïla. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Group Djantoyerela is composed of married women; they are on average 45 years old with six children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Fala Koulikoro, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through their families, neighbors, and friends. They retail cereals and condiments. This is the twenty-sixth solidarity loan for the women of group Djantoyerela. To meet the huge demand from their client, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.

Mamine, the first customer standing from right to left, is illiterate. She currently sells sauces. She is planning to purchase smoked fish, onions, Maggi bouillon cubes, cauliflowers, and peppers, all from wholesalers in Dioïla.

She retails at the market, and takes cash from her mixed-gender clientele. She is forecasting a monthly profit of 60,000 XOF, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dembagnouma est composé équitablement de femmes monogames et  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 46ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, de médicaments traditionnels, de biscuits et de calebasses. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits des enfants de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60 complets d’habits à  Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle majoritairement  composée de femmes. Madame Awa  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de subvenir aux besoins de la famille dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Dembagnouma Group is evenly divided between monogamous and polygamous women. They have an average age of 46 and eight children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, in the commune of Mande, in the area of Kati. They met via neighborhood ties. The group members run small businesses, selling clothing, traditional medicine, cookies and gourds. To increase their working capital, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan. Ms. Awa (the woman sitting at the far left of the photo) is a major seller of top-quality children's clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy 60 complete outfits of clothing in Bamako. The resale takes place in Kanadjiguila to a clientele of mostly women. Ms. Awa hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA that will be reinvested in her business. Her goal is to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nyirabarame

texts.en: Nyirabarame is married and her husband is a businessman. She has been running a business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more wood that works as firewood. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and purchase clothes for herself.

loans.use: To buy more wood and timber for resale

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo and paints and to pay for laborers' salaries for her furniture making business.

Delia has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo and paints and to pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Vadamalli Shg-Mathur Group

texts.en:
Vadamalli Self-Help Group is managed by the NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu. This group consists of ten members from Mathur village in Tamil Nadu. 

Fransishmary (holding a board with the SHG name) is the leader of group. She lives with her family in her own house; she has two children. Her husband is a mason by profession. 

Fransishmary, along with the other group members, needs a loan to purchase a smokeless stove. It is durable, handy, and easy to use and sustainable. It emits less smoke, which reduces the risk of respiratory diseases. The traditional mud stove emits more carbon dioxide, due to which children are affected the most, leading to asthma, bronchitis, etc.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: M. Ashraf

texts.en:
M. Ashraf is a 40-year-old man living in Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a small crockery store in which he sells utensils and crockery items, such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldrons and buckets. 
He is a father of five children and is the sole responsible person who feeds them. He has only one source of income; he has to afford the expenses of utility bills and household expenses alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark according to the living standard.
He wants to buy more inventory for resale because most of his female customers purchase utensils in large quantities to arrange dowry. The marriage season is about to start; for this purpose, more inventory is required to cope with the sudden increase in demand.
M. Ashraf has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, brac Pakistan, so that he can buy utensils and crockery items and generate more income.
He is very thankful to  Kiva’s field partner, brac Pakistan, because they showed him a beam of hope to fulfill his desires.

loans.use: To buy utensils and crockery items.

loans.name: M. Zahid

texts.en:
M.Zahid is 35 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He has run a general store for the last five years near his house, and the business is operating very well. In this way he feeds his aged parents and sibling. He is a responsible father of two sons and a daughter.
He established his general store with the help of previous loan from brac. His general store is situated in a populated area, and there are a lot of customers available here to buy miscellaneous general store items. He wants to offer all those products that are necessary and consumable for daily usage. He wants to increase his business by purchasing more stock of general store items. He also wants to offer stationery items, such as copies, pens, lead pencils, erasers, etc. But the major problem is the shortage of funds. 
Therefore, M.Zahid requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, brac Pakistan, so that he could buy the sacks of rice, sugar, flour and additional general store items. He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.
M.Zahid is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, brac Pakistan, and he assures that he will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: To buy more stock, such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, and stationery items for his general store

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 26-year-old married woman and mother. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shamim has requested a loan to help her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shamim is hoping that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his services.

loans.use: to buy new tires for repairing her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Siswanto

texts.en:
Meet Siswanto. Siswanto is married and he lives in the family home in Cilegon, a major coastal industrial city located about 3 hours from Jakarta. 

Siswanto manages a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, home appliances and mobile phone airtime credits. His spouse is a full-time housewife. He began working with Ruma a month ago because he wanted to increase his income. Since then, he became more aware of how mobile technology can support his business.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan in order to do more transactions on weekends, which is when people mostly buy mobile airtime. 

In the photo, Siswanto is standing in front of his small stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Al Ngarifah

texts.en: Al Ngarifah is a housewife who lives with her husband and her only child in West Bandung. Al Ngarifah and her husband realize that they have to find ways to support their family's needs. For now, her husband works as a car driver and Al Ngarifah is managing a small stall called a 'warung' that sells authentic local snacks and mobile airtime credits. She started selling mobile airtime credits since she began working with Ruma five months ago. As the business continues, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable her to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help her in running the mobile airtime business and consequently supporting her plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Sri Sarashwathy Shg - Umaiyalpuram Group

texts.en:
Given its abundance, firewood is a common domestic fuel in India, especially in rural households. Anbalagi, the featured borrower, hails from Umaiyalpuram in the Tanjore district in Tamil Nadu. She cooks food using a mud cook stove that runs on firewood. Many women living in her neighborhood are dependent on similar cook stoves and firewood. Unfortunately, these women are putting themselves at the brink of contracting fatal lung diseases such as lung cancer, pneumonia, bronchitis, etc as they inhale a high volume of smoke emanating from burning firewood every day.
Anbalagi has teamed up with five other women to purchase low-smoke cook stoves available in the market and named their group as “Sri Sarashwathy Shg - Umaiyalpuram Group”(holding a board with the SHG name written on it). All these women earn a living with small livelihood activities. Their earnings are not sufficient to purchase the smokeless stoves. So, they wish to borrow a loan to buy low-smoke cook stoves. This loan will help them breathe safer air and have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a low-smoke cook stove

loans.name: Tamilmozhi Shg - Ammanpettai Group

texts.en:
Devisakthi is the leader of the Tamilmozhi Self-Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Ammanpettai village, Tamil Nadu.

Devisakthi and her family live in her own house, and she has two children. Her husband is a driver. The husband and wife both are working very hard to change their standard of living.  

Now Devisakthi wants to purchase a smokeless stove, which will save her time and money. The smokeless stove prevents the risk of getting respiratory diseases from the smoke emitted. Devisakthi and the other members of the group are requesting a loan for a healthier life.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Marikolundhu Shg-Palinganatham Group

texts.en:
Philominal is the leader of the Marikolundhu Self-Help group, which is managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). The group contains five members from the Palinganatham village of Ariyalur in Tamil Nadu, India. She is married; her husband is working in a cement factory. They are the parents of two children.

The group has been receiving loans from PAT for the last three years. These loans have been instrumental in developing the quality of their livelihood, as well as in purchasing cows, goats, etc. Because of these loans, they have been able to earn more income and are prompt in their repayments.

With a group loan, the members of the group can buy smokeless stoves that lower firewood consumption. As a result, these stoves reduce carbon emissions as well as indoor air pollution levels. The group is requesting a loan of INR 7,000. By purchasing this stove, group members can reduce fuel consumption, lower costs and help create a better environment in their surrounding village.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Santos Lidubina

texts.es: Santos de 31 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos dos niñas de 12 y 10 años de edad y dos varones de 16 y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos de manera domiciliar en el centro de su municipio, su esposo se gana la vida como jornalero. Santos desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos, 31, lives with her husband and four children, two daughters ages 12 and 10 and two sons ages 16 and 4.  She is a hard-working woman who works as a domestic employee in the center of her municipality.  Her husband earns a living as a day laborer.  

Santos wants to repair the roof of her house and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, wood and nails to carry out the project.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ashara Alok Shg Group

texts.en:
Sukanti is a 34-year-old lady who has four children. She lives in the Koraput district of Odisha, India with her husband and her children. A few years back, she started a business making and selling spices, such as turmeric powder, chili powder, dry mango powder, cardamom powder, cinnamon powder, coriander powder, mixed spices for curry, etc. She makes these powders with the help of grinders. She makes a variety of spices, depending on the demand for spices in the market. 

Sukanti is requesting a loan of 150,000 INR to buy more supplies such as asafoetida, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, black pepper, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. 

She is requesting in a group of ten members, who are all women and all live in the same community. They named their group Ashara Alok Self-Help Group, which is situated in the Koraput district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make spices.

loans.name: Aalefa

texts.en:
Aalefa is a young and energetic woman. She is 31 years old. She hails from the village of Boragari in the district of Jalpaiguri in West Bengal. The village is one of the most remote in the region and lacks basic amenities such as pakka houses (made of concrete and mortar), electricity, etc. But the village is rich in spirit and ideas of its women who want to be someone in life.  

Aalefa is the mother of two little kids who are students. They are in grade 3 and grade 1. Her husband and she both are uneducated and can sign their names only.

Aalefa’s husband Hamidul, aged 33 years, is engaged in paddy cultivation. This village has good agricultural land and access to ponds and rivers, making paddy cultivation possible. They give their hard toil to grow good-quality products to satisfy their customers, and at the same time earn for the family. But, their income is hardly enough just for the food cost of the family. They want to grow their agribusiness, but the main obstacle is capital.

Aalefa has come to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan from them. She will invest this new loan in buying high-yield paddy seeds, fertilizers and manure. She also wishes to increase her total cultivatable area. She hopes through this loan, she will be able to give a better living to her family, provide better education to her children, and at the same time save money for the future to construct a concrete and mortar-made house.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to grow paddy.

loans.name: Ashpia

texts.en:
Ashpia, only 25 years old and married, belongs to Satvendi village in the district of Jalpaiguri in West Bengal.

Agriculture has been a prime source of livelihood in India for close to 60% of the population. India has one of the world’s largest productions of paddy crops in the world. So, Ashpia and her husband are associated with paddy cultivation.

Ashpia’s family comprises her husband, Rajaaul, and her two small sons. One of the children is in grade one, and the other is too young for school. In her childhood she did not have any opportunity for education because of her family's financial stringency. She is illiterate and can sign her name only. Her husband has an elementary education.

Ashpia and her husband work tirelessly on their farmland to grow paddy. They sell their crop locally. They cultivate high-quality paddy, and selling prices are comparatively cheaper, so their customers are increasing gradually. But, the current household income is not sufficient and with the daunting responsibilities that they will face in the future to finance their children's education, it is imperative that she exploits the land for paddy cultivation.

So, in order to generate more income, they have planned to improve their business by cultivating more paddies. Ashpia is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) for her paddy cultivation. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, etc. She expects to reap a good profit through her loan. With her finances in place, she can expect to bring stability to her family.

She wants to give thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Luwin

texts.en: In the year 2010, Luwin signed up his membership and has accessed loans from Paglaum MPC. As a farmer in Sindangan, ZDN he tried his luck and borrowed to start his farm production. After several months he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day Luwin feels he owes much to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. Recently, he availed of another loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Luwin wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply the neighboring towns from his farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en: Maylyn, is aged 38, married to a motorcycle driver and blessed with three children. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her income on this business is usually spent on the school allowances for their children. Due to lack of capital she would like to avail of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат мирная жительница района Варзоб, где она живет с мужем и тремя детьми. Муж рабочий, а дети учатся в школе. У нее хорошая дружная семья. 
Саодат по природе целеустремленная и предприимчивая женщина. В возрасте 39 лет она начинает свой торговый бизнес в сфере продаж продуктов питания. Саодат уже построила помещение для магазина. Теперь для купли продуктов питания она берет кредит, так как у нее осталось мало сбережений. Благодаря кредиту у Саодат будет свой бизнес и источник дохода. Она станет независимой женщиной.
texts.en: Saodat is a peaceful resident of Varzob, where she lives with her husband and three children.  Her husband works and her three children are in school.  She has a good and close family.  Saodat is a goal-oriented and enterprising woman.  At 39 years of age, she is starting her own business selling food products.  She has already set up her own shop and now she is asking for a loan to buy products, as she doesn't have much left in savings.  Thanks to this loan, Saodat will be able to have a source of income for her business and she will become an independent woman.

loans.use: to buy food products to open her new shop.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a banana and sweet potato buy and sell business in Sindangan, ZDN and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up his membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she has availed of another loan to purchase more sweet potatoes and bananas to sell.  Elvie hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy bananas and sweet potatos to resell

loans.name: Viamora

texts.en:
Viamora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell corn business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy sacks of corn to sell for her business.

Viamora has been in this business for 2 years. Viamora earns more income from a buy and sell young coconut business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Viamora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn to sell for her business

loans.name: Bant Bway (North) Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yin Mar Pin township, this community currently has 47 village customers, including 7 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.  Additionally, the land of this village is made up of salty sand, which makes farming and getting access to fresh water difficult. 

This new loan will help borrowers hire labor for the planting and harvesting seasons and purchase high quality farming inputs such as topsoil and fertilizer, which will boost crop yields. This boost in crop yields will lead to an increase in crop sales, and this additional income will be invested in a tractor, which will cost about $2,400.  As farmers cannot currently afford their own tractor, most of the farmers have to lease a machine for $12 a day, plus diesel fees.  Mechanization is especially important in this village, as many young people who would be hired as day laborers are migrated to urban centers in search of economic opportunities.

Pictured above are the committee members from the village CBO: U Win, U Htay, U Thein, U Aung, U Shwe, and U Zaw. Included in the photo (second from the left) is U Htay, who is 52 years old and has seven family members, including three small children who attend primary school in the village. He aspires to use his loan to buy fertilizer and topsoil to enrich his sesame and bean crops.

loans.use: to help 47 villagers pay for farming inputs such as labor, topsoil, and fertilizer

loans.name: Bant Bway South Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yin Mar Pin township, this community currently has 29 village customers, including 8 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area.  This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

These villagers are planning on buying pigs with their loan.  One small pig costs about $50 and it is usually sold at $120, for a $70 profit.  To ensure the health of these pigs, they will also invest in animal feed and vitamins.  Raising livestock is a crucial business for farmers in this village, because it is a more stable income than income from their tomato, millet, sesame and pigeon crops, as harvests are variable depending on the season's rainfall.  Villagers also supplement their incomes by growing limonia trees and making clothes.  

Pictured above are the committee members from the village CBO: U Aung, U Nyo, U Win, U Aung, Daw Khin, U Lin, U Aung, and U Shwe. Included in the photo (first from the left) is U Aung, who is 42-years-old. He purchased two small pigs with his past loan. The new loan would help him to buy animal feed and vitamins to ensure that his pigs are healthy and grow quickly.

loans.use: to help 29 villagers purchase pigs, animal feed and vitamins to help them grow

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: José, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Yamaranguila, Intibucá.  Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura realizando trabajos de jornal, actualmente lleva tres años de tener su propio cultivo de café. Y para darle asistencia ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para comprar el fertilizante y también sembrar nuevas plantas de café.  Su plan es aumentar la producción para mejorar su vivienda y su condición de vida.
texts.en: Jose, 38, is married and has three children.  He lives with is family in a village of the municipality of Yamaranguila, Intibuca.  He has worked in agriculture as a day laborer all his life and for three years has been growing his own coffee.  In order to provide crop maintenance he is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL to buy fertilizer and to plant a new coffee crop.  His plan is to increase production to renovate his home and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to plant a new coffee crop.

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en: Roseminda is a businesswoman from Maras, Sindangan, ZDN. She is 53 years old, married and has an expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that is sufficient to support her family. Roseminda is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to purchase noodles. canned goods, and soft drinks for her business. Roseminda continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase noodles. canned goods, and soft drinks

location.town: Sindangan - Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 49-years-old, married and has six children. He is a vegetable vendor in their village. He also raises hogs for additional income. Alfredo wants to buy more vegetables to sell, but has insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy tomatoes, eggplant, cabbages and beans to sell. 

He hopes to improve his sales for more profits and save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, eggplant, cabbages and beans to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Editha is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more nipa roofing to sell.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren, aged 54, is married and blessed with nine children. Currently, two of whom are in school. To earn a living, she grows rice and soybeans as the main source of income, which has returned her about 18,500 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Ren and her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), for which Ren is a leader. For Ren, her entire loan portion will be used to buy a solar panel to generate electricity from the sunlight. She hopes that she can have electricity to use as do others.

loans.use: To buy solar panel to generate electricity from the sunlight.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Pi Tauk Kone Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yasagyo township, this community currently has 29 village customers, including 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area.  This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

The new loan would help this community to buy a variety of seeds, as they grow various crops such as pigeon, sesame, and paddy. Villagers also need to purchase insecticides and pesticides to protect and enrich their crops. One bag of insecticide is about $15, and the required number of bags varies by acreage and crop farmed. In this village, people generate additional income by sewing and crafting handmade products, such as bamboo chairs. About 70% of households are able to sew clothes and make handmade accessories.  They are even planning to extend sales to nearby townships.

Pictured above are the committee members from the village CBO: U Win, U Aye, U Shwe, U Myint, and Daw Cho. Included in the photo (first from the left) is U Win, who is 57-years-old and the father of two children. His eldest son just graduated from University, and the younger one is currently enrolled in University. With his new loan, he wants to purchase farming inputs, such as sesame seeds and fertilizer, for his farm.

loans.use: to help 77 villagers purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Leonel Armando

texts.es: Leonel de 33 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 12, 9 y 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña desde hace 3 años como albañil, actividad que le permite dar solidez económica a su familia, además su compañera de vida apoya en los gastos económicos del hogar vendiendo diversidad de productos. Leonel desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: lámina galvanizada y madera para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Leonel, who is 33 years old, lives in his own house with his life companion and their three children, ages 12, 9, and 3. He is a hard-working man who has been working for three years as a mason, work that allows him to give economic soundness to his family. In addition, his life companion helps with the household economic expenses by selling a variety of products. Leonel wants to change the roof of his house, and for this reason he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood to change the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that, she is doing her hobby and she earns an income as well. At the age of 34 and married, she busies herself sufficiently to provide for her family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. In the future, Leonora wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia  is driven by a passion in selling. At the age of 69, a widow in Sindangan, ZND, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. Everyday she never gets tired of tending her store. Lilia  is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously repays her obligations without a record of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory will mean income opportunities.In the future. She dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Dannyboy

texts.en: Dannyboy learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in 2010. He immediately signed up his membership and gained financial access. He tried his luck engaging in a business focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital.  Dannyboy has now borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give his farming income a big boost. Dannyboy looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is aged 42, married to a farmer and blessed with six children. She has managed a hog raising business for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 2,500 for every hog that she sells. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their daily expenses.

Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en: Socorro raises hogs within her village. She has been in this line of business for 19 years. Socorro is also engaged in farming. With her determination to improve her way of life, she is seeking additional capital of PHP 5,000, which allows her to buy one piglet, hog feed and vitamins. She knows that through sustaining her hogs with proper nutrition, she can make them healthier upon reaching their optimum growth. Socorro is hoping that her hog raising business will continue to grow. In this way, she can generate greater income for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy one piglet, hog feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two daughter in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. She works as a wet-nurse and gets a small monthly income. Her husband is an artisan and gets orders to renovate houses. Irma owns a small flat with 2 rooms and decided to rent it out. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $ 1500. With the received credit she will purchase all the building materials, her husband will renovate the flat and she will be able to rent it out at a good price in order to increase the family income. The Start up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to increase family income

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has been operating her own rental housing business for 14 years, and she earns well from this. She is from Taguig, 63 years of age, and is married to Herman. She has a big responsibility to provide for their needs, especially for her two children. Norma and her husband have to work hard, with the determination of earning more income than they currently do, so they can provide their children with a better education. 

To improve her profit and to pay for the maintenance of the boarding house, Norma would like to ask for loan assistance. An amount of 12,000 PHP could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place, so that her regular boarders will choose to stay there for longer periods of time. She sincerely wants you to know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance.

In the future, Norma hopes to refurnish her boarding house and make it concrete. She dreams for her children to finish their studies. Norma meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental property

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es:
Luz es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección de su propia línea de pijamas.
