Todo comenzó hace más de 15 años cuando comenzó aprendiendo de manera empírica el oficio de la confección y ya hoy en día, a sus 57 años de edad, tiene su propio taller. 

Trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de pijamas y camisetas; de esta forma intenta generar los recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y poder sostener a sus hijos menores.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra insumos de confección como tela, hilos, botones, broches, entre otros, para abastecer su taller y poder aumentar su producción.

Luz sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Luz is a dedicated and hard-working micro-entrepreneur. Her field of work is sewing her own line of pajamas.

Everything began more than 15 years ago when she began learning the seamstress trade in an empirical manner, and now, at the age of 57, she has her own workshop.

She works every day, and her strength is making pajamas and t-shirts. In this way she intends to generate the resources to help her husband with the economic burden of the household and be able to support her young children.

The loan that she is applying for will be invested in the purchase of sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, buttons, and fasteners, among other items, to stock her workshop and allow her to increase her production.

Luz dreams of continuing to strengthen her workshop and having a better level of production every day in order to generate employment opportunities and improve the quality of life of her family as well as that of the people who daily influence her work.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, lace, and buttons, among other items, to stock her workshop and improve the quality of life of her young children.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 39 years old, married to a construction worker, and blessed with four children. She has managed a vulcanizing shop in their village for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 600 daily. Her income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase a compressor for her vulcanizing shop. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve and to become more profitable so that she can earn a better living.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y los 2 hijos que han procreado de  9 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida con la venta de pupusas, además su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar con su trabajo de obrero. Ana desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, además deberá reparar el cuarto de la cocina, que como se observa en la fotografía se encuentra en mal estado. Por lo anterior Ana solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento y arena para cambiar el techo y reparar el cuarto de la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana, who is 24 years old, lives in her own house together with her life companion and their two children, ages 9 and 3. She is a tenacious woman who earns a living selling pupusas. In addition, her life companion supports the family economy with his work as a laborer. Ana wants to change the roof of her house. In addition, she will need to repair the kitchen, which, as can be observed in the photograph, is in bad condition. To do this, Ana is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, cement, and sand to change the roof and repair the kitchen in her home.

loans.use: to buy laminated metal sheeting, wood, cement, and sand to change the roof and repair the kitchen of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 200 blocks, 15 bags of cement, iron and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es: La señora Claudina está casada, tiene 37 años de edad, alcanzo a estudiar solo hasta el nivel primario por diversas razones ya que su familia no tenia los recursos suficientes para pagar sus estudios, con mucho esfuerzo logro comprarse una casa, la misma es de condiciones humildes,cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a su cargo, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, los productos que cultiva son papa, haba, avena y cebada en su terreno propio de 4 hectáreas ubicado en el Municipio de Tiraque de la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora es una persona responsable y trabajadora, actualmente se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas que a corto plazo le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar las condiciones  de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Claudina is married. She is 37 years old. She went to school only through the primary level for various reasons, since her family didn't have sufficient resources to pay for her studies. With great effort, she managed to buy a house, which is of humble circumstances. She has three economic dependents in her care. The economic activity in which she works is agricultural production. 

The products that she raises are potatoes, beans, oats, and barley. She raises them on her own 4-hectare plot of land located in the township of Tiraque in the city of Cochabamba. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She now finds it necessary to apply for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies that in the short term will allow her to obtain better economic income, which is going to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow delicious food on her smallholder farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: wood, galvanized steel and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en: Annalyn is a married woman and a mother of a four year old child from Leyte, Philippines. Annalyn is engaged in sari-sari or retail business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Annalyn's buisness was ruined when typhoon Haiyan hit the country several months ago.  As of now, Annalyn is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips and other snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to augment her stocks and attract more buyers in her store. In the future, Annalyn hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips and other snack foods, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is engaged in a direct selling business, particularly selling various kinds of dresses, blouses, slippers and shoes. As her additional source of income, she is also a manicurist within her village. Merly would like to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 4,000 to be used for buying a manicure kit, blouses, shorts and other clothes for her direct selling business. She hopes that she can avail this loan to improve her sales and profit.

loans.use: to purchase manicure kit, blouses, shorts and other clothes for her business

loans.name: Sokan

texts.en:
Sokan is 25 years old and a married man who has one little child. He lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, he and his wife manage a rice farming business which is their sole source of their income. So far, they have been in this occupation for nearly five years with the average income is USD $6 a day. 
Sokan wants to improve the general living conditions of his entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who all go to school. She sells used shoes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last nine years. She takes care of additional family members. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes and clothes. Her major challenge includes defaulters and seasonality. She is aspiring to build a residential house. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes and clothes

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en: Zoila sells snack foods within her locality. She is happily married to a construction worker and blessed with three children. Two of her children go to school while her youngest child is still below school age. Zoila would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to be used for buying cooking oil, ingredients, raw meat and vegetables for her snack food businessl. She is hoping that through this loan she can keep her food vending business productive in order to get ahead in life and have a stable source of income someday.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, ingredients, raw meat and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her pig business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.  She recently obtained a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in the nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old and has ten children. Elvira is widowed and has three children who are still in school.

Elvira is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elvira has been farming vegetables for 6 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: José Castillo

texts.es:
José de 50 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, su nivel de  estudio solo fue sexto grado no tuvo la oportunidad se seguir estudiando, una por la guerra que vivió el país y la otra porque su familia tubo emigrar del país.

 Está casado, padre de dos hijos de las edades de 10 y 14 años que están estudiando en la escuela, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda y cuidar de sus hijos. 

José es albañil tiene aproximadamente 15 años de trabajar en la actividad, él construye casas, pisos, muros  etc. Comenta que estuvo fuera del país en los Estados Unidos 5 años trabajando en la misma actividad y logro fortalecer más sus conocimientos en la albañilería; es por esta razón que él ha visualizado dedicarse a esta actividad y que hoy en día lo conocen muchas personas y lo buscan para que les haga trabajos, él sale fuera de su casa a realizar los trabajos siempre es necesario movilizarse a otros lugares para poder trabajar, él aprendió el trabajo cuando trabajaba de ayudante con su tío. José también se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos maíz, maicillo y fríjol. 

El financiamiento del préstamo es para la siembra de frijol, preparación de la tierra y pago de mano de obra, pues por sus compromisos en los trabajos casi no tiene tiempo y le toca que buscar personas que le ayuden a trabajar, él siempre tiene la costumbre de sembrar maíz y frijol para el alimento diario de su familia. 

Desea poder ir a trabajar de nuevo a los Estados Unidos, pues comenta que obtiene mejores ingresos para su familia o si no, encontrar un mejor empleo aquí en el país, también mejorar sus cultivos, obtener mayor producción y que sus hijos sigan estudiando en la universidad; también mejorar un poco su vivienda construir 2 habitaciones más para sus dos hijos todo esto comenta que lo lograra con mucho trabajo y con futuros créditos  que solicitara.
texts.en:
José, 50 years old, is a very hardworking person. Educationally, he only reached the sixth grade. He did not have the opportunity to continue studying, first due to the war that swept through his country and second because his family had to emigrate out of the country.

He is married, a father of two sons aged 10 and 14, who are studying in school. His wife does housework at home and raises their children.

José is a mason with 15 years of experience. He builds homes, floors, walls etc. He remarks that he was out of the country in the United States for five years, working in the same line of work and he was able to expand his skills and boost his knowledge of masonry. This is why he envisions himself dedicating himself to this line of work. Nowadays, many people know of him and seek him out to give him work. He always complies and leaves his home. He learned this work by working alongside his uncle. José also works in agriculture with basic grains: corn, millet and beans.

The loan funds are for planting beans, priming the soil, and for paying the labor costs, since with his masonry projects he hardly has time for agriculture, so he has to find people to help with the work. He always has had the tradition of planting corn and beans to provide food daily for his family.

He hopes to be able to return to work in the United States; he says he has better wages for his family there, or else if he can't, then he hopes to find a better job here at home, improve his crops, obtain better yields and have his children go on to study in college; he also hopes to improve his home by building two more rooms for his two children: something that he will achieve with hard work and with future loans he will request.

loans.use: for planting beans, land preparation and payment of labor, because due to his work commitments, he almost has no available time and he has to find people to help with the work. He always has had the habit of planting corn and beans daily as food for his family.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. Annabelle is married and has a carbon dioxide refill business in the Philippines.

Annabelle requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional tank of carbon dioxide to sell.

Annabelle has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional tank of carbon dioxide for her refill business

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cresencia is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Cresencia has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. Cresencia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and payment for electric bills.

Cresencia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and payment for electric bills

loans.name: Ayatulloh

texts.en: Ayatulloh lives in Cilegon, a major coastal industrial city located about 3 hours from Jakarta. He is married and living with his wife and his two children. Ayatulloh runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. He began working with Ruma a month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends, which is when people mostly buy mobile airtime. In the photo, Ayatulloh is standing in front of his stall.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Romina

texts.en: Romina sells mineral water in her neighborhood. She is 40 years of age, married and has three children. Her spouse is a farmer. The couple has been doing their best in order to sustain their basic needs and improve their living condition. Romina would like to purchase bulk mineral water to supply all her customers but she struggles with inadequate capital, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 3,000. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan to gain better profit and be able to send her three children to university.

loans.use: to purchase bulk mineral water to sell

loans.name: Telman

texts.en: Telman is 51 year old and is a married man. His wife is a housekeeper. They have been farming for 34 years now and they are currently growing watermelons to sell at the market. His monthly profit from this business is 160 AZN. Telman learned how to farm thanks to his parents who taught him when he was young. He needs the loan to buy a water pump because currently he has to get water from his neighbor. For this reason he is asking for a loan 1200 AZN. This is his  first loan. Please support Telman.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 26-year-old divorced woman. She lives with her infant child in the Kareli district. Mariam is involved in agricultural activities. She has a small family-owned agricultural farm, where she grows fruits and vegetables. Mariam wants to start a husbandry business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1500 Gel. With the loan she will purchase a cow and will start a husbandry business. Mariam will milk the cow every day and will produce cheese to sell locally. She will be able to increase the income of her family and with increased income she will provide better living conditions for her child. Mariam awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start a husbandry business in order to increase family income

loans.name: Panfela

texts.en:
Panfela is hard working woman from Shahumyan village. 
She is married and has a very nice family. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law, three grandchildren, her husband and mother-in-law. Panfela's husband is a shoemaker, her son is a policeman and Panfela herself runs the farm. Her daughter-in-law helps Panfela with farming activities, but she also has too much work about the house and too many family members to take care of. 
The farm includes 4 cows, 4 calves and some hens. 
Panfela plans to start cultivation work and needs more funds. The requested loan for USD $2,500 is important for Panfela to purchase a lawn mower.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mower for her farm

loans.name: Toedora

texts.en: Toedora is a married 60-year-old woman with three adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years. The business helped her to meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides a good income, due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already received previous loans to purchase additional stock and is now reapplying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Senona

texts.en: Senona makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a food stall in Aloran and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up her membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Se availed a loan to purchase more food to sell. Senona hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and additives to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 64 years old. She is known in the Aloran area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 17 años y 14 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Rosa es mujer creativa quien se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, blusas, etc. De esta forma se gana vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Rosa desea reparar el techo de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de madera, lámina galvanizada y clavos. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes lo antes posible.
texts.en: Rose is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her two children, ages 17 and 14. At this time they are studying in the public school in their neighborhood. Rosa is a creative woman who works as a tailor, making ready-to-wear skirts, dresses, blouses, etc. With this, she earns a living and brings the earnings to her home. Rosa wants to repair the roof of her home. She is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in wood, galvanized sheet metal, and nails. She hopes to be able to depend on this financing, and therefore to improve the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: wood, galvanized sheet metal, and nails to repair the home's roof.

loans.name: Tuyen's Group

texts.en:
Tuyen was born in 1977. She lives in a small village of Bac Ninh province. She has been running a clothing store for 15 years. Her husband is a farmer. She has two children, all of whom are currently studying at school. Tuyen and her husband also raise pigs and grow crops to earn a living. Her family monthly income is VND 9,000,000. Because of her passion in business, Tuyen hopes that she can expand her clothing store in the future. 
Tuyen has participated in the SEDA program since 2010. She successfully repaid a loan of VND 7,392,000. This time is her sixth cycle, she is applying a VND 8,736,000 loan though SEDA to buy new clothes for her store. Tuyen wishes that by doing so, she will be able to earn more money to improve her family’s living standard and support her children in their studies. 
Tuyen is also the leader of a group that includes four other SEDA members, who are included in the following list. 
• Lien was born in 1972. She is a carpenter who has three children. She is requesting a loan of VND 10,976,000 to buy wood for her carpentry shop. 
• My was born in 1973. She is the mother of three children. She wants to borrow VND 10,080,000 to buy hair products for her business. 
• Huong was born in 1975. She runs a food stall and has two children. She is applying a VND 8,736,000 loan through SEDA to buy more vegetables and meat for her food stall. 
• Hai was born in 1963. She runs a grocery store and has three children. She would like to borrow VND 6,944,000 to buy more goods for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for her store

loans.name: Firaman

texts.en:
Firaman is a 57-year-old widow with three sons. The older two are married and the youngest lives with her. She works in animal husbandry and agriculture for her primary source of family income. This includes growing potatoes, cucumbers, and other crops on her own land.

Thanks to her hard work, she now has four cows. Between milk sales, livestock, and crops, she earns about 130 AZN per month. With the goal of further developing her business, Firaman has turned to Agroinvest CU for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This will be used to purchase two cows to increase her livestock. She plans to invest profits from the loan to further increase her livestock and to save for her youngest son's future wedding.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is engaged in selling different kinds of fish. She has been involved in this kind of business for seven years. Juanita is a widower who has five children. Four of her children are married while the other one is working. Juanita's income goes toward their basic needs, payment to monthly electricity bills and other household expenditures. With her determination to have a stable source of income, she is asking for financial support in the amount of PHP 5,000. She will use this loan to buy crab, shrimp, tilapia and dwell fish. She believes that she will be able to improve her standard of living and gain greater income.

loans.use: to buy crab, shrimp, tilapia, dwell fish and tangui to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is managing her eatery business in Aloran. She has mastered the business when she and her husband were on the early years of their marriage. She has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, she availed of a loan to purchase more meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her direct selling business. She also has been operating a “sari-sari” (variety) store for ten years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Alejandra would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 30,000, she can purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Alejandra wants that her profit from business will continue to increase. She also hopes good health and good life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Cecelia works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from nipa roof making. Cecelia is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Gilar

texts.en: Meet Gilar. Gilar is a father of four who lives in East Bandung, West Java. Gilar manages a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, consumer product, and mobile phone airtime credits. His spouse is a fulltime housewife, taking care of their children. He began working with Ruma (Microfinacne Institution) three months ago because he wanted to increase his income to fulfill his family living; especially for his children's education. In addition, since he got support and assistance from Ruma's staff, he has become more aware of how mobile technology can support his business. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan in order to do more transactions on weekends, which is when people mostly buy mobile airtime. In the photo are Gilar and his wife carrying their baby. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: To buy more airtime credit to sell on busy weekends

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos de 19 años, 17 años, 14 años y 12 años de edad. María trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace tres años y es así como va sacando a sus hijos adelante dado que no cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo del cual se separó hace unos años. Con el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra  de cemento y arena para repellar las paredes de la vivienda y poder así protegerla de las plagas y de la humedad.
texts.en: María is 42 years old and lives in her own home along with her four children, ages 19, 17, 14, and 12. María has worked as a housemaid for three years. This is how she helps her children to move forward, as she does not have the help of a husband, having separated from him a few years ago. With the desire of improving the conditions of her home, she has made the decision to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in cement and sand to plaster the walls of her house. This will help to protect it from infestations and humidity.

loans.use: to buy: cement and sand to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is a married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in poultry business for more than 7 years now. This is the source of her income.
Bella is asking for a loan to buy chicks, animal feed and food supplement. With this she will be able to grow more chickens in her place which she can sell to the market. In the future, Bella hopes of making business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy chicks, animal feed and food supplement

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim (in picture) lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has seven children, four sons and three daughters. Two of her children are married, three are garment workers, one attends school and another one assists his parents in business. 
Sim is a rice farmer and raises cows at home. She wants to buy one more cow, which why she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member (sister). She has a business of selling maize flour and soda and has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 1200000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of maize flour and crates of soda. She generates additional income from a beauty salon. She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells wholesale. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of owning a delivery van to ease her transportation challenge and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent for her business premises .

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize flour and crates of soda.

loans.name: Luzvillan

texts.en: Luzvillan is 36 years old and is a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, in the Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to a public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.  Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into the business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. Luzvillan joined Paglaum MPC to avail a loan to buy fishing nets. But aside from financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is single and currently lives with his two family members in Indramayu. Indramayu is a small city located at the north, coastal part of Java. It is about three to four hours east of Jakarta by car.

Ahmad manages a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, daily consumer goods, and mobile phone airtime credits. He began working with Ruma a month ago. This started from his friend, who has also become a Ruma agent, because he wanted to increase his income. He is excited about the business because he can learn more about mobile technology and because he gets support and assistance from Ruma's staff, which is insightful for him. As the business runs, Ahmad hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva. This will help to process more transactions on weekends. He is a hard-working and motivated young man, and he thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 57 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF. It will be used to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries.

Eden has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as soap and groceries. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy better breeds of chickens for her farm

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is from Lejan village of the Lori region. 
Lusine perfectly manages to provide her small family with normal living conditions due to her farming business.
She lives with her husband and retired mother-in-law. 
Together with her husband, Lusine is doing her best to improve the family income.
She requests a loan of USD $3,000 to buy a cow and forage for her livestock. As this is Lusine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven't had access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to buy a cow and forage for her livestock

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita has run her variety store for two years. She is 59 years old, married, and has four grown children. She aims to increase her income, so she is seeking additional capital amounting to 5,000 PHP. This amount will be use to purchase grocery items such as sugar, milk, Nescafe and canned goods for her variety store. She knows that someday she could improve her variety store through continuous access of financial support from lenders. Rosita is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount. In this way, she can keep her business profitable.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as sugar, milk, Nescafe and canned goods for her variety store

loans.name: Enelyn

texts.en:
Enelyn works hard to support her family. Enelyn is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like linen, zippers, tailoring chalk, etc. for her business.

Enelyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Enelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like linen, zippers, tailoring chalk, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 48 year old married woman, from Dmanisi district. She lives with her school-aged son and husband, who is a private artisan and generates minimal income. Nana works as a cleaner and makes 200 GEL monthly. The family doesn't have enough income to cover all their daily expenses but manage to live at an acceptable living standard level. They realize that they need to increase their income to continue to pay for their basic needs. Nana has requested a loan from a number of local financial institutions, but was rejected several times because of her family's poor living condition. Finally, Nana's request was approved within the start-up program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. She plans to start agricultural activity, in particular she will purchase a milking cow and start dairy farming. Nana will sell milk products locally at a good price and also have milk for her family. 
The loan will greatly assist Nana and her family, as they will be able increase her family's income and improve their financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Amorlita

texts.en: Amorlita is a member of PMPC and has used the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business (general store). She is thankful for the capital, for even a small borrower like her. Amorlita is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a better home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is 44 years old, married and the father of one child. Samir  is a very skilled farmer with experience in a variety of agricultural areas. He has an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind.  He has a vegetable field that he tends every day from very early in the morning. Lack of water is a big problem in his region. This is why people in the area can't water their gardens and fields and their crops die. He is asking for a loan of 1200 AZN in order to be able to supply water for his garden every month. Please support Samir.

loans.use: to supply water for his garden every month

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a responsible mother and requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilograms of fruit and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit & vegetables for retail

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than eight years now. She also runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. 

Gina is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to raise more pigs which she can sell to the market after a few months. In the future, Gina hopes of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed and food supplements for the pigs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is from Oroquieta and is married with three adult children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is requesting another loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Chiratabala

texts.en:
Chiratabala, age 37, is an energetic housewife from Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She lives with her husband in their small kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw). They have only one son who lives abroad in connection with his work.  She is illiterate and can sign only her name.

Chiratabala’s husband, 49 years old, is a farmer by profession. He has been involved in this agricultural activity for 10 years. He mainly cultivates rice on his own farmland. He has good knowledge of paddy rice cultivation. He wants to boost his agricultural business to strengthen his family's financial situation.

Chiratabala heard that Kiva’s partner BJS gives business loans to rural women and she has taken a loan to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers. In order to strengthen her agricultural business, she plans to improve her strategy and make use of new farming techniques.

Her ambition is to enlarge her business for which she is struggling a lot.

She gives her hearty thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is married with six children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business of selling sweet and Cavendish bananas and has been in this business for 8 years. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of sweet and Cavendish bananas. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to pay for her remaining children to attend university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but no to piped water. Her main monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of cavendish and sweet bananas.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes is married and a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is in the business of selling fish. She is a member of PMPC and aside from financial assistance she also has enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with patience & diligence of her husband she is looking forward to being an even more successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried fish for selling

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso is a married man and a father of two grown up children from Leyte, Philippines. He has been engaged in the poultry business for more than five years now. This is his main source of income. Narciso is asking for a loan to buy more chicks to raise, animal feed and supplements for his farm. 
With this, he will be able to raise more chickens which he can sell at the market. In the future, Narciso hopes improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more baby chicks, animal feed and supplements for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, and gravel to pave the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Ana Candida

texts.es: Ana tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos de 10 años, 7 años, 6 años y 4 meses de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 11 años se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir las cuales son muy demandadas por sus clientes. Ana desea construir un muro de contención en su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo y grava para dar inicio a la construcción del muro lo antes posible.
texts.en: Ana is 41 years old. She lives in her own home along with her life partner and her four children, aged 10 years, 7 years, 6 years, and 4 months old. She is an enterprising woman and for the past 11 years has worked to sew clothing, items that are very much in demand from her clients. Ana wants to build a retaining wall in her home. For this, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, bricks, and gravel to begin construction on the wall as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, bricks, and gravel to begin construction on a containing wall.

loans.name: Dunuk

texts.en: Dunuk lives in West Bandung, a regency area located in West Java province. She is a full time housewife who runs a small stall called 'warung' that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credit. Dunuk's husband is a civil worker, and they live together with their three children in the family home. Dunuk was first introduced to Ruma (microfinance institution) by one of Ruma's staff who visited her small stall and she became excited to sell mobile airtime ever since. She can see that the opportunity of selling mobile airtime to her neighborhood is huge. Nowadays, as her business continues to grow, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to process mobile airtime transactions on busy weekends. That way, Dunuk can increase her family's income. In the photo, Dunuk is standing in front of her small stall.

loans.use: To buy more airtime credit for the busy weekends

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en: Eloisa, is aged 29, married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She manages a transportation business, particularly motorcycle transport and earns a net income of PHP 200-300 daily. Due to insufficient fund from her business she would like to avail of a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle. She also sells carabaos' (water buffalo) and cows to generate additional income. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintnance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Miryakub

texts.ru:
Мирякуб позитивный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 56 лет. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Он живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Жена Мирякуба домохозяйка, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мама. Сам Мирякуб занимается откормом и продажей скота. От этого дела он получает постоянный доход. Этого дохода хватает Мирякубу только на проживание. Старший сын его работает в России и получает среднюю заработную плату, которую присылает домой.

Но у него есть мечта, Мирякуб хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. Но для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому Мирякуб обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Мирякуб и вся его семья очень надеятся на положительный результат и заранее благодарят Арванд  за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Miryakub is an optimistic and responsible 56-year-old who is married and has five children.  He fattens and sells livestock for a living, while his wife, a hardworking and nurturing mother, tends to their home.  His oldest son is a migrant worker in Russia and earns an average wage, sending money home to his parents to help them when he can; though Miryakub himself earns a steady income, he only makes enough to pay for living expenses.

Miryakub lives with his family in a rural village.  Their house there is on the small side, and not very livable to boot.  As such, Miryakub dreams of building a big new home for his family.  He has turned to Arvand as he lacks the money to do so, and is seeking a loan to buy building materials for his new house. Miryakub and his family are hoping for a positive outcome, and thank Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: buy building materials to build a new home for his family

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en: Aybaniz is a 20-year-old university student. She is in her third year. She is still very young and eager to get ahead in life. Her parents work hard to cover her education expenses, but their salary isn't good enough to cover unexpected increases. She requests a loan of 1,500 AZN from Kiva's field partner, Aqroinvest CU, to pay tuition fees. She hopes to continue to pay the fees and related costs.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dipti

texts.en:
Dipti is from the town of Dhupguri.  She is 28 years old and a homemaker who looks after her husband and two sons. It is a remote village named Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri where she lives with her family. Her sons attend school and are in grade four and grade eight, respectively.  Dipti and her husband Anil both studied until the secondary level. They live in a house that is mud-made and they are deprived of basic facilities like electricity and water.

The couple has been engaged in agriculture for more than 10 years. Dipti's husband cultivates potatoes and gourds (bottle gourds, bitter gourds and ribbed gourds) and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. As the income is too scant to provide the basic needs of his family, he thought of cultivating a crop that is profitable and is an all-season crop. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. Because they have inadequate capital, they have decided to take some financial help for cultivation.

Dipti has sought a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) and the requested loan is very important for Dipti to be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize cultivation work and they hope for a good harvest.  They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. She dreams of upgrading her house to a concrete-made house.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for growing paddy.

loans.name: Bascillisa

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Bascillisa, a 41-year-old caring, honest and very hard-working mother of 4 children.  She is based in Kologolo a remote village in Kitale area of Kenya. She is a determined farmer who easily jells with other people and has been practicing farming for the past 25 years. All through those years she has never looked back and has never regretted any single bit. Her primary source of income has been eggs, milk and a variety of food crops she sells to the local market and to her neighbors. Through income from farming she has been able to earn a living and always put food on the table for her family. Bascillisa is a very hard working woman and rises very early to go to her farm since farming is the only way she can earn a decent living. When asked what she enjoys about farming her reply was “I enjoy the returns I get after hard work”.

She passionately loves poultry farming because the business is very profitable and can be done on a part time basis to make extra income. She is facing challenges of lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. Bascillisa wants to buy good quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to disease and have high productivity. Through the loan she will buy quality breeds of poultry that will increase her egg production and this will translate to increased income. Other than profits she will also benefit from chicken manure which will increase the fertility of her farm and save money that would have been used in buying fertilizer. Bascillisa is very determined to succeed and be economically empowered but, being a woman, she knows that accessing funds is very challenging. However,knowing that there are partners such as Kiva and Juhudi Kilimo, she feels relieved and knows that her dream will be achieved and she will provide a secure future for her school going children.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Ernesto vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente, trabajador y responsable; se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 2 años, siembra papa, haba, oca  y papaliza como sus principales productos en terreno propio con una extensión de 2.5 hectáreas en el mismo lugar. Produce con rotación de cultivos además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 2 de engorde y 2 lecheras . El señor Ernesto requiere un crédito para la compra de un terreno agrícola porque quiere incrementar su producción para aumentar sus ingresos y asi mejorar su nivel de vida y su situación social en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Senor Ernesto lives and works in Colomi. He is economically independent, and is a responsible and hard worker. He has made a living in agriculture for the past two years, planting potato, bean, oca (a vegetable), and papalisa (similar to potato) as his main products. He plants on his own land, with a 2.5 hectare extension in the same place. He produces the crops in rotation, as well as raising cattle-- two for fattening, and two for milk.

Senor Ernesto is asking for a loan to buy agricultural land, because he wants to increase his production. This will increase his income, and therefore better his standard of living and social situation to benefit his family.

loans.use: to buy land to grow from being a smallholder farmer

loans.name: Fajina

texts.en:
Fajina is 29 years of age. She is a very dedicated and hardworking woman who is a mother of three lovely daughters. She resides in the small village of Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district, a region always referred to as the paddy cultivating area.  She has three lovely and adorable school-going daughters that she really values and treasures. She and her husband, 43-year-old Shafikul, are illiterate.

They have been practicing farming for many years and through hard work and determination, they have been able to support their family and always provide a plate of food for them. Her main source of income is paddy cultivation.

Because of the harsh living conditions and the lack of sufficient profit, Fajina plans to increase her farming output so that she can improve her income and, hence, her living conditions. That is why she is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy farm inputs. Through buying farming inputs such as good quality paddy seeds and good fertilizer and pesticide, she will be able to increase her crop production output and, hence, improve her income.

Fajina is very visionary and enterprising and she hopes that, through improved income, she will be able to save more money. She plans to upgrade their house to a concrete and mortar house.

Through the loan, her business will continue to flourish, she will assure her school-going daughters of uninterrupted learning and improve her living standards.

She is thankful for her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and material such as fabric and thread in order to increase her production, better her workshop, and support her family.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is a 58-year-old divorced woman from the small village of Idumala. She has only one school-aged daughter and the family earns a living with the help of small agricultural activity. However they live under poverty, as the only source of income is trading in potatoes seasonally. Natela wants to expand her agribusiness and start farming. She requested a loan and was approved within the start-up program, that regards provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the requested money she plans to purchase cattle, raise them and sell them at a good price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Terifena

texts.en: Terifena and her husband live in Bogor, a city located about an hour from Jakarta. Together with her husband, she runs a small shop that sells electrical and home appliances and mobile phone airtime credits. She began working with Ruma five months ago because she wanted to try out the mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business is running, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Terifena is sitting in front of her small shop.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin is 61 years old and a single mother of two dependent children and three married children. She lives in a small village of Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. In the last forty years, she has managed a rice farming business which is the sole source of her income. She grows rice and sells the crop to local dealers. The farmland was located near her house.

Chin wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Silver & Gold Group

texts.en:
Clara started her poultry business in 2012. After working as a volunteer counselor with Childline Zimbabwe, as a token of appreciation, World Education funded her to start a project and she thought of chicken rearing. In 2013, when she was on the third batch, her birds were affected by Newcastle - a serious poultry disease. A friend in her group (also doing poultry business) advised her to take the birds to the Veterinary Department. She then got help on how to treat various diseases that affects chickens. The business bloomed and she managed to save money for buying a residential stand in Dzvivarasekwa, Harare.  With the Kiva loan, Clara will be able to build another fowl run to have more birds reared at her place. She also hopes the in future she will be able to keep chicken layers as well as broilers. 
Clara and her friends formed the Silver and Gold group. Most of the members in the group keep poultry and they help each other to market their chicken as well as bringing them up. The group continually attends training offered at Thrive and this has since helped then to prepare budget in the business before spending the money.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business.

loans.name: Girabagenzi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Aisha  fait partie du groupe  Girabagenzi  et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 42 ans .Elle a 3 enfants âgés  de 7 à 16 ans et tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de boutique et de restaurant   depuis 10 ans. 

Elle  est s à son  deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des articles pour sa boutique (riz, haricot, savon,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait constuire une maison et   voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Aisha is a member of the Girabagenzi II group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 42 years old and a widow. She has three children, aged from seven to 16 years old. All of her children go to school.

Aisha has been in retail and the restaurant business for ten years. She is on her second loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy items for her shop (rice, beans, soap, etc.), which she will resell and earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to build a house and see her children [continue to] go to school.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop (rice, beans, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Miguel

texts.fr: Miguel vit a Jérémie dans le département de la Grand-Anse Haiti. Miguel est marie et a un enfant sous sa responsabilité. son activité principale est la vente des produits de communications. il revient vers nous pour son premier prêt.Miguel veut intégrer ses produits EarthSpark Enèji Pwòp dans sa Boutique dans le but d'aider les gens a faire un peu d’économie et il voudrais contribuer dans l’avancement des produits de l’énergie renouvelable en Haiti.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in Jérémie, in Grand-Anse, Haiti. He is married and has one child under his care. 

Miguel works mostly selling communication products. He is now seeking his first loan, so that he can offer EarthSpark Enèji Pwòp products in his shop. 

He wants to help people save money, and he would like to contribute to the advancement of renewable energy products in Haiti.

loans.use: to sell renewable energy products

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MENA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le mais  avec DJELIKA 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 225 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 5 group are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Mena, in Kolondieba, one of the areas in the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan, and their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Djelika, who is the first person standing on the left in the photo, grows rice, groundnuts, and corn. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the cost of plowing three hectares of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in Kolondieba to male and female customers.

Djelika hopes to earn 225,000 francs CFA in profit, which will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the cost of plowing

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene 29 años de edad y vive en Santiago junto a su familia. Tiene un hijo quien es su mayor orgullo y por quien lucha día a día para poder brindarle un mejor futuro. Desde hace algún tiempo trabaja como empelado en una empresa Agrícola y le va muy bien gracias a su buen desempeño. Jorge gasta mucho en sus pasajes para trasladarse de su domicilio a la empresa es por ello que su meta es comprarse una moto para transportarse.
Él está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprarse una moto para ya no gastar en pasajes y así tener ese ingreso adicional para apoyar a su familia. Con esto él seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder brindarle una educación de calidad a su hija.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very enterprising person. He is 29 years old and lives in Santiago with his family. He has a child, who is his greatest pride. Jorge strives day after day in order to provide a better future for his child. He has been working as an employee in a farming business for some time and it is going very well for him thanks to his good job performance. Jorge spends a lot of money to get to work, which is why his goal is to buy himself a motorcycle so he can transport himself. 

He is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support they have given him he will be able to buy himself a motorcycle so he doesn’t have to spend money on transportation, and in this way he will have additional income for supporting his family. He will continue striving towards being able to give his daughter a quality education further down the track.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: cement, bricks, gravel, sand, etc. to build a sink and water tank.

loans.name: Brenda Vanesa

texts.es: Brenda tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora quien se dedica a la elaboración de gabachas desde hace tres años. Dicha actividad la realiza en su hogar de habitación y cada día son más las personas que demandan sus productos. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, Brenda solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que, desea reparar el techo de su vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera y polines. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder mejorar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Brenda is 20 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and her small three-year-old son. She is a hard-working woman who has made a living by making smocks for three years. She does this work at home and every day more people ask for her products. With the desire of improving her living conditions, Brenda is requesting this loan from FUSAI since she wishes to repair the roof of her home. For this she needs materials, such as: galvanized sheet metal, wood, and purlins. She hopes to be able to get this financing and thereby be able to improve the roof of her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, pins and purlins to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 40 year old married woman from Leyte, Philippines and a mother of two school-age children. Nancy earns a living through her sari-sari or retail business selling various goods and items to the  people in her neighborhood. Nancy's business was ruined when a typhoon hit the country several months ago. As of now, Nancy is requesting a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, flour and cooking oil, and  gasoline, among others. Through this loan, Nancy will be able to increase her stock which will attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Nancy hopes of making her business even more of a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, flour and cooking oil, and  gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 56 and married to a construction worker and blessed with four children. Fe has managed a hog raising business for almost eight years and earns a net income of PHP 20,000 for three hogs. Her net income is usually spent on her vegetable vending business for additional income. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and hogs to raise

loans.name: Sreyny

texts.en:
Sreyny is 31 years old and lives in a village across the Mekong river twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three children who are in school-one son and two daughters. 

Sreyny buys and sells recycling materials, while her husband is a fisherman. She is applying for a loan to assist her husband’s fishing business by buying additional fishing materials because the old ones are broken and do not work well.

loans.use: To assist her husband’s fishing business by buying additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Alessandra Samir

texts.es:
Alessandra, es una mujer de 51 años de edad que desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales, inició con un pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos en su casa, con el cual ha tenido muy buen desempeño y logró adquirir recursos para aportar a la economía de su hogar.

La titular se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante. 

Es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en compra de mercancía como desodorantes, maquillajes, cremas, aceites, entre otros, con el fin de darle un impulso a su negocio, que logre atraer más clientes para ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio, de esta manera logrará obtener más ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para poder comprar su propia casa.

Apoya a una madre emprendedora con ganas de darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alessandra is a 51 year old woman who for several years has dedicated herself to diverse work activities. She started up a small business of selling cosmetics in her house, with which she has had a good result and she has achieved to acquire resources to support the household economy.

The incumbent is characterized by being a entrepreneurial and friendly woman with vision and a lot of will to move forward.

Therefor she is encouraged to request a loan to invest in the buying of goods like deodorants, make-up, creams, oils and others, with the goal to give her business an impulse that will achieve to attract more clients by offering them a variety of products that will satisfy the needs and likes of everyone that will visit her business. This way she will achieve to obtain more income to continue supporting the household economy and save up to buy her own house.

Help a entrepreneurial mother with a will to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of goods like deodorants, make-up, creams and others, to supply her business and improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood, paint and ingredients which will allow him to continue working and pay for his children's  schooling.

loans.name: Roxana Amanda

texts.es: Roxana de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijas de 18, 14 y 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida con su trabajo en un taller de costura desde hace 5 años, su esposo aporta a la economía del hogar prestando sus servicios de seguridad. Roxana desea colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda que se encuentra a medio construir como se observa en la fotografía, es por ello que solicita un cerdito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, ladrillo de piso y pagar mano de obra necesaria para que le coloquen el ladrillo de piso en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roxana, 36 years old lives in her own home with her husband and her 3 daughters of 18, 14 and 12 years old.

She is a sturdy woman who has made a living through her work in a dressmaking workshop for 5 years, her husband contributes to the family finances by providing his security services.

Roxana wants to put bricks on the floor of their dwelling which is only half built as shown in the photograph, therefore she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, floor bricks and to pay for the manual labor necessary to fit the bricks onto floor of her home.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, floor bricks and to pay for the manual labor to fit bricks onto floor of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 36 years old, and a married woman with three children. She has sold fish and vegetables since 2007. One of her children is a garment worker and two are students. Her husband is a farmer and he has been a famer since 1995. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Now Ly would like to request a loan to buy cows for her husband and children to feed and breed. They will then sell the calves. This loan will help her family earn more income. In the future, she is going to help expand her husband’s cultivation, renovate her house and support her children so they can go to university.

loans.use: to buy cows for her husband and children to feed and breed.

loans.name: Phalley

texts.en: Phalley is 35 years old, and a married woman with two children. She has been a garment worker since 2006. Both of her children are students. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and a fisherman. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $22.6 per day. Now Phalley would like to request a loan to buy a new motor for her husband’s motor taxi because his present motor is old. This loan will help her husband earn more income by having a more reliable motor. In the future, she is going to stop working as a garment worker and open a shop designing clothes and support her children so they can go to university.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for her husband's motor taxi.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en: Sokunthea is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been a garment worker since 2011. Her husband is a thatched roof maker and he has been doing this work since 2008. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $13.36 per day. Now she would like to request a loan to buy a motorbike to ride to work. This loan will help her reduce traveling expense. In the future, she is going to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to ride to work.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à WAKORO, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le mais  avec AWA 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 1,5 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 110 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi1 group are married women, who average 36 years of age with four children each; they all live in polygamous families in Wakoro, in the Kolondieba municipality, one of the prefectures in Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their farming activities smoothly during the winter season. They are on their second loan with the institution and the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Awa, who is standing on the far left of the photo, grows groundnut and corn. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs and seeds as well as to pay for labor to farm 1,5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Kolondiebla to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 110,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds and pay for labor for the farming season.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à WAKORO, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, le fonio et le mais  avec RAMATOU la personne au milieu sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 1,5 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 110 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women, who average 39 years of age with three children each; they all live in polygamous families in Wakoro in the Kolondieba municipality, one of the prefectures in Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their farming activities smoothly during the winter season. They are on their eighth loan with the institution and the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Ramatou, who is standing in the middle of the photo, grows rice, fonio and corn. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs and seeds as well as to pay for labor to farm 1,5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Kolondieba to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 110,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds and pay for labor for the farming season.

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Madame KOROTOUMOU est née vers 1958 à DIAKOROLA DIASSA,  mère de 6 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à KODIALANIDA  un village dans la commune de PIMPERNA dans le cercle de Sikasso 3ième reg ion administrative de la république du MALI.
