Cette brave femme après avoir mener beaucoup d’activité sans succès madame KOROTOUMOU s’est initiée des activités de fabrication de savon KABAKOUROUNI de façon traditionnelle. 
Elle achète des matières première au grand marché de SIKASSO plus des bois achetés à KODIALANIDA.
Après cette incorporation des matières premières pour donner un produit fini (KABAKOUROUNI) qui sera livré à la clientèle. Sa vente se fait au marché d’où elle dispose une place fixe à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso un cinquième prêt individuel commerçant. 
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat des quantités importantes des matières premières et 3 chargements de camion de bois.  
EIle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 220 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Korotoumou was born around 1958 in Diakorolo Diassa. She is mother to six children and lives with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Kodialanida, a village in the Pimperna municipality, which lies in Sikasso circle, the Republic of Mali's third administrative region.

This courageous woman, who has had many unsuccessful activities, has now begun to make Kabakourouni soaps with a traditional method. She buys raw materials at Sikasso's Grand Market and wood in Kodialanida. Once she has incorporated the raw materials to make up the finished product (Kabakourouni) this is delivered to her customers. She sells her soaps at the market - where she has a fixed stand - to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. 

With a view to satisfying the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she is requesting a fifth individual trading loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. This loan will enable her to buy a signficiant quantity of raw materials as well as three truckloads of wood. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 220,000FCFA, and this profit will enable her to repay her loan and the interest on it, as well as to put some money in her savings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making traditional soap.

loans.name: Tiessiri 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Tiessiri 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’tiesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Troisième prêt avec l’institution., les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés .
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec Koniba, arrêtée au bout et à  gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte realiser un bénéfice moyen de 170 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Tiessiri 1 group are married women, who average 48 years of age with five children each; they all live in traditional families in N'tiesso, one of the villages in Koutiala in Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their farming activities smoothly during the winter season. They are on their third loan with the institution and the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Koniba, who is standing at the end on the left of the photo, grows groundnut. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs, seeds and farming materials, as well as to pay for labor to farm and hoe a hectare of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in Koutiala to a mixed customer base. She is expecting to make an average profit of 170,000FCFA at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and hoeing as well as to buy seeds, inputs and farming equipment.

loans.name: Tiessiri 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Tiessiri 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’tiesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Troisième prêt avec l’institution., les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec Nataga, assise au bout à  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  2  hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 295 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Tiessiri 2 group are married women, who average 49 years of age with three children each; they all live in traditional families in N'tiesso, one of the villages in Koutiala in Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their farming activities smoothly during the winter season. They are on their third loan with the institution and the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Nataga, who is sitting at the end on the right of the photo, grows groundnut. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs, seeds and farming materials, as well as to pay for labor to farm and hoe two hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in Koutiala to a mixed customer base. She is expecting to make an average profit of 295,000FCFA at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and hoeing, as well as to buy seeds, inputs and farming materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to build a new roof for his home.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Khoeurn is 46 years old, a farmer, and a married woman with four children. One of her children is a garment worker, one is a construction worker, and two are students. Her husband is also a farmer. They all live in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $14 per day. Now Khoeurn would like to request a loan to buy more farmland to cultivate rice. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she wants to expand her farming, build a new kitchen, and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Mas

texts.en: Mas is a 44-year-old married woman with six children. She has been a fish seller since 2009. Three of her children are students. Her husband is a fisherman. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $20 per day. Now Mas would like to request a loan to buy firewood to resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to expand her fish selling and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla is 32 years old, a garment worker, and a married woman with a child. She has been a garment worker since 2009. Her husband is a construction worker. They live in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $10 per day. Now Phalla would like to request a loan to buy a motorbike to ride to work. This loan will help her reduce her travel expenses. In the future, she is going to renovate her house with fences around it and support her child to go to university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to ride to work

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en: Samphors is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. She has been a garment worker since 2008. One of her children is a garment worker and three are students. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. All of them live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $16 per day. Now Samphors would like to request a loan to buy cement to finish building her house. This loan will help her and her family live in better conditions. In the future, she is going to support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy cement to finish building her house

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Noeun is 59 years old, a homemaker, and a married woman with four children. Three of her children are garment workers. Her husband is a guard. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $21.50 per day. Now Noeun would like to request a loan to buy wood to build a house. This loan will help her live in better conditions. In the future, she is going to build a store for her children to sell clothes and a new concrete house.

loans.use: to buy wood to build a house

loans.name: Tin

texts.en: Tin is a 31-year-old married woman with a child. She has been a garment worker since 2010. Her husband is a construction worker. They live in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $11 per day. Now Tin would like to request a loan to buy wood to build a house. This loan will help her and her family live in better conditions. In the future, she is going to build fences around her house and support her child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy wood to build a house

loans.name: Phol

texts.en: Phol is a 60-year-old widow with an only child. She has been a silk weaver since 2008. Before that she was a farmer. Her child is a worker. They live in Takeo Province of Cambodia. They can earn approximately $10 per day. Now Phol would like to request a loan to buy a motorbike for her child to ride to work. This loan will help reduce her child’s travel expenses. In the future, she is going to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her child to ride to work

loans.name: Josue Antonio

texts.es: Josué de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él e s un joven emprendedor que se desempeña como albañil, además los fines de semana se dedica al cuido de sus cultivos de maíz y frijol. Josué desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Josué is 22 years old and lives in his own house together with his family.  He is a young entrepreneur who works as a brick layer, and on weekends he takes care of his rice and bean crops.

Josué wants to add a room onto his house so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI so that he can buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and metal.  He would also use it to pay for the necessary labor to build the room.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and metal, and to pay for labor to build a room in his house.

loans.name: Ana Aracely

texts.es: Ana de 31 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida elaborando uniformes escolares y diferentes prendas de vestir en un taller de costura. Ana desea reparar el corredor y el techo de su vivienda, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena y grava para reparar el techo y el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana, 31 years old, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 11-year-old daughter. She is a tenacious woman who earns her living making school uniforms and other clothing in a tailoring shop. Ana wants to repair the hallway and roof of her house, and for this reason she asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, wood, cement, sand, and gravel to repair the roof and the hallway of her house.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, wood, cement, sand, and gravel to repair the roof and hallway of her house.

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo eligió su nombre ya que para los miembros, el haber recibido un crédito por parte de VisionFund México fue como un milagro para invertir en sus actividades. Las integrantes del grupo son personas muy alegres pero sobretodo muy responsables. 
Abigail tiene 24 años de edad y vive en unión libre desde hace cinco años con Luis; aunque aún no tienen niños, la pareja inició su negocio para mejorar su ingreso. El papá de Abigail se dedica a elaborar cazuelas, y en un inicio ellos las compraban y revendían. Con el tiempo, Abigail también aprendió a elaborar las macetas pero ha planeado incrementar su mercancía y comenzar a pintar ella misma. “Estoy muy contenta y agradecida con Kiva y VisionFund México por la oportunidad de obtener un crédito porque así compraré macetas y figuras de yeso para decorarlas y venderlas también”. 
El obstáculo que enfrenta Abigail es no tener una camioneta lo suficientemente grande para transportar toda su mercancía porque muchas veces, cuando sale a vender a otras comunidades tiene que hacer varios viajes para llevar todas las macetas necesarias. Por otro lado, su sueño es tener un puesto fijo o un local en donde pueda vender los productos sin ningún problema aunque también le gustaría mejorar su vivienda.  
Las demás integrantes del grupo son Ma del Carmen y Araceli quienes invertirán en figuras de yeso; Feliciana, en perfumes; Guadalupe y Jesús, en la elaboración de tortillas; mientras que Lizeth y Rosalba lo harán en ropa.
*En la foto: Abigail se encuentra detrás de doña Jesús quien está vestida con un suéter azul.
texts.en:
This group chose its name since, for its members, having received a loan from VisionFund México was like a miracle to invest in their businesses. The group members are very happy people who, above all, are very responsible.

Abigail is 24 years old and has lived in a common-law-marriage for the past 5 years with Luis.  Although they don't have children, the couple started their business to increase their income. Abigail's father works making clay pots, and at the beginning, they bought and resold them. With time, Abigail also learned how to make flowerpots but she has planned to increase her merchandise and begin to paint them herself. "I am very happy and grateful to Kiva and VisionFund México for the opportunity to get a loan because then I will purchase flowerpots and plaster figurines to decorate and sell them, too."

The challenge Abigail faces is not having a truck big enough to transport all her merchandise so that many times when she leaves to sell in other communities, she has to make several trips to carry all the necessary flowerpots. On the other hand, her dream is to have a permanent retail location where she can sell her products without any problems although she would also like to improve her house.

The other members of the group are Ma del Carmen and Araceli who will invest in plaster figurines, Feliciana in perfumes, Guadalupe and Jesús in making tortillas, while Lizeth and Rosalba will invest in clothing. 

*In the picture, Abigail is found behind Jesús who is dressed in a blue sweater.

loans.use: to purchase clay and paint to make flowerpots and clay pots.

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es: Yesenia de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se desempeña como enfermera, además vende frutos cultivados en su terreno como: cocos, nance y mamey. Yesenia desea reparar el techo del corredor de su vivienda, ya que la madera está deteriorada y corre el riesgo que se desplome, es por ello que desea cambiarlo lo antes posible. Por lo anterior Yesenia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: madera y lámina para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Yesenia, 31 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and 9-year-old son. She is a tenacious woman who works as a nurse.  In addition she sells fruits grown on her land such as coconut, nanche and mamey. Yesenia wants to repair the roof of the outdoor hallway of her house, since the wood is deteriorating and runs the risk of collapsing, so she wants to replace it as soon as possible. For this reason, Yesenia asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase wood and metal sheeting to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: to purchase wood and metal sheeting to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su conyuge, en casa propia en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, en una comunidad tranquila, donde se respira bastante armonía.

Luis se dedica a las actividad de servicio de transporte en mototaxi, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, Luis presta este servicio en el distrito de Lagunas y sus alrededores, él solicita préstamo para el arreglo de su vehículo, dicha inversión le servirá para poder brindar un mejor servicio a los pasajeros, y asegurar el buen funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, para poder seguir velando por el bisnestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old and lives with his spouse in his own house in Lagunas district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department in a quiet community where there is an air of harmony. 

Luis works in the transportation sector in his motorcycle taxi, with more than 3 years of experience in the business. Luis offers this service in Lagunas district and the nearby areas. He asks for this loan to repair his vehicle. This investment will serve him to be able to offer a better service to his passengers, and assure the good functioning of his work tool, in order to be able to continue caring for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle, this investment will serve him to be able to offer better service to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an awning and tables to serve her customers better and increase her sales.

loans.name: José Ramiro

texts.es:
José de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, no le gusto la escuela por lo que su papá  le llevo a enseñarle todo respecto a la agricultura, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos.

Él se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 8 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre y madre son quienes le han enseñaron el respeto al prójimo y a sí mismo, no teniendo la oportunidad de un empleo se dedica a la agricultura. 

José ha sido un joven responsable con las tareas de la casa, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique. El trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, su padre en sus horas libres es quien le dirige en el trabajo,  su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 11:00 am.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra, hoy que viene la época de invierno, con el préstamo pagara personas quien le ayuden con los trabajos, lo demás del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos (dos sacos de fórmula, uno de sulfato y herbicidas para las malezas) para el cultivo del maíz. La necesidad satisfecha es el poder tener un capital de trabajo para iniciar, ya que la primera siembra se le perdió por falta de lluvia, por lo que sembrara de nuevo. 

Desea poder tener primero lo más necesario, aprender siempre de sus padres, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
José, 22 years old, went to school up to the 9th grade. He didn't like school, so his father brought him to teach him everything about agriculture. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings. 

He works in agriculture, and has over 8 years of working in this field. His father and mother are who have taught him to respect others and himself. Not having the opportunity for another job, he works in agriculture. 

José has been a responsible young man with the housework. He doesn't have any other jobs that he does.  The work is near his house, and he gets there by foot. His father, in his free time, is his manager. His work schedule is 6:00 am to 11:00 am.

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to prepare the land for planting, since winter is approaching. With the loan he will pay people who help him with the work, the rest of the loan will be invested in purchasing supplies (2 bags of formula, one of sulfate, and herbicides for the weeds) to grow corn. The need met is being able to have working capital to begin, since he lost the first crop for lack of rain, so he needs to plant again. 

He wants, first, to have everything he needs, and to always learn from his parents, for which he hopes to work as long as God gives him health and life.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting, since winter is approaching. With the loan he will pay people who help him with the work, the rest of the loan will be invested in purchasing supplies (2 bags of formula, one of sulfate, and herbicides for the weeds) to grow corn. The need met is being able to have working capital to begin, since he lost the first crop for lack of rain, so he needs to plant again.

loans.name: Mongtung Group

texts.en:
Mongtung is a group formed by women with similar interests to get loans so that they can buy solar home lighting for improving their personal and business purposes. Due to insufficient power supply in the area, the group members wanted the mini solar home lighting so that they can stay in better home environments everyday and perform their duties without any difficulty.

Lamngaikim (31) is a featured member of the group with her hand raised. She runs a petty shop while her husband is an auto-rickshaw driver. They generate their income from their humble occupation and sustain their family including their two school-going children. Families in the area are affected by the lack of power supply and cannot perform their duties accordingly after sunset. 

In order to run her petty shop for longer hours after sunset, she took the loan for mini solar home lighting so that she could run the shop with comfort and generate more income. This will help her to improve the family's financial condition, even though she extends her working hour in the shop for a fraction of hours. While she runs her shop in the evening, the children will study their lessons under the solar lighting with comfort and concentration. This will improve their academic performance and benefit them in their career. 

She said that the solar lighting is very beneficial to their family and improves her business. She is happy and thankful to WSDS for lending the loan to avail the solar lighting system.

loans.use: To buy solar home lighting systems

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single mother of four children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister). 

She has a business of a restaurant, and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, cooking oil, and fresh peas. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. 

She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on retail basis.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, cooking oil, and fresh peas

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is 37 years old, married, and the father of three kids. He has a vegetable field that he tends every day from very early in the morning.

Lack of water has been a big problem for all of the region for a long period. This is reason why people can't water their gardens and fields, and then  their harvest dies. He is asking for a loan 600 AZN in order to be able to supply water for his garden every month.

loans.use: to supply water for his garden every month.

loans.name: Kpi Ward No.3 Group

texts.en:
KPI Ward No.3 is a group formed by women with similar interests to get loans for buying mini solar house lighting systems that will provide them better home environments for their families after sunset since there is irregularity in the power supply in the area. They can perform their duties comfortably at home even when there is a failure in the power supply.

Lhingjoujam (30) is the featured member of the group with her hand raised and works as a private tutor at her home. She has 15 students who are in primary school. The school gets over at 3 PM and her students come for tuition classes after school at her home. The first shift of the tuition classes starts at 4 PM and the second shift at 6 PM,  after sunset. Since there are frequent shortages of power supply in the area, the children cannot concentrate on their lessons under candlelight and struggle to share and study their lessons in the dim light. It is the tutor’s duty to teach them their lesson properly so that they get better knowledge and understanding through the tuition classes. 

For their better study environment, the tutor took a solar loan from WSDS. After the solar home lighting was fixed in the house, the students were able to study their lessons with comfort, concentrate more, and were more attentive to their lessons without any disturbances of power cuts. She was happy that her students could study comfortably and was grateful to get such a loan from WSDS.

loans.use: To buy mini solar home lighting

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a  mother of nine children, seven of whom graduated from school and are working. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Monica dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: Samoun

texts.en:
Samoun (in photo) is 60 years old, a widow mother with two sons. She lives in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. One of her sons is a teacher and anther one attends school. 

Samount looks old, but she is strong enough to work. She is a weaver. 

She wants to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to school; hence she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.name: Dora Delmi

texts.es: Dora de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 24 años se dedica a la crianza de pollos, además elabora quesadillas de arroz las cuales vende de forma ambulante en su cantón. Dora desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda para lo que ya cuenta con ladrillos los cuales se observan en la fotografía, pero aún le faltan varios materiales, por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, hierro, lámina y madera para la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their 12-year-old daughter. She is a businesswoman who has raised chickens for the past 24 years. She also makes rice quesadillas and sells them on foot in her canton. 

Dora would like to build a room in her home and already has bricks, which are shown in the photograph. However, she lacks other materials so she has requested a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, iron, laminate, and wood to build a room in her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, iron, laminate, and wood to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a housewife, 30 years old, who is raising her two sons with love and care with her husband. She is from the small village of Madhya Boragari in Dhupguri, in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. Her husband is engaged in agricultural activities, and she has to look after her husband and son as well as help her husband in his work. She is a very hardworking and courageous lady. One of her sons is in grade two now. The other is too young for school. In her childhood, she did not get the opportunity to get higher education due to the poor financial resources of her parents. But she is earnestly trying to provide an education to her sons.

She and her husband cultivate different vegetables on the farm in different seasons and sell them to the market for their livelihood. Anita, being a hardworking woman, works in the field after managing her all household work. With experience in agricultural work, she has been able to get ahead despite the difficulties that have risen along the way, including rising costs of inputs and the instability of the prices for buying and selling vegetables.

As her sons have grown up and the family expenses are increasing day by day, she and her husband feel likely to further improve their agricultural activities. They have decided to cultivate paddy, which is an all-season crop, the staple food of West Bengal and in much demand throughout the year, so it will be a profitable business for her to generate income.

Currently, Anita is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, etc., to start paddy cultivation. She has a lot of faith and hopes to get ahead because her household expenses depend on this work.

Her dream as a mother is to give a good education to her sons so that they can prosper in life. With her profits, she plans to construct a decent and better house in the future.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva, for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Randi

texts.en:
Randi lives in Sukabumi, a small city in West Java located about three hours from Jakarta. Randi is married and living with three people in the family home. He runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. 

He began working with Ruma a month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit transactions

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José, tiene 33 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su esposa e hijos, en una aldea del municipio de Concepción sur Santa Barbara. Siempre  se a dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz y frijoles y hace 5 años cultiva café para vender en el mercado local.  Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 12,000 lempiras, con el cual  va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café y mejorar la cosecha.  Su  meta es sembrar una manzana más de café para que sus hijos tengan educación y mejor vida.
texts.en: José, 33 years old, is married, has 3 children, and lives with his wife and children in a village of the Concepción sur Santa Barbara municipality. He always has worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans and 5 years ago he started growing coffee to sell in the local market. He is asking for a second loan for 12,000 lempiras with which he will purchase fertilizers and supplies to care for his coffee plantation and improve his harvest. His goal is to plant an additional manzana (approximately 7000 square meters) of coffee so that his children can have an education and a better life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies to care for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Darel

texts.en:
Growing up in Georgia under adverse circumstances, Darel formed his lifelong dream of owning his own business and controlling his family’s financial health. When he saw that his uncle was able to open a successful restaurant, Darel realized that it was possible to break the cycle of financial hardship, and that entrepreneurship was the way to do it. He went to college to study business but when his son was born, he decided to put his education on hold and join the Navy to support his growing family

A week after returning from his most recent deployment, Darel visited his barbershop for his regular trim. In the course of conversation, his barber broke the news that she was selling the business as her husband had just been stationed in another state. Darel mentioned to her that his step-dad was a barber and with one thing leading to another, she offered to sell Darel all the tools and equipment necessary for him to start his own barbershop.  Pro Style Barbershop was born. 

Darel couldn’t be more ecstatic to finally be starting his own business. The first barber employed by Pro Style will be Darel’s step-dad, who is moving to town with Darel’s mother to help get the business off the ground. He has an additional barber ready to rent another of the six stations and will be having a mini job fair to fill the rest of the stations for rent. For now, Darel will keep his job with the Navy, while managing all of the aspects of his business on his off time. However, he is looking forward to eventually working there full-time cutting hair, so that he can have a more flexible schedule to spend more time with his kids.

Darel recently moved his business to a location with a more reasonable rent and is requesting a loan to pay for the flooring of the new shop. 

His advice for anyone looking to start a business: “You don’t have to be a business major or guru to live out the dream of owning a business – all you need is drive and an unwavering determination to beat all adversities.”

loans.use: to pay for the flooring of his new barber shop.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita, a rural housewife of 43 years, hails from Dhupguri.  She resides in a small house with her six-member family in a rural village named Madhya Boragari in the Jalpaiguri district in West Bengal, India. Sabita is an uneducated woman who can sign her name only.  Two of her children are in school and two are grown up and are deprived of education and unemployed.

Sabita's husband has been running a general grocery shop in their small house with items like soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, oil, lentils, etc., for many years. Sabita also assists her husband in this business after managing her household work. He started the business with a small investment of his own. His monthly net income is very small.  With this small income, it is very difficult on their part to maintain the family with the educational expenses of her children.

So to expand her husband's business for some more income, Sabita has decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to purchase items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potatoes, etc., for her grocery store. She hopes that this investment will give her more income and with enough savings, she will be able to construct a permanent cabin for her shop, provide sufficient financial sustenance to her family, and give a better education to the children.

She wants to buy lands in the future with the profit generated from the business. She will be grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her husband's grocery shop.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
Daniel de 26 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, no le gustaba mucho estudiar y se dedicó a otras actividades, en un tiempo estuvo casado pero no funciono su relación, de la cual nació su niña, quien él apoya incondicionalmente. La niña es menor de edad vive con su mamá, todas las semanas la visita,  aun no asiste a la escuela. Daniel vive solo en una casa que le aprestado una amiga.  

Él vende pan dulce y francés, le vende a una panadería que le da el 30% de la venta total, ya tiene cinco años de realizar la actividad, la necesidad de ingresos económicos y el tener que apoyar siempre a su hija en lo que necesite.

 El dueño de la panadería es amigo de Daniel,  al necesitar de empleados le propuso que trabajara con él, oportunidad que no desaprovecho, poco a poco se fue haciendo de experiencia en el trabajo por lo que hoy es un gran vendedor, no tiene más actividades a la que se dedique, la distancia que recorre diario es de unos 5 kilómetros diario , ya que vende por todos los caseríos vecinos, el recorrido lo hace en su bicicleta, solo él se dedica a la actividad, tiene un horario de trabajo de 5:00 am y 8:00 am y  por la tarde de 2:00 pm a 6:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una motocicleta para realizar las ventas y cubrir más espacio en menos tiempo, la mejora que el préstamo ara es el cumplir el sueño de poder tener su propio medio de trabajo, y con esto tener mejores ingresos.

Desea seguir poco a poco creciendo las ventas y la clientela, irse preparando desde ya económicamente para cuando su niña empiece la escuela tener una estabilidad para apoyarle en lo que necesite. Las ganancias serán dirigidas  un porcentaje al pago de la cuota y lo demás a la  inversión,  a la casa y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Daniel is 26 years old and attended school until sixth grade. He did not really like to study so he focused on other things. He was married and the relationship did not work out, but he has a daughter from the relationship and supports her unconditionally. The girl is young and lives with her mother. He visits her very week, and she does not yet attend school.

He sells sweet bread and French bread to a bakery that gives him 30% of the total sales. He has been doing this for five years. He needs the income in order to provide his daughter with what she needs. 

The owner of the bakery is Daniel's friend and, when he needed employees, he suggested that Daniel work with him. This was an opportunity that Daniel did not want to waste, so he began doing the job and is now a great salesman. He does not have any other jobs. He travels about 5 kilometers per day since he sells in all of the neighboring villages. He travels by bicycle alone. He works from 5:00 am until 8:00 am and from 2:00 pm until 6:00 pm.

He will use the loan that he has requested from CREDICAMPO to purchase a motorcycle to make his sales and cover more space in less time. This will allow him to achieve his dream of having his own form of transportation so that he can earn more money.

He hopes to increase his sales and customers little by little. He wants to prepare financially for when his daughter begins school so that he can have the stability to provide her with what she needs. His earnings will go towards paying off the loan, investments, housing, and savings.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to make sales and cover more space in less time. The loan will allow him to achieve his dream of having his own form of transportation so that he can earn more money.

loans.name: Katia Odalis

texts.es: Katia de 20 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 3 años de edad y su compañero de vida. Ella es una joven tenaz que se gana la vida gracias a su trabajo en un hogar de ancianos donde presta sus servicios domésticos. Katia desea construir un servicio sanitario abonero en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: bloques de cemento, arena, cemento, una taza de cemento y una plancha de cemento, para construir un servicio sanitario abonero en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Katia is 20 years old and lives in her own house with her 3-year-old son and her life partner. She is a young, tenacious woman who earns her living doing domestic work in the home of an elderly couple.

Katia wants to build a composting latrine by her house, so she is asking FUSAI for a loan so she can buy cement blocks, sand, cement, a cement receptacle and a cement slab to build it.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, sand, cement, cement receptacle and a cement slab to build a composting latrine by her house.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng is 63 years old, a cloth weaver and a widow with three children. She has been a cloth weaver since 2000. All of her children are garment workers. They live in Takeo Province of Cambodia. They can earn approximately $17.80. 

Now Leng would like to request a loan to buy a motor for her children to ride to work. This loan will help reduce her children’s traveling expenses. In the future, she is going to expand her cloth weaving and build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a motor for her children to ride to work

loans.name: Sokhorl

texts.en:
Sokhorl is 44 years old, a silk weaver and a married woman with four children. She has been a silk weaver since 2007. One of her children is a worker and three of them are students. Her husband is a garment worker. They all live in Takeo Province of Cambodia. They can earn approximately $13.5 per day. 

Now Sokhorl would like to request a loan to buy a plot of farmland to cultivate rice. This loan will help her earn more income from the cultivation. In the future, she wants to expand her silk weaving, build a new house, and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Rubiela De Jesus

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Rubiela es que ahora su hogar podrá tener unos ingresos extra.

Ella prepara y vende comidas y almuerzos en su propia casa en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, adicionalmente, prepara helados caseros.

Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de utensilios de cocina para mejorar la producción de sus alimentos.

Con estos elementos ella podrá trabajar de una manera más cómoda y ágil.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran restaurante bien reconocido en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Rubiela's perseverance and courage, her household can now have extra income. 

She makes and sells meals and lunches in her own house in the municipality of Medellín, a line of work that she undertook with the goal of getting more income to sustain her family, and additionally she makes home-made ice cream. 

Her husband and children are the greatest motivation she has to work every day and to put forth the effort to make each day better.

She hopes to be able to give a boost to her business with the purchase of kitchen utensils to improve her food production. 

With these tools, she will be able to work more comfortably and with agility. 

Her greatest dream is to be able to have a big, well-known restaurant in the same area so as not to lose her customers.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils to be able to work in a more comfortable way, quickly and flexibly, to improve the service she offers.

loans.name: Maria Katherine

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos de papelería y miscelánea.

Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser independiente y tener las razones suficientes para dedicarse en pleno a su negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como juguetería y una línea de dulcería.

Ella sostiene a su hijo con este negocio y es por eso que siempre procura por mantenerlo al día con todos los productos de moda.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who is always ready to face the world and have a good life due to her efforts.

She has a store where she sells paper goods and other miscellaneous goods. She would like to increase the products that she offers and increase her sales with an infusion of capital into her business. She has requested a loan to give herself the opportunity to be independent and have good reason to dedicate herself completely to her business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise that she doesn't currently have, like toys and sweets.

She supports her son with her business so she always stocks the latest styles.

She has great hopes for her business and thinks that her future can greatly improve thanks to the support from these entities that make it possible for people to dream of a better, more stable life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her toy and candy store to stock the business and increase her products.

loans.name: Merena

texts.en:
Merena is a mother two children at the age of only 19 years. She lives with her husband and children (two sons) in village Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is illiterate but her husband has a secondary education.  Her sons are too young for school.  They have a bamboo, mud and straw house.

Merena is a homemaker who looks after her household, whereas her husband Yunus has for the last few years earned a living by planting and harvesting rice. She helps her husband sowing, planting, and growing seeds. He wants to extend his business to give financial sustenance to his family

So Merena is applying for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as manure, paddy seeds, and other things. These investments will help Merena boost up her rice yield. She plans to keep investing, expanding her land, increasing her harvest, and earning more income so she can provide for her children. She also wants to invest part of her earnings in the construction of a concrete house to live in.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for their existing paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya  is a rural woman hailing from Dhupguri.  She is 47 years old and married to Digendranath.  She is blessed with two lovely sons, one of whom is a student of grade 7 and the other is grown up and unemployed. She is illiterate and unfortunate that she could not get opportunity to study due to her family's financial crisis.  They live at Kothapara, a remote region in the district Jalpaiguri.

Sandhya's husband (56 years old) is engaged in agricultural activities to earn for the household costs of his family. But his income is insufficient to cover all the expenses.  So Sandhya has been involved in the business of rearing livestock. She has been engaged in this business for the last few years to provide a financial help to her family.  She somehow developed her business to some extent through her dedication and hard work. She fattens the goats and sells their milk to the local people. Also sometimes she sells the goats to the butcher when they grow up. In this way she tries to extend her helping hands to her husband to run the family. However, owing to a lack of capital, she is not in a position to take the full advantage of her knowledge of rearing livestock.

That is why she seeks a loan from BJS to utilize as working capital.  The loan will help her to purchase more goats for her business. It will help Sandhya to construct a concrete made house and allow her children to continue their education.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase goats for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Rodolfo de 59 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 20 años se gana la vida como albañil logrando tener una buena clientela por su desempeño. Rodolfo desea construir un muro a media altura con malla ciclón en la parte superior, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, malla ciclón y postes para construir un muro con malla ciclón en la parte superior.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 59 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. He is a hardworking man who has worked as a bricklayer for the past 20 years and has a good customer base due to his hard work. 

Rodolfo would like to build a medium-height wall with chain link fence in the back of his home, so he has requested a loan from FUSAI to purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel, chain link fence, and posts.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel, chain link fence, and posts to build a wall with a chain link fence in the back.

loans.name: Wilber Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Wilber desde muy joven se dedico a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y ganadería, actividades que le enseño su padre para su supervivencia.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la ganadería y el alquiler de caballos para cabalgatas, actividad con la que intenta ganarse la vida y progresar.

Tiene como objetivo aumentar su capital comprando lotes de ganado y caballos que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos y es esta la razón por la que solicita un préstamo.

Es padre responsable y amoroso con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposa.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien.
texts.en:
Since he was very young, Wilber has worked in rural jobs such as agriculture and animal husbandry, work his father taught him for his survival.

These days, his primary work is animal husbandry and renting horses for horseback rides, a line of work from which he intends to earn a living and progress.

He has as a goal to increase his capital, purchasing lots of cattle and horses which will permit him to stock up and to generate more income and this is the reason he asks for a loan. 

He is a responsible and loving father to his children, and lives on a farm with them and his wife.

He dreams of being able to provide his children with a quality education so that in the future they can provide for themselves and be independent. 

Every day, he works in his business and manages to do things very well.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and horses to continue with his work and be able to provide his children with a good education.

loans.name: Dede

texts.en: Dede runs a small stall selling mobile accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments. Dede lives in Cianjur , a semi-urban area about four hours from Jakarta, with his wife. Dede joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income and grow his business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business. As his business is growing, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, a mother of two, lives in Kitale, Kenya. She has been farming for six years in the northern part of the Rift Valley. Her primary income source comes from selling milk. She also sells eggs and maize from her farm. To meet the high school fees and expenses at the beginning of school terms, she ventures into other small businesses. There is nothing she enjoys more than a good harvest! However, poor weather has adversely affected the harvests of many farmers from this region. 

She ventured into dairy because milk production is not as affected by poor weather as maize farming is.  Emily is seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. She has seen the benefits of a dairy animal, and she wants to expand her asset base. With the additional cow, Emily will be able to repay the loan with ease and realize more income to pay her children’s school fees. At the moment, Emily is really focused on improving her farming activities. Through the loan she will be able to completely turn around her life and she projects that after two years, she will start a big dairy shop in the local market. Emily waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea de Concepción del Sur, Santa Bárbara. Blanca trabajaba anteriormente en al elaboración de sombreros de Junco, hace 5 años decidió por comenzar otro negocio de  cría y engorde de cerdos para vender. El préstamo que esta solicitando es el segundo ciclo y es por 10,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar vitaminas y concentrado para alimentar los cerdos y hacer crecer el negocio. Su plan es ampliar el corral para tener más cerdos y con los ingresos darles educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Blanca is 38 years old, lives in a common-law marriage with her husband, with whom she has 4 children, and lives in a village of Concepción del Sur, Santa Bárbara. Blanca previously worked making reed hats. Five years ago, she decided to start another business raising and fattening pigs to sell. The loan that she is requesting is the second loan cycle and is for 10,000 lempiras, with which she will purchase vitamins and concentrated feed for the pigs and to grow her business. Her plan is to expand the corral to have more pigs and with the income, provide an education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and concentrated feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Adytyo

texts.en: Adytyo lives in Bogor, a city located about 1 hour from Jakarta. He is a hard-working young man who lives with three family members in the family home. Adytyo runs a small stall that sells mobile phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. To build his business, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Adytyo is standing in front of his small stall.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Satijah

texts.en: Satijah is a housewife who lives with four family members in their family home in Jakarta. Satijah and her husband manage a small stall that sells women's clothing and mobile airtime credits. She has started selling mobile airtime credits and processing bill payments since she began working with Ruma. As the business continues, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable her to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help her run the mobile airtime business and consequently support her plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. In the photo, Satijah is sitting in her small stall.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on the weekends.

loans.name: Ruby Yajari

texts.es:
Ruby tiene 19 años, ella es madre soltera y es muy conocida en el medio, por su servicio de elaboración de cajitas para los dulces típicos de Zaña. Vive en casa familiar con su madre y pequeño hijo; tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos; y vive en una comunidad ubicada a 42 Km de Chiclayo, conocida por sus ruinas y sus dulces típicos. Habitada por gente respetuosa, que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería, está en la regiónd e Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Ruby se dedica a la fabricación de cajas para dulces típicos de Zaña, desde hace más de 02 años aproximadamente, Adicionalmente se dedica a prestar servicio como ayudante de cocina por zona de residencia; ella necesita el préstamo para invertir en arreglo de casa, lo que le brindará seguridad a su unidad familiar asi como una calidad de vida mejorada.
texts.en:
Ruby is 19 years old, she is a single mother and is well-known in the area for her service making the little boxes for the traditional candies of Zaña. She lives in her family house with her mother and small son, she has good references from her neighbors, and lives in a community located 42 km from Chiclayo, known for its ruins and its traditional candies. It is inhabited by respectful people who work in trade, agriculture, and animal husbandry, it is in Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú. 

Ruby has worked making boxes for the typical candies of Zaña, for approximately the past 2 years.

In addition, she works as a kitchen assistant in the area where she lives. She needs the loan to invest in repairs of her house, which will bring security to her family and also, in turn, an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in fixing her house, which will offer her family security.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cows so he can increase sales

loans.name: Ulduza

texts.en: Ulduza is 47 years old, married and a mother to 5 sons. Ulduza is an IDP person (internally displaced person) and she lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region. Her husband is a driver. His salary is not enough to cover the family needs, and because of that Ulduza is growing vegetables and fruits on her small plantation to earn additional income. She has been doing this for 20 years. Her sons help her in this business. She is asking for the support of KIVA lenders because she wants to introduce potatoes, as a different crop this season. She needs a loan of 1500 AZN to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds of the highest quality to plant. This will help diversify the income of her household and stop depending only on bean crops to support the needs of her children and get ahead. This is going to be her 3rd loan and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds for a potato crop.

loans.name: Ilonya

texts.en:
This nice lady is 68 years old and she lives with her beloved husband in Vanazdor, in the Lori region. Her name is Ilonya and she has a higher education with a specialty in pedagogue (teaching). Ilonya worked in this field for only 6 years. She was a teacher of geography at the school. Then for 10 years she worked as an accountant. Now she is a commandant at the private organization. Ilonya lives with her retired husband who is 73 years old. Their only son is in the Russian Federation where he lives and works. As Ilonya says, she greatly misses her son and she dreams of the day when their son will be back and finally get married.
Since Ilonya’s son still has no opportunity to return, Ilonya asks for this loan in order to buy a computer to get in touch with their son with the help of the Skype computer program. As she says, her delight will be great when she can manage both to talk and to see her son.

loans.use: to buy a computer to get in touch with their son with the help of the Skype computer program.

loans.name: Zamhoi Inn Group

texts.en:
The group Zamhoi Inn was formed by those women who have common interest to get a mini solar home lighting loan. The members are from an area that faces insufficient power supply. It hampers their daily activities, especially after sunset.

Lhingboi, 30, is the featured member (with her hand raised) who lives with her husband and four children. They have three school-going children at home. Both of them work at a quarry in the river bed to sustain their family. 

The family needed solar lighting at home since there is irregular supply of power in their area. It hampers their daily duties after sunset. Lhingboi took the solar loan so that the children will not be disturbed during their study hours after sunset and at the same time she and her husband will also do the household chores and do their business without any problems. 

She said that they are now living in a better home environment compared to the life before they had the mini solar light. She has been grateful to WSDS to avail her the loan, which made a difference in their lives.

loans.use: To buy mini solar home lighting.

loans.name: Ahoi In Group

texts.en:
The group Ahoi In was formed by women with similar interests in getting a loan to buy mini solar home lighting systems so that their families stay in comfort even when there is a shortage in power supply in the area after sunset.

Tingvah, 45, is the featured member of the group (with her hand raised) who is a daily wage earner. Both she and her husband work as a daily wage earners and have been supporting their family with their humble income. They have five college-going children who are diligent in their studies. They have been supporting their children’s education with much financial difficulty in the hope that they will get government jobs in the near future and will be able to support their parents. 

Due to frequent failure in power supply in their area, the study hours of the children are disturbed in the evenings and at night. They cannot study their lessons according to their desire and have to shorten their study hours due to frequent power cuts. 

Since they got the solar home lighting system, the children do not face problems during their study hours anymore and are able to study without any problems and with comfort. As the mother works outside the house during daytime, most of the household chores need to be done mostly in the early morning and evenings. She is also able to perform her household chores with comfort and better environment after dusk. She said it was all thanks to WSDS for lending them such a loan that helped them to live a comfortable and fulfilling life.

loans.use: To buy a mini solar house lighting system.

loans.name: Jajang

texts.en: Meet Jajang. Jajang is a father of two who lives with four people in the family home in Sukabumi, West Java. Jajang works as an employee in the local education sector. His wife is a full-time housewife. To support his family, Jajang runs a small stall that sells office stationery and consumer products. He joined Ruma and tried out the mobile airtime business. Since then, he became more aware of how mobile technology can support his business. As his business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan to use as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. In the photo, Jajang is standing in front of his stall.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, la razón por lo que no continuo fue por no haber más grado donde él estudiaba, ya que para ir hasta la ciudad incurría en gasto y no habían condición económicas para poderlo hacer. Se casó a los 24 años, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, de sus dos hijos la niña de 17 años está estudiando bachillerato en el pueblo, el niño de 11 años estudia cuarto grado en la escuela de la comunidad. 

Él trabaja como vigilante de seguridad en una empresa de maquinaria pesada, ya tiene cuatro años de ser empleado en  el mismo lugar. Sus empleadores lo estiman por sus honestidad y responsabilidad ya que el trabajo requiere de esos dos fundamentos. Anterior a ser empleado se dedicaba a la agricultura. El trabajo le queda a dos km de retirado, su medio de transporte es una bicicleta. Él hace turnos de 24 horas corridas, por lo que descansa lo mismo.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar mercadería para poner una mini tienda, lo que comprara es productos de primera necesidad, como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, etc. La mejora que el préstamo ara es el poder iniciar una fuente de ingreso extra, la que será su esposa quién la atienda.  

Sus sueños a futuro, son que sus hijos puedan prepararse en el estudio, que no corran la misma suerte que él, también espera que la tienda le dé resultado, y con las ganancias poder pagar la cuota e invertirle más al negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old. He went to school up to the ninth grade, and the reason he didn't continue was because there weren't any further grades where he went to school, and because to go to the city would have incurred another cost and there weren't the economic conditions to allow it.  He married at age 24, his wife takes care of the household tasks, and of his two children the girl is 17 years old and is studying in the secondary school in the village. The boy is 11 years old and in the fourth grade in the community school.  

He works as a security guard at a heavy machinery business and has been an employee in the same place for four years. His employers value him for his honesty and responsibility since this work requires these two fundamentals. Previous to being employed, he worked in agriculture. His job is two km away, and his mode of transportation is a bicycle. He works 24 hour shifts, so he rests there, too.

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase merchandise for a small store. He will purchase basic necessities such as beans, rice, sugar, etc. The majority of the loan is to be able to start a source of additional income, and his wife will tend the store. 

His dreams for the future are that his children will be able to prepare themselves in school, that they don't have the same fate as him, he also hopes that the store will profit, and with the earnings he will be able to make the payments and invest more in the business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to set up a small store. He will purchase basic necessities such as beans, rice, sugar, etc. The majority of the loan is to be able to start a source of additional income, and his wife will tend the store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 29-year-old single mother of two children aged 13 and 10 years respectively. She sells popcorn to clients in her area. She also sells gas cylinders, which has been a lucrative business for her as well, and she is able to make a monthly income of  12,000 Kenya shillings.

Betty has applied for her second loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to buy more maize for making popcorn, as she is currently running low on stock. She hopes to use the income generated to further expand her business. 

In the future, she would like to be a major supplier of popcorn and be able to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: to buy maize for preparing and selling popcorn

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.en: Rahmat is a married man who lives with his wife and his child in Sumedang, West Java. Rahmat's wife is a fulltime housewife. To support his family, Rahmat realized that he needs to find another source of income. Rahmat met one of Ruma's staff from his friend and he decided to try out selling mobile airtime. As the business is continuing to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Hildegarde

texts.en:
Hildegarde is a married woman from Leyte, Philippines. Hildegarde has three young children who are now attending school. 

Hildegarde runs a sari-sari or retail store business in her place. Hildegarde's business was affected when a typhoon hit the country several months ago. As of now, she has just started to rebuild her business again. Hildegarde is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, eggs, flour, soap, shampoo and toiletries. With this, she will be able to increase the inventories of her store, which will attract more buyers. 

In the future, Hildegarde hopes to make her business a success. In addition, Hildegarde hopes to save enough money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira was born in 1993. She is a hardworking and smart woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is a student of the Khujand State University. She graduated with a bachelor's degree.  

Now, she is going to continue her education for getting a master's degree. She studies well and hopes she is a good specialist in the future. She must pay for tuition but she has not enough money for it. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Alex Henis

texts.es:
Alex tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene tres hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; la cual está ubicada en una zona rural del Caserío Las Delicias S/N - Oyotún, provincia de chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Alex tiene su mototaxi en la cual brinda el servicio de transporte; hace 10 años, y él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de llantas y sistema de arrastre para su mototaxi, para poder asegurar el buen funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, ya que es mediante esta que da sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Alex is 36 years old. He is married and has three children. He lives in his own home, located in a rural area of Caserío Las Delicias in Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque, on Perú's northern coast.

Alex has a mototaxi and provide transportation services. He has worked in this business for 10 years and requests a loan to invest in fixed assets. He will purchase tires and a towing system for his mototaxi to ensure that it functions well since it is the way that he supports his family.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets (tires and towing system for his mototaxi).

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own sari-sari (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Olivia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 50,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know of her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Olivia hopes that her business will continue to cover her everyday needs and that she will always be able to help her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items needed in her business.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 42 years old and she lives in Stepanavan city of the Lori region, Armenia. She is a pedagogue with 22 years of pedagogical experience. She graduated from the Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute. She is married and she has two children, both of whom are school-aged. Her husband works at the Stepanavan State Agricultural College as a lecturer. Now Gayane works at the school as a teacher of Armenian History. She also gives paid private courses at her flat and as she says, all her pupils pass the entrance examination successfully and with good results.

Gayane planned for a long time to do this purchase but she never managed to spend her saved money on anything other than her family needs, now this loan finally will help her to realize her plan to buy a computer and professional literature.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, los estudios los realizo en la escuela de su comunidad, por las mañanas trabajaba y por las tardes se dedicaba a sus estudios. Esta soltero, aún no ha decidido formar su propia familia; vive con sus padres y hermanos en casa.


Él trabaja como cocinero en el ingenio chaparrastique, cuenta con 5 años de dedicarse al mismo trabajo en ese lugar. El trabajo lo aprendió por medio de un amigo quien ya trabajaba en el lugar, entro a trabajar como asistente de cocina, con el tiempo fue aprendiendo todo lo relacionado a la cocina, por lo que luego ascendió a cocinero titular. Antes de ser empleado le apoyaba a su papá en los trabajos de la agricultura. La distancia que recorre para su trabajo es de unos 40 km, por lo que solo los fines de semana viaja a casa, el horario de trabajo es de las 6:00 am a 6:00 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitado a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar  un molino de nixtamal para ponerlo a funcionar en la casa de su papá, ya que en el caserío donde viven no hay un servicio de esto, por lo que espera que le dé un buen resultado. La necesidad satisfecha será el poder innovar con un nuevo servicio en la comunidad.
	
Sus sueños son el poder continuar con su empleo y con esto ayudar a sus padres, ya que él es el único que les apoya económicamente, espera que el molino le dé resultado y con esto ir cubriendo las cuotas del préstamo.
texts.en:
Juan, 25 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade. He studied in the community school, in the mornings he worked and in the afternoons he studied. His is single, still has not decided to create his own family, and lives with his parents and siblings at home. 

He works as a cook at the Chaparrastique sugar factory. He has been working for 5 years in the same place. He learned the work from a friend who already worked in this place. He started working as a kitchen assistant, and with time learned everything related to cooking, so then he was promoted to the job of cook. Before being employed, he supported his father in the agricultural work. The distance that he travels to his work is some 40 km, for which he only goes home on the weekends. He works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.

The loan that he is asking from CREDICAMPO is to purchase a corn flour mill to set up in his father's house, since in the small village where they live, there isn't this type of service, so he hopes that it will turn a good profit. The need met is to be able to innovate with a new service in the community. 

His dreams are to be able to continue with his employment and, with that, to be able to help his parents, since his is the only one who supports them economically. He hopes that the mill will profit well and, with this, will cover the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase a corn flour mill to run in his father's house, since in the small village where he lives, there isn't this type of service, for which he hopes that it will profit well. The need met will be to innovate with a new service in the community.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene un negocio muy bonito que es de cultivo y comercio de flores, ella es madre soltera y sus 2 hijos tienen 7 y 10 años de edad,  son 5 años que Maribel se dedica al cultivo de estas plantas, ella compra sus plantas cuando están pequeñitas y luego cuando ya están grandes las vende, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de todo tipo de flores,  la aspiración de Maribel es incrementar su negocio con más variedad de productos  para mejorar sus ingresos y darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos que actualmente están estudiando.
texts.en: Maribel has a very nice business which is growing and selling flowers. She is a single mother with 2 children who are 7 and 10 years old. For 5 years, Maribel has worked growing these plants. She purchases the plants when they are very small, and then when they are big, she sells them. The loan will be invested in purchasing all sorts of flowers. Maribel's aspiration is to expand her business with a greater variety of products, to increase the income and give her children, who are currently students, everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase plants.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine knew that her partnership with Kiva would be continued after her first very profitable deal last year. She feels great and still runs her trading business at the Sevan city wholesale market. She sells women's and children's clothes, also school-bags and shoes for children. 

Karine says that now her business brings a little bit less profit than it brought in spring, but she surely knows that it is connected with summer holidays since people leave the city to spend their holidays in the countryside or abroad, but with the coming of autumn months, she will have great sales. 

Karine lives with her son in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Her husband is still abroad and he greatly manages to support his family during these  months when his wife’s business is less profitable.
 
Karine is a very clever businesswoman and she is sure that this Kiva loan will help her to buy a lot of women's autumn season clothes and especially a new assortment of clothes and bags for school-age children.

loans.use: to buy a lot of women's autumn season clothes and especially a new assortment of clothes and bags for school-age children.

loans.name: Libertad

texts.es:
Libertad tiene 29 años de edad, ella vive en casa familiar de material rustico, con sus tres menores hijos; en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Libertad es la venta de postres en general como mazamorra, arroz con leche, flan, gelatina, asi como tambien la venta de refrescos. El destino del crédito será para ivertir nuevos postres asi como bebidas gaseosas y compra de utencillos con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia ya que para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Libertad is 29 years old, lives in the family house made of rustic materials, with her three young children, in a rural zone in Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the Peruvian mountains. 

The work that Libertad does is selling general desserts such as mazamorra (cornmeal pudding), arroz con leche, flan, jello, and also selling soft drinks.  The loan will be used to invest in new desserts and soft drinks and to purchase utensils with which she will generate more income and, in turn, be able to improve her quality of life, since in this line of work there isn't any bigger competition and with that she will get better prices.

loans.use: to invest in new desserts and also soft drinks and to purchase utensils with which she will generate more income and, in turn, be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Jose Luis Romulo

texts.es:
