texts.en: Zahida, age 31, is a married woman. She has been providing laundry services for many years in her locality. She makes enough through her business to bear her household expenses. Over time she has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation, and she has a regular list of customers. To meet the orders of her customers, she needs to purchase a new dryer machine, along with packs of washing powder. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new dryer machine and washing powder.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and air-conditioner.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 34-year-old lady. She has been successfully running a small general store in her house. Her father-in-law also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and healthcare. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, oil, tea and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and aspires to save some income for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, oil, tea and beverages.

loans.name: Artsvik

texts.en:
Artsvik is engaged in agriculture and cultivates various vegetables and fruits. She cultivates beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, eggplant, zucchini, radishes, and greens. She also has apple and peach trees and several plum and pear trees. She sells her garden’s harvest through the re-sellers or in a wholesale market. 

Artsvik lives with her big family of six: her husband, her two sons, daughter-in-law, and two infant grandchildren (in the photo). The requested loan of 1,000 USD is very important for Artsvik to purchase polyethylene cover and six heaters for the greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene cover and heaters for the greenhouse

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek is a student from Hovtashen village of Ararat region. He studies at Yerevan State Conservatory after Komitas in the vocal department. 
This will be Narek's second loan from Kiva. He used the first one to pay for his tuition fee for the first semester .

This time he asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to pay for the second semester's university tuition. As a very responsible borrower, Narek hopes for lenders' support one more time.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition of the second semester

loans.name: Roberto Enrique

texts.es: Roberto es un hombre de 41 años de edad quien habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 13 años y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Roberto posee un taller de bicicletas y motocicletas el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer desde hace 25 años. Tiene muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Roberto desea reparar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI  para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: lámina galvanizada, madera, polines y clavos. De esta forma espera brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is a 41-year-old man who resides in his own home along with his 13-year-old daughter and 6-year-old son. He has a workshop where he repairs bicycles and motorcycles. With great effort, Roberto established this business 25 years ago. He has many customers each day who prefer to do business with him.

Roberto wants to repair the roof of his house, so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will invest in the purchase of needed materials such as galvanized sheets, wood, beams, and nails. As a result, he hopes to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials in order to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Priscilla a wife, a mother, and a farmer with 14 years experience in mixed farming. She lives in Kitale, Kenya, together with her five children on a small piece of land that she inherited from her parents. Priscilla completed high school thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents, but never advanced. This never killed the spirit she has for succeeding in life. 

Through mixed farming she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbours. She passionately loves poultry farming and as she likes to say “poultry is close to my heart”. Although this humble and ever smiling mother has been making profits selling poultry she faces challenges of lack of funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and expand her poultry farming. 

She is requesting for a loan to buy poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Priscilla has enough poultry feed that is maize to give the poultry energy and green grams to give the poultry proteins and this will assure increased productivity. 

She chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that she can have access to quality loans at an affordable interest rate. Through the loan she will improve her living conditions and not only benefit from profits but she will get chicken manure. She will save a lot of cash that could have been spent on buying fertilizers. This loan will be a turning point in Priscilla’s life since she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks and other food stuffs. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a marketable area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks and food stuffs. Her business goal is to have many businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks and food

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen has successfully built her business sewing clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to purchase raw materials. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a new sewing machine with some stitching materials such as spools of threads and ribbons. This will enable her to stitch up more dresses on time to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some stitching materials such as spools of threads and ribbons.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is 47 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Nagina’s husband who is a driver by trade and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason Nagina has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Nagina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and an air-cooler.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza lives in Arbat village with her husband and two children: son Gnel, age 33 and Anahil, a 24-year-old daughter.

Tereza is a farmer who is highly skilled in animal breeding and land cultivation.  She has a cow and a pig and also cultivates potatoes, wheat, cucumber, haricot and grains. 

Her husband and children help her with the farm work.  Money they make from agriculture helps the family have a stable income during the year.  So it is very important for Tereza to increase he earnings. 

She asks for this loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and to cover labor costs.  The loan will be of great support to Tereza and she is very grateful for that.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and cover labor costs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. At present she has three buffaloes. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Lirio Blanco Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Lirio blanco, está conformado por señoras solidarias y preocupadas por su bienestar económico. La coordinadora es la señora Jaqueline de 49 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos quienes son su motivo de superación; se dedica a vender ropa nueva y el crédito lo solicita para invertir en mercadería para hacer crecer el negocio como es camisetas, talladores, pantalón  para damas, blúmer, brazier, tobilleras, talladores, etc. La segunda socia es la señora Flor de 28 años, se dedica al negocio de venta de tortillas y frijoles cosidos en su domicilio. La tercera socia es la señora Adela de 22 años de edad y se dedica a vender plata, cosméticos y distinta artesanías en diferentes lugares, en universidades y en el mercado del municipio. Y la cuarta socia es la señora Odili de 53 años de edad quien se dedica a vender ropa desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Lirio Blanco” (White Iris) consists of supportive women who are concerned about their financial well-being. The group coordinator is Sra. Jaqueline. She is 49 years old, single, and the mother of two children who motivate her to get ahead. Jaqueline sells new clothes, so the loan she is requesting will be invested in merchandise to grow her business. These items include T-shirts, tank tops, women’s slacks, underwear, bras, anklets, and other items.

The second member is Sra. Flor, age 28. She sells tortillas and cooked beans from her home.

The third member is Sra. Adela, age 22. She sells silver, cosmetics, and different handicrafts in various places such as universities and the town market.

The fourth member is Sra. Odili, age 53. She has been selling clothes for four years.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mediko

texts.en:
Mediko is 53 years old who lives with her brother in the Tskaltubo district.  

Her brother has a retirement pension.  Mediko runs an agricultural business. In particular, she has a plot of land, where she grows trees and vegetables to sell. 

Mediko decided to start her husbandry business and requested a loan.  The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2000 gel to purchase cows.  

Mediko will start producing cheese to sell locally. This will increase her monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and sewing machine.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man with two children. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.  He has been in business for six years. 

Michael's business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public.  He describes his biggest business challenge as insecurity. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle.  His business goal is to own a motor vehicle within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be happy. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.ru: Махди работает охранником в своем районе Шахритус. Он женатый молодой человек, ему 25 лет. Махди решил улучшить финансовое положение семьи и поэтому планирует параллельно с работой начать собственный бизнес. Он давно интересуется овцеводством. И теперь думает момент настал для начала этого бизнеса. Он немного накопил сбережение и еще недостающую сумму просит в кредит. По словам Махди овцы неприхотливые животные и их разведение не трудоемкое дело. Поэтому он уже верит в успешность своего бизнеса и с нетерпением ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Mahdi is a married young man of 25 who works as a security guard in the Shahrituz region. He has decided to improve his family's financial situation and therefore plans to start his own business as a secondary source of income. He has been interested in keeping sheep for a long time and thinks that it's a good time to get into this business. He has some money saved and is requesting a loan for the remaining amount he needs. In Mahdi's words, sheep are undemanding animals and caring for them is not a time-consuming task. Therefore he believes his endeavour will be successful and eagerly looks forward to support.

loans.use: to buy and sell sheep and rams

loans.name: El Malinche Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario El Malinche II, lo integran tres socios perseverante en sus metas lo que los ha llevado a triunfar en sus negocios, es coordinado por la señora Patricia de 41 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos a su cargo, se ha dedicado a la venta de frutas, en es especial lo que es el tamarindo, este negocio lo impulso hace diez años y tiene tres años de estar trabajando con los financiamientos que le brinda la institución y ha demostrado ser una socia responsable, la socia asegura ha sido de mucho beneficio, debido a que le permite comprar las cosechas y comercializarlas al detalle, lo que le permite aumentar sus ganancias además que le ha permitido cubrir parte de los gastos familiares, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de tamarindo, pues es el producto que más demanda tiene por parte de la población. Otro de los socios es la señora Fátima quien tiene la edad de 29 años y comercializa frutas en la municipalidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosecha de aguacate y tamarindo, y el señor Cristoffer quien tiene la edad de 26 años y se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, además es chequeador de taxi.
texts.en:
The solidarity group El Malinche II is made up up three members who are perseverant in accomplishing their goals, which has led them to be successful in their businesses.

The group is led by Patricia, a 41-year-old married woman with two children in her care, who has had a business selling fruit (especially tamarind) for ten years.  She has been receiving financing from this institution for three years and she has demonstrated that she is a responsible member.  She confirms that she has benefitted a lot from the loans, since they allow her to buy crops and sell them retail, allowing her to increase her profits as well as cover a part of the family expenses.  She is asking for the loan to buy a tamarind crop, since it is the product that has the largest demand among the population.  

The other group members are 29-year-old Fátima, who sells fruit in the town and will use the loan to buy avocado and tamarind crops, and 26-year-old Cristoffer who sells nacatamales and works as a taxi verifier.

loans.use: to buy a tamarind crop

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Meet Annah, a small-scale farmer in Kitale, Kenya. She owns a small piece of land where she lives with her five children. For the last 14 years, she has been growing maize on the piece of land. She has managed to make a living selling the maize grains to millers after the harvest. She is also involved in other small personal businesses to make extra money. 

Recently, Annah started keeping poultry for fun. She liked the fact that she could wake up in the morning and collect eggs for her family's breakfast. She started looking at poultry as a business when she had more hens and surplus eggs for breakfast. She started selling eggs to neighbors. More neighbors kept coming wanting more and more every day. 

Annah seeks a loan to purchase poultry. She can hardly meet the demand as it is today. Her major challenge is raising funds. She was, however, referred to Juhudi Kilimo, Kiva's field partner, by a well-wisher. With your loan, Annah will grow her poultry business to the next level. The extra income will meet her high business-related costs. The loan will help her family improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
For the last five years Eunice has been in the crop farming business as well as managing a retail shop where she sells a variety of goods to her customers. She earns a monthly income of KES.10,000 which she uses to support her family.

Eunice is applying for a first loan KES.15,000 from Vision Fund Kenya and she intends to use the entire loan amount to buy seedlings, fertilizers for her farming activity, and also add more retail goods like sugar, rice and paraffin to her store inventory. The profit made will be used to pay school fees for her children.

In future she plans to grow her business and have a big shop. She is 47 years old, married, and a mother of three children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and also add more retail goods like sugar, rice and paraffin to her shop inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a generator and table.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy and populated area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy  a motorcycle. His business goal is to own a transport company within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life.

loans.use: to  buy  a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, a table, a generator, and fabric.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con sus dos menores hijos de 14 y 16 años los cuales cursan secundaria en colegio nacional; él vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz, dicho distrito esta en la región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza es la compra, crianza y venta de ganado caprino, adicionalmente también trabaja transportando pasajeros por mototaxi, cuenta con unidad propia. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de ganado caprino y arreglos a mototaxi con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 42 years old, lives in his own house made of rustic material with his two children, ages 14 and 16 years old, who are studying in the public secondary school. He lives in the rural part of this district, and has water and electric services. This district is in Piura region, on the northern coast of Perú.

The work he does is purchasing, raising, and selling goats. In addition, he also works transporting passengers by motorcycle taxi, and has his own vehicle. The loan will be used to invest in purchasing goats and making repairs on the motorcycle taxi which will generate more income and, in turn, allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of goats and to repair a motorcycle taxi which will generate more income and, in turn, allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Enalvis

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva Enalvis compró víveres, y activos fijos necesarios para el funcionamiento de su negocio. Su negocio mejoró porque pudo ampliarlo y por la tasa de interés menos costosa que le ofreció Kiva. Desde que recibió su credikiva, obtuvo mas utilidades se incrementaron sus ventas mejoró la calidad en su atención a los clientes y la vida y el bienestar en todo su grupo familiar. Hoy día Enalvis pide a sus financiadores que  "sigan apoyando la ilusión de cada empresario para salir adelante". Actualmente está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará una fotocopiadora e impresora  y víveres, para seguir ampliando su negocio lo que hace de su credikiva una buena inversión.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Enalvis purchased supplies and fixed assets that were necessary for the functioning of her business. Her business improved because she was able to expand it, and because of the less costly interest rate offered by Kiva. 

Since she received her Kiva loan, she earned more profits and her sales increased; she improved the quality of her customer service, and the life and well-being of everyone in her family. 

Today, Enalvis is appealing to her lenders so that “They might continue to support every entrepreneur’s dream of moving forward”. Currently, she is applying for a new loan, with which she will purchase a photocopier-printer and supplies in order to continue expanding her business, which makes her Kiva loan a good investment.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier-printer and supplies.

loans.name: Dolrose

texts.en: Dolrose is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own an electric sewing machine within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her child. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells water tanks. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are of all types. 

Elvis describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more water tanks to sell. His business goal is to own a lorry within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more water tanks to sell

loans.name: Maria Nelza

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su tres hijos de 15, 14 y 3 años de edad, en casa propia de material rustico, en una comunidad pequeña de 50 familias, ella se lleva bien con todos los miembros de su comunidad, es natural del Caserío El Frayle del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza María es la cría y comercialización de animales menores(patos, gallinas cuyes), los mismos que cría en el corral ubicado en su domicilio, se dedica a esta actividad hace 10 años y hace 5 años cultiva maíz, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, sus animales los comercializa todos los jueves y domingos que es día de plaza en el distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo, donde se reúnen criadores, compradores de todo el distrito y sus caseríos, donde cliente oferta sus productos y animales. El destino del crédito será para compra de gallinas y patos, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder diversificar su stock de animales, lo que le permiti´ra aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias asi como su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old and lives with her three children, 3, 14, and 15 years old, in her own home.  Their house made of rustic materials is in a small 50-family community. Maria gets along well with all the members of her community.  She is a native of Caserio El Frayle, in the district Santo Tomas de Cutervo, region of Cajamarca, in the highlands of northern Peru.  

Maria's work is growing and selling ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs, which she raises in a pen at her home.   She has been doing this work for 10 years and growing corn for five years.  Maria has a lot of experience in this field of work.  She sells her birds and animals every Thursday and on Sundays.  Sunday is market day in the district of Santo Tomas de Cutervo.  On Sundays, those who raise birds and animals, as well as buyers from the whole district and its villages,  gather for the sale of products and animals.  

The purpose of the loan is to buy chickens and ducks.  With their purchase, Maria will have a better income because she can diversify her stock for sale, which will let her improve her earnings and thus the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks to raise and sell so she can improve the quality of life for herself and her family

loans.name: Kyedala

texts.fr:
Mme KYEDALA est mariée et mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 06ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 01personne en charge.
Mme vend de l’eau minérale,  du jus, des gâteaux et des pagnes (divers) depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne en ville.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de farine, 01bidon d’huile et 01sac de sucre pour faire les gâteaux.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une moto et un terrain (parcelle).
texts.en:
Mme Kyedala is married and the mother of two children. The older is six years old and the younger is a year old. One of them attends school. Mme Kyedala is also responsible for one other person. She has been selling mineral water, juice, small cakes and lengths of colorful African cloth for six years. She buys her supplies in the town. 

Mme Kyedala wants to buy one sack of flour, one tin of oil, and one sack of sugar to make the cakes. With her profit, she wants to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to buy a small motorcycle and a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of flour, 1 tin of oil, and 1 sack of sugar to make little cakes.

loans.name: Geovany Edemilson

texts.es:
Geovany de 33 años de edad,  estudio hasta quinto grado, poco le gusto la escuela por lo que a temprana edad se dedicó a trabajar la agricultura junto a su papá, está acompañado, decidió formar su familia a la edad de los 24 años, su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa y como madre también está al pendiente de sus hijos. La niña de 8 años asiste al jardín de niños, el varoncito a un no asiste. En el terreno donde viven también viven  los papas de Geovany.  

Él  es vendedor,  se dedica a vender pan horneado (pan dulce y francés), tiene más de cinco años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual aprendió dedicándole tiempo y por medio de un amigo que también vendía pan, el de la panadería necesitaba otro vendedor y Geovany aprovecho la oportunidad.  Anterior a ser vendedor trabajaba la agricultura. El recorrido que realiza es un promedio de 30 km en cada jornada, ya que realiza dos una en la tarde de 2:00 pm a 6: 00 pm y la otra por la mañana de 5:30 am a 9:00 am, su medio de transporte en el que realiza el trabajo es una motocicleta.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para reparar su equipo de trabajo, ya que es indispensable el que este en buenas condiciones para realizar su actividad, cambio de amortiguador, cambio de llantas, entre otros pequeños ajustes. Las necesidad satisfecha será el poder tener un buenas condiciones su motocicleta  y con esto no perder día de trabajo y también lo que es más importante evitar un accidente.

Los sueños a futuro son comprar una motocicleta  nueva, también poder seguir trabajando de buena forma como lo ha hecho hasta hoy, espera cuidar siempre de sus hijos y estar pendiente de su familia, el préstamo le ayudara a satisfacer algo muy urgente para su trabajo y seguridad.
texts.en:
Geovany is 33 years old. He went to school up to the fifth grade, but disliked school, so at a young age he started to work in agriculture with his father. He is partnered, and decided to start a family at 24 years old. His wife takes care of the household tasks and, as a mother, she also also cares for her children. The 8-year-old girl attends a kindergarten, and the little boy doesn't go to school yet. On the land where they live, Geovany's parents also live. 

He is a salesman, working to sell bread (pan dulce and French bread), and has been working in this job for over five years. He learned it by taking the time time and through a friend who also sells bread. The baker needed another salesman, and Geovany took advantage of the opportunity. Prior to being a salesman, he worked in agriculture. He travels an average of 30km each day, since he does two trips, one in the afternoon from 2:00 pm-6:00 pm and the other in the morning from 5:30 am-9:00 am. His mode of transportation for his work is a motorcycle.

The loan he is requesting is to repair his work equipment, since it is essential that it be in good condition to do his work, to change the shocks and change the tires, among other small adjustments. The need met will be to be able to have his motorcycle in good condition and, with this, not miss a day of work, and also, more importantly, avoid an accident. 

His dreams for the future are to purchase a new motorcycle, also to continue working in good form as he has up to now.  He hopes to always care for his children and attend to his family, the loan will help him take care of something very urgent for his work and safety.

loans.use: to repair his work equipment, since it is essential that it be in good condition to do his work, to change the shocks and change the tires, among other small adjustments. The need met will be to be able to have his motorcycle in good condition and, with this, not miss a day of work, and also, more importantly, avoid an accident.

loans.name: Eliberto

texts.es: Eliberto, tiene  48 años de edad, está casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro.  El se dedica a la compra y venta de frijol y maíz, este negocio lo tiene hace 16 años en su casa y el mercado. Siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad donde compra y vende al por menor y mayor. Actualmente solicita el cuarto ciclo de préstamo que es por 10,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de 4 cargas de  frijoles para venderlos a mejor precio y obtener ganancias. Su idea es mantener el negocio y darle lo mejor a su familia e hijos.
texts.en: Eliberto is 48 years old, married, has 2 children, and lives with his family in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. He works buying and selling beans and corn. He has had his business for 16 years in his house and in the market. He always has worked in this business where he purchases and sells retail and wholesale. He currently is requesting his fourth loan cycle, which is for 10,000 lempiras. This money will be invested in the purchase of 4 loads of beans to sell them at a better price and get profit. His idea is to maintain the business and give the best to his family and children.

loans.use: to purchase 4 loads of beans to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and sewing machine.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, cooking fat, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, cooking fat, flour and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, cooking fat, flour and other items.

loans.name: Asunción Arnulfo

texts.es:
Asunción de 52 años de edad, es un hombre que solo estudio segundo grado, ya que en ese tiempo no existían centros de estudio cerca de donde él vivía y le tocaba viajar muy lejos. Él es casado y su esposa se dedica a trabajos domésticos. Es padre de 5 hijos. La 1ra está en Estados unidos, la 2da está acompañada y vive en la ciudad, la 3ra está acompañada y también vive y trabaja en la ciudad, la 4ta estudia 9no grado y la 5ta estudia séptimo grado. 

Asunción se dedica a trabajar como albañil, pero su actividad más fuerte es de siembra de granos básicos,  siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo. Como agricultor casi toda su vida la ha dedicado a esta actividad y como albañil lleva alrededor de 6 años de laborar, el aprendió albañilería porque antes trabajaba con un ingeniero como  ayudante  de albañil o auxiliar; así fue adquiriendo experiencia en la actividad hasta convertirse en albañil, también el lugar donde trabaja como agricultor le queda a unos 30 minutos a pie de su casa y cuando trabaja de obrero es variable la distancia y generalmente se transporta en bus. Su esposa es quien se involucra indirectamente en las actividades llevándole sus alimentos a tiempo.

El préstamo que esta solicitado, es para comprar 3 quintales de fórmula,  6 quintales de sulfato, un galón de herbicidas y con el resto pagara mano de obra que ayude a realizar las actividades, el crédito mejorara su calidad de vida ya que, por el momento es la única actividad que realiza, con ello sacara su cosecha parte de  ella la dejara para el consumo de su familia y el resto podrá venderlo.
El sueño de Asunción es que sus cultivos produzcan para mejorar la economía de su familia, por otra parte quiere comprar un lote de terreno,  esto lo va lograr con la ayuda que tiene de su hija que está en USA, y ayudar a sus otras hijas para que puedan salir adelante con sus estudios y que si ellas quieren puedan logar una profesión.
texts.en:
Asunción is 52 years old. He only studied until second grade since there weren’t any study centers nears his house and he had to go a long distance to attend to one. He is married and his wife dedicates to the house chores. 

He is father of 5 children. The oldest one is in the U.S., the second one lives with her life partner in the city, the third one also lives with her life partner in the city and also works there, the fourth one is currently in ninth grade of school and the younger one is in the seventh grade of school. 

Asunción is a construction worker, but his main activity is the sowing of staple grains, like corn, beans and sorghum. As a farmer, he has dedicated most of his life to this activity, and has been a construction worker just for about 6 six years. He learned this last activity because he used to work with an engineer as a construction worker’s assistant. This way he began to gain some experience in the activity until he became a construction worker. 

The place where he works as a farmer is 30 minutes away from his house. He goes there by foot, but when he works in construction, the distance may vary and generally must use a bus for transportation. His wife participates indirectly in his activities by getting him his food to the site where he is sent to work.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy 3 quintals of fertilizer, 6 quintals of sulfate, a gallon of weed-killer, and with the rest of the money he will pay for the labor to help him with the activities. The loan will improve his quality of life, since at the time it is the only activity he is performing. Part of the harvest will be for his family’s consumption and he will sell the rest.

His dream is to make of these crops something productive to improve the family’s finances. On the other hand, he wants to buy a plot, which he will get with the help of his daughter living in the U.S. He also wants to support his daughters with their studies, and if they wish to, continue with their studies until getting a professional degree.

loans.use: to buy 3 quintals of fertilizer, 6 quintals of sulfate, a gallon of weed-killer, and pay for labor to help him in the farming activities.

loans.name: Dalila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cada día, tras haber tomado un energizante cafecito caliente, Dalila del Carmen inicia a ordenar y a limpiar los productos de su pulpería,  para que los clientes al entrar a realizar sus compras siempre estén en un ambiente agradable. Es una mujer amable, trabajadora y emprendedora. Tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene  dos hijas, una de cuatro años y otra de 10 meses de nacida. Desde los 13 años ha trabajado en la pulpería junto a su mamá, pero al irse del país, ella quedo a cargo del negocio familiar. Es su primer negocio y expresa que ha sido todo un reto, pero con el apoyo de toda su familia ha logrado salir adelante. 
Dalila solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos, como arroz y frijoles; también, aceite, condimentos, verduras, frutas, refrescos, gaseosas, golosinas, productos de aseo personal, entre otros.  Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que anhela ganar más clientela y al mismo tiempo generar más ingresos de manera que pueda invertir en la educación y salud de su familia y así se desarrollen con éxito en la sociedad. Agradece el apoyo económico que le brinda su mamá y su esposo, lo que ha sido un pilar importante para su crecimiento. Es una mujer con muchas metas establecidas, una de ella es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, para hacer más grande la pulpería, al mismo tiempo iniciar otro negocio, venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Every day, after having had an energizing cup of hot coffee, Dalila del Carmen begins to organize and clean the products in her general store, so that the customers who come in to make their purchases are always in a nice environment. She is a friendly, hard-working and enterprising woman. She is 28 years old, married, and has two daughters, one is 4 years old and the other is 10 months old. For the past 13 years she has worked in the general store with her mother, but when her mother left the country, she was left in charge of the family business. It is her first business and she has said it has been quite a challenge, but that with the support of her entire family, she has managed to get ahead.

Dalila asks for a loan to increase the production of her capital. She needs to purchase basic grains such as rice and beans, and also oil, seasonings, vegetables, fruits, cold drinks, soft drinks, snacks, and personal hygiene items, among others. She puts her confidence in the loan, since she desires to earn a larger customer base and at the same time generate more income so she can invest in her family's education and health and, in turn, develop with success in the society.  She is grateful for the economic support that her mother and husband have offered her, which has been an important pillar for her growth.  She is a woman who has set many goals, some of which are to improve the infrastructure of her house, to expand the general store at the same time to start another business, selling clothing.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains such as rice and beans, and also oil, seasonings, vegetables, fruits, cold drinks, soft drinks, snacks, and personal hygiene items, among others.

loans.name: Tiessiri 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Tiessiri 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’tiesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Troisième prêt avec l’institution., les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés .
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec Awa Boli, assise au bout à  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  ½ hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Tiessiri 6 group are married women, who average 37 years of age with three children each; they all live in traditional families in N'tiesso, one of the villages in Koutiala in the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can succeed in their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Awa Boli, who is sitting on the end at the right in the photo, grows peanuts. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs, seeds and small farming tools, as well as to pay for plowing and weeding to maintain half a hectare of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold right in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed customer base. She is expecting to make an average profit of 100,000 F CFA at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seed, inputs, agricultural tools, and fees for weeding.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 64 años de edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, ya que por la zona donde vivía no se escucha hablar de escuelas, por lo que desde la infancia se dedicó a los trabajos agrícolas, se casó a la edad de los veinte y cinco  años, a procreo 5  hijos con su pareja, su esposa es ama de casa, ella es la que se encarga de las labores del hogar, sus hijos mayores  viven aparte, solo el 23 años está con ellos, quien le ayuda con los trabajos que realiza.

Él es agricultor, tiene más de 50 años de realizar la actividad, su padre desde pequeño le enseño que la vida solo se vivía bien, si trabajaba honradamente, cuando alguien lo busca que le ayude a trabajar también lo hace, la distancia que recorre es variable ya que no siempre va al mismo lugar, cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás para el consumo, su hijo es quien le apoya siempre con los trabajos, la actividad la hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 md.

El proyecto que realizara es comprar una novilla que esta por parir, con lo que mejorara sus activos  y podrá ampliar la producción y tendrá más ingresos alimenticios a su hogar, podrá dar un paso de desarrollo para  él y su familia.
 
Desea que sus hijos sigan sus pasos, que no se desvíen por el camino del mal. También quiere seguir trabajando mientras tenga salud. Espera siempre poder apoyar a su esposa en la vejez.
texts.en:
Juan, 64 years old, did not have the opportunity to go to school because in the area where he lived, no one talked about schools, so from his young childhood, he worked in agricultural tasks. He married at twenty-five and has had 5 children with his wife. His wife is a housewife, she is in charge of all the household tasks. His older children live on their own, only the 23-year-old son lives with them, who helps him with the work he does. 

He is a farmer, and has done this for more than 50 years. His father, since he was little, taught him that a life is only a good life if one works honestly, when someone seeks him out to help with the work, he also does it. The distance he travels is variable since he doesn't always go to the same place. When he collects the harvest, he sells some and keeps the rest to eat. His son is who always helps him in his tasks, and he does the work in the mornings from 6:00 am -12:00 noon.

The project that he is doing is to purchase a pregnant heifer, with which he can improve his assets and expand his production and have more food income for his household; he will be able to take a step for the development of himself and his family.  

He wants his children follow in his footsteps, that they don't go down the wrong path. He also wants to continue working while he still is healthy. He hopes to always be able to support his wife in old age.

loans.use: to purchase a pregnant heifer, with which he can improve his assets and expand his production and have more food income for his household; he will be able to take a step for the development of himself and his family.

loans.name: Maryuri Del Rosario

texts.es:
“La educación os hará libre” dijo José Martí, frase que identifica a Maryuri y su trayecto por conseguir su título de Licenciatura en inglés. Esta joven de 22 años de edad, se levanta todos los sábados, desde hace cuatro años, para acercarse más al sueño de conseguir su título universitario, sueño que no pudo lograr un año atrás debido a la falta de recursos económicos. Eso no es todo, esta joven emprendedora no solo quiere aprender, también le encanta enseñar, por lo que durante las semanas trabaja como docente de educación rural, desde hace seis meses.  
Maryuri decidió estudiar una licenciatura en inglés, porque considera que es un lenguaje muy importante para poder comunicarse con las personas extranjeras, debido a que es conocido como el idioma universal. Además que para ella es un medio de trabajo. Ya todo está listo para que esta joven trabajadora sea oficialmente conocida como licenciada, lo único que hace falta un paso, por lo que solicita un préstamo para poder pagar el título universitario, pues cuenta con el respaldo de su padre como agricultor y de su madre como ama de casa. Ella asegura que con este título podrá ser aceptada en cualquier institución como docente. Su plan es desarrollarse profesionalmente, seguir aprendiendo y enseñando cada día más.
texts.en:
"Education will make you free,” said José Martí, a phrase that identifies with Maryuri and her path to get her degree in English. This 22-year-old young woman has gottn up every Saturday for the past 4 years to get closer to her dream of receiving a university degree, a dream that she couldn't achieve last year due to a lack of economic resources. This isn't all, this young entrepreneur doesn't only want to learn, she also loves to teach, so during the week, she has worked as a teacher in rural education for the past six months. 

Maryuri decided to study for a degree in English since she believes that it is a very important language to be able to communicate with foreigners, since it is known as a universal language. In addition, for her it is a means of work. Now everything is ready for this hard-working young woman to officially be known as someone with a university degree, the only thing she lacks is one step, for which she asks for this loan, to be able to pay for the degree, since she has the support of her father who is farmer and of her mother who is a housewife.   

She confirms that with this degree, she can be accepted in any school as a teacher. Her plan is to develop herself professionally, and to continue learning and teaching more each day.

loans.use: to pay for a university degree.

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es: En el año 1984, Astrid mujer casada y madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 19 a 25 años, emprendió su iniciativa de negocios de confecciones; Ella toda su vida vio a su madre dedicarse a la costura de ropa y por eso aprendió y cuando cedió generar ingresos,  revisó lo que conocía y organizó su taller de confecciones, continuando con la herencia cultural en este oficio. Astrid hoy en su taller realiza todas las operaciones del proceso: diseño, preparación, corte, ensamble y acabado de piezas, más la comercialización entre vecinos y amigos que han conformado un grupo de clientes fijos. Su meta es mejorar la imagen del negocio, para  incrementar sus inventarios de materias primas, pero su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiación que le permitan alcanzar su propósito. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará telas, hilos, pellon, botones,  con los cuales solucionar las debilidades de su negocio, mejorando sus inventarios, lo cual es la razón de éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
In 1984, Astrid, a married woman with three children between 19 and 25 years old, started her dressmaking business venture.

All her life, she saw her mother work in sewing clothing and so she learned. When she needed to generate income, she looked over what she knew and organized her dressmaking shop, continuing the cultural legacy of the trade.

Today in her shop, Astrid carries out all the processing operations -- design, preparation, cut, assembling and finishing pieces -- plus commercialization among neighbors and friends, who have formed a group of regular clients.

Her goal is to improve the appearance of the business in order to increase her inventory of raw materials, but her greatest challenge is to finding sources of financing that allow her to achieve her intent. This is the reason she is turning to a Kiva credit, with which she will buy fabric, thread, interfacing and buttons to solve the weaknesses of her business, improving her inventory.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, interfacing and buttons.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado, tiene 5 hijos, vive con su familia en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años, la producción la vender en el mercado local como su fuente de ingresos. ha solicitado varios prestamos, actualmente solicita el doceavo ciclo y es por 25,000 lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de 24 sacos de abono para fertilizar sus cultivos y pago de mano de obra. su objetivo es obtener ingresos para apoyar a sus hijos en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Hector is 48 years old, married and has 5 children. He lives with his family in the town of Morazán, Yoro. He dedicates to the sowing of staple grains, like corn and beans. He has performed this activity for the last 12 years. His incomes come from selling the product in the local market. 

He has requested several loans, and now he is going for his twelfth loan for the amount of 25,000 lempiras. He will use it to buy 24 sacks of manure to fertilize his crops, and pay for labor. His objective is to obtain enough incomes to support his children in whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy 24 sacks of manure to fertilize his corn and bean crops, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es: Argentina, tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 2 hijos, vive con sus hijos en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. Hace 6 años decidió dedicarse a cultivar café, maíz y frijol. Esta producción la vende en la misma zona o en el mercado local. Ella solicita el quinto ciclo de préstamo y es por 15,000 lempiras, este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abonos para asistir su finca y cultivos y con una parte va cancelar un saldo de deuda que tiene pendiente. El propósito es poder fertilizar sus cultivos para sacar mejor producción y obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
Argentina is 45 years old, and she is a widow. She has two children, and she lives with them in a small village within the municipality of Taulabe, Comayagua. Six years ago she decided to grow coffee, corn, and beans; and she sells this production within the same zone, or in the local market. 

She is requesting a fifth loan, of 15,000 Lempiras.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of compost in order to care for her land and her crops, and she will use part of it to pay off the balance of an outstanding debt that she has.

The goal is to be able to fertilize her crops in order to get better production and earn income.

loans.use: to purchase compost in order to fertilize her land and crops, and to pay off the balance of an outstanding debt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of fruits for making juices

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna lives in Ghukasavan village with her husband, mother-in-law and three children. Anna and her husband help each other on the farm since they know that working together ensures that they will earn a decent income. They are involved in pig breeding. Currently the farm includes 10 pigs and 15 piglets. The requested loan of USD 1500 is very important for Anna to purchase special forage for feeding pigs. She is sure that this loan will be productive and profitable for her pig breeding business and her hopes for enlarging it.

loans.use: to pay for special forage for feeding pigs

loans.name: Tiessiri 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Tiessiri 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’tiesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Troisième prêt avec l’institution., les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés .
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec Lidi, arrêtée au bout à  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Tiessiri 7 group are married women, who average 36 years of age and have on average 6 children. They all live in traditional families in N'tiesso, one of the villages of Koutiala, third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can succeed in their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Lidi,  who is stooping on the end at the right in the photo, grows peanuts. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs, seeds and small farming tools, as well as to pay for plowing and weeding to maintain one hectare of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold right in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed customer base. She is expecting to make an average profit of 170,000 F CFA at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seed, inputs, agricultural tools, and fees for weeding.

loans.name: Rebeccah

texts.en: Rebeccah is a married woman. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells maize and charcoal. Her business is located in a semi urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of maize and charcoal. Her business goal is to start another business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to improve  her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize and charcoal

loans.name: Dora Eleticia

texts.es:
Dora de 29 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, en la escuela de la comunidad, eran bastantes hermanos, por lo que los ingresos eran muy invertidos en la alimentación.  Está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen dos hijos que viven en casa, solo la que tiene nueve años estudia su segundo grado, la otra niña pasa en casa con Dora.

Ella tiene uno negocio de venta de pupusas, desde hace tres años, su madre le enseño el oficio, por lo que decidió poner en práctica lo que había aprendido, no tiene otra actividad a la que se dedique, el local donde hace las pupusas lo tiene fuera de su casa ya que está a orilla de calle y es un lugar muy céntrico, ya que transita toda la gente de la comunidad. Le paga a una hermana que le ayuda todos los días, el horario de trabajo es de 2 pm a 9 pm. 


Este préstamo es para cancelar lo que tenía pendiente de la deuda y el resto para terminar de cancelar una refrigeradora que seco al crédito en una comercial, la cual la necesita para tener el quesillo, chicharon, bebida y la comida de la casa, ya que siente que está cancelando demasiado interés. La mejora que el préstamo ara es el poder pagar menos intereses y en menos plazo. 

Los sueños que tiene son  poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que les dará una mejor estabilidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dora, at 29 years old, studied until sixth grade in the school in her community. She had many siblings, therefore the income was very invested in feeding everyone. She is with someone and her partner works in agriculture. They have two children that live at home, and just the nine year old studies in second grade. The other daughter stays at home with Dora. 

She has had a business selling pupusas for three years. Her mother taught her the position, and she decided to put what she learned into practice. She does not have another activity that she dedicates herself to. The locale where she makes pupusas is outside the house since she is on the edge of the street and it is a very central place since everyone in the community passes through. She pays her sister who helps her every day. The work schedule is from 2 pm until 9 pm. 

This loan is to settle what she had remaining of her debt. The rest is to finish paying off a refrigerator that she got from a loan in a business, which she needs in order to have the cheese, crackling, drinks and the food for the house, as she feels that she is accumulating too much interest. The improvement that this loan will make is the power to pay less interest and in fewer installments.  

The dreams that she has are to be able to always increase her sales and with this to have better income, with which she will give her children greater stability.

loans.use: to settle what was remaining of her debt and the rest to finish paying off a refrigerator that she got from a loan in a business, which she needs to have cheese, crackling, drinks and food for the house since she feels that she is accumulating too much interest. The improvement that the loan will make is the ability to pay less interest and in less installments.

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es: El señor Fernando es un hombre emprendedor de 46  años de edad, casado y padre de tres hijos de las edad de 19, 14 y 8 años, quienes han sido su motivación para su superación, es propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años, este negocio lo impulso de los ahorros que tenía, pues anteriormente trabajaba de jardinero, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos en la compra y venta de los productos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar, plátano verde, plátano maduro, tomate, queso, pan, gaseosas, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, caja de jabón, etc., es primer ciclo que el socio presta en la institución y una de sus metas es ampliar su negocio ofreciendo productos que aún no tiene en su negocio  y que la población demanda.
texts.en:
Sr. Fernando is an enterprising man. He is 46 years old, married, and the father of three children (ages 19, 14, and 8) who are his motivation to succeed. Fernando is the owner of a store in his home, which he has managed for the past four years. He started this business with his savings.

Fernando previously worked as a gardener. With the help of his wife and children, he buys and sells his products. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy rice, oil, green plantains, ripe plantains, tomatoes, cheese, bread, sodas, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, cases of soap, and other products. This is the first loan he has received as a member of ADIM.

One of his goals is to expand his business by offering products that he still does not have and that are demanded by the public.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, green plantains, ripe plantains, tomatoes, cheese, bread, sodas, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, cases of soap, and other products.

loans.name: Esfuerzo De Mujer Group

texts.es: Esfuerzo de mujer es un  grupo solidario que lo integran tres microempresarios trabajadores y que luchan cada día para ofrecerle el pan de cada día a su familia, este grupo es coordinado por la señora Ana quien tiene la edad de 37 años y acompañada, su negocio es la venta de leña en su comunidad, este es un producto que es de utilidad y tiene mucha demanda por parte de la población, por tal razón la socia solicita el crédito para invertir en fletes de leñas, y así cubrir la demanda que tiene este producto. Los otros socios son el señor Erick de 30 años de edad, quien elabora flores arteriales y el crédito lo invertirá en materiales como es plástico, alambres, moldes, etc., y la señora Johana quien tiene la edad de 34 años y es comerciante de frutas en la municipalidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de nancite y aguacate.
texts.en:
'Esfuerzo de Mujer' is a solidary group made up of 3 hardworking small-business owners who strive every day to bring home the daily bread to their families. This group is coordinated by Ana, who is 37 years old and married. Her business is selling firewood in her community. This is a product that is useful and is in high demand in the town. For this reason, Ana is requesting a loan to invest in bundles of firewood and thus meet the demand that this product has. 

The other members are as follows: 
• Erick, 30, makes artificial flowers. His loan will be used to invest in materials such as plastic, wires, molds, etc. 

• Johana, 34, sells fruit in the municipality. She is requesting a loan to buy nancite [a small, yellow Central American fruit] and avocados.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood.

loans.name: Sadbarghon

texts.ru: Садбаргхон жительница сельской местности. Садбаргхон  43 года, у нее 3 детей. Садбаргхон  с раннего возраста начала заниматься торговлей и в начале ей приходилось трудно так как не было начального капитала. Она выходила на поле и работала наемной рабочей за небольшие деньги, которых едва хватало на то чтоб прокормить семью. Постепенно она смогла повысить свой товарооборот и обеспечить свою семью. Сейчас Садбаргхон занимается продажей одежды и разных мелочей для повседневного использования. Садбаргхон   хочет дать свои детям образование, чтобы в будущем они не мучились как их мать. На данный момент у нее упал товарооборот и ей нужны деньги чтоб повысить его. С данной проблемой Садбаргхон   обратилась в «Арванд» за помощью и надеется ее получить. На полученные деньги Садбаргхон хочет закупить товар для своего бизнеса, одежду, нижнее белье, и прочие принадлежности для быта. Садбаргхон   выражает огромную благодарность Арванд за предоставленную помощь малоимущим слоям населения.
texts.en: Sadbarghon lives in a rural area. She is 43 and has three children.  She has been involved in retail since a young age, though it was difficult for her at first because she did not have start-up capital. She began working for barely enough money to feed her family, but she was gradually able to increase her sales and provide for them. Sadbarghon currently sells clothing and various items for everyday use. She wants to give her children an education so that they will not suffer like their mother. At the moment her inventory is running out and she needs money increase it. She applied for a loan with Arvand and hopes for help with this problem. Sadbarghon wants to purchase inventory items for her business such as clothing, underwear, and other everyday items. She is thankful for Arvand's assistance to the poor.

loans.use: to buy retail inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a generator, a table and an iron.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane is an experienced farmer from Masis town. Her family consists of her husband and two children (a son who is an army officer and a daughter). Gayane works in a local company as an inspector. All the family works hard to earn a living. Gayane is engaged in aviculture and in cultivation of tomatoes, garlic, and grass and takes care of the vineyard. Her husband and son sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Gayane needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase fertilizer and wire for the grape orchard. Gayane and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and wire for her grape orchard

loans.name: G.s Los Agricultores Group

texts.es:
Don Mariano, tiene 64 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene 1 hijo y vive con él en una aldea del municipio de Cofradía, Cortes.  Siempre se ha dedicado a  la agricultura, lleva 20 años de producir y cultivar maíz y frijoles,  ha solicitado un préstamo por 2,500 lempiras para compra de abono y limpieza para darle  mantenimiento a los cultivos de maíz y frijol y poder sacar una buena ganancia, cosecha y crecer. Su meta es mantener el negocio y cultivar otros productos. 
Este grupo se llama Los Agricultores, formado por 4 miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma zona. El préstamo grupal es por 12,500 Lempiras que lo invertirán en el mantenimiento de los cultivos. En la foto a la izquierda esta Mariano, Jesús, José y Oscar a la derecha.
texts.en:
Don Mariano is 64 years old, single, and has 1 child who lives with him in a small village in the town of Cofradia, Cortes. He has always made a living in agriculture. He has spent 20 years producing and harvesting corn and beans. He is requesting a loan for 2,500 lempiras to buy fertilizer and to clear the fields  in order to maintain his corn and bean crops. Also so he will be able to earn a good profit and harvest and to grow. His goal is to maintain his business and grow other crops. 

This group is called The Farmers and is made up of 4 members that making a living in agriculture and live in the same area. The group loan is for 12,500 Lempiras. They will invest it in the maintenance of their crops. In the photo from left to right is Mariano, Jesus, Jose, and Oscar.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay to clear the fields in order to maintain his crops

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself as spiritual. She operates a retail business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located in a busy market area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be infrastructure problems especially during the rainy season. She will use the KES 98,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be able to buy two lorries packed with maize every week within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her eighth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of utensils and basins

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is an experienced agronomist from Goris, Syuniq region. She lives with her elderly pensioner husband. To take care of her family, Mareta has been engaged in agribusiness for more than eight years. She is involved in cattle breeding and breeding pigs. Currently, she keeps 18 mother pigs and some hens. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Mareta needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 3,000 will help this hardworking woman and her family a lot by enabling her to purchase two mother pigs and grass as forage for the livestock and pay for renovation of the barn. As this is Mareta’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Mareta and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two mother pigs and forage for the livestock and to renovate the barn

loans.name: Santos Domingo

texts.es:
Santos de 38 años de edad, es un hombre que no estudio, cuenta  que sus padres lo mandaban, le exigían que fuera a clases, pero a él  no le gustaba y no quiso ir. Él es casado y su esposa se dedica a trabajar en la elaboración de petates. Es padre de tres hijos, la 1ra de ellos estudia 4to grado, la segunda estudia 2do grado y el 3ro estudia kínder, con él solo viven sus hijos y su esposa.

Santos se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, también a la siembra de granos básicos, es una actividad que realiza desde que era niño como no quiso estudiar decidió seguir las huellas de su padre que es agricultor, él fue quien le enseño el trabajo y a comerciar con ganado se dedica desde hace 5 años aprendió esta actividad ya que antes trabajaba como ayudante de un comerciante y poco a poco fue despertando interés por el negocio y fue así como decidió lanzarse a ello. Ahora es él quien se encarga con los trabajos y quien trabaja fuerte para sacar adelante a su familia ya que su padre sufrió una enfermedad que lo ha dejado imposibilitado. 

 El lugar donde trabaja en la agricultura le queda a media hora a pie, y al trabajar en el comercio se moviliza a comprar los animales a unos 15 km, a veces se transporta a pie y a veces en carro, los horarios varían según la actividad que realice. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar dos vacas productoras de leche, con lo que ayudara al sustento de su familia, ya que teniendo producción no incurrirá en gastos en lácteos, además podrá vender parte de la producción con lo que mejorara las condiciones económicas
El sueño Santos es comprar más ganado para repasto y al tenerlo en buenas condiciones sacarlo a la venta para sacar ganancias y hacer crecer de esta manera su negocio. Para sus hijas desea que estudien hasta donde ellas quieran, de ser posible que coronen una carrera universitaria, para que ellas en el futuro tengan una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Santos, age 38, is a man with no studies. He says that his parents used to send him to school but he never liked it, and so he didn’t attend to. He is married and his wife works making petates (woven mats made out of strips of palm leaves). 

He is father of 3 children. One of them is in fourth grade, the other one in the second grade, and the youngest is in kinder. He only lives with his children and his wife.

Santos buys and sells cattle, and also works sowing staple grains. It is an activity that he has done since he was a kid. Since he never liked going to school, he decided to follow the steps of his father, who is a farmer. He was the one that taught him the job. 

He has trade cattle for the last 5 years, and he learned this activity from a business man he used to assist. He slowly began to show some interest for the business until he finally decided to go on his own. Now, he is the one in charge of the work, and the one that works hard enough to support his family, since his father suffers a disease that makes him unable to contribute.

The place where he works as a famer is 30 minutes away going by foot. When he works trading cattle, he has to go and buy the animals to a place located 15 kms away. Sometimes he goes by foot, and sometimes he goes by car. His schedule changes depending on the activity he has to perform.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy two dairy cows, which will help to support his family. By having his own production, he won’t have to spend on dairy products. Besides, he will be able to sell part of the production which will benefit his economic conditions. 

Santos’ dream is to buy more cattle for grazing, keeping the animals in good conditions, sell them to get some profits and in this way improve his business. For his daughters, he wishes they can study all that they want, if possible to finish a university career, so in the future they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en: Caren is a married woman. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, soap, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of soap, sugar, and other items. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Tiessiri 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe Tiessiri 8 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de46 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’tiesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Troisième prêt avec l’institution., les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés .
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec Fatoumata, arrêtée au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  2  hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de260 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Tiessiri 8 group are married women, who average 46 years of age and have on average 5 children. They all live in traditional families in N'tiesso, one of the villages of Koutiala, third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can succeed in their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution and the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Fatoumata, who is in the middle in the photo, grows peanuts. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs, seeds and small farming tools, as well as to pay for plowing and weeding to maintain two hectares of land. Her produce will be sold right in the village and in Koutiala, after the harvest, to a mixed customer base. She is expecting to make an average profit of 260,000 F CFA at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, inputs, agricultural materials, and fees for weeding.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells sweets, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a market area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, sweets and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, sweets and other items

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es: Hace 2 años Ayda, mujer de 57 años de edad, llegó a su retiro jubiloso y la empresa donde trabajaba  la pensionó; ella mujer muy activa,  decidió no quedarse con los brazos cruzados  (desocupada)  y por eso emprendió su negocio con sus ahorros,  mediante el cual  hoy comercializa ropa, accesorios femeninos y para el hogar, entre otros artículos de interés de las familias. Ayda trabaja 12 horas diarias,  para aumentar cada vez más la calidad de vida de su familia,  conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 19, 28 y 32 años. Su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiación, para mejorar la imagen de su negocio, incrementando sus inventarios. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar ropa y accesorios que incrementen su oferta, y lograr mejorar con este crédito las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en: Two years ago, Ayda, a 57-year-old woman, joyfully retired and the company where she worked gave her a pension. Being a very active woman, she decided not to stand idly by (unoccupied) so she started her business with her savings. She now sells clothes, women's accessories, and household accessories, among other items of interest to families. Ayda works 12 hours every day to improve her family's quality of life, which consists of her spouse and their 3 children, ages 19, 28, and 32. Her greatest challenge is obtaining financing in order to improve her business's image and increase her inventory. This is why she is requesting a Credikiva, the first loan she's had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy clothes and accessories to increase the items she offers and improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Tiessiri A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Tiessiri A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 54 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’tiesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec Moussokoro, arrêtée au bout à  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  2  hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Tiessiri A group are married women, who average 54 years of age and have on average 2 children. They all live in traditional families in N'tiesso, one of the villages of Koutiala, third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can succeed in their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their first loan with the institution.

Moussokoro, who is stooping on the end at the right in the photo, grows peanuts. With her loan, she is planning to buy inputs, seeds and small farming tools, as well as to pay for plowing and weeding to maintain two hectares of land.
