Once harvested, the produce will be sold right in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed customer base. She is expecting to make an average profit of 165,000 F CFA at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seed, inputs, agricultural materials, and fees for weeding.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a single man. He describes himself to be opportunistic. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial problems. He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to have a supply firm within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en: Astghik is an agronomist from Aknalij village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, her retired father-in-law and two infant children. With the help of her family members, Astghik is engaged in cultivation of greens, grass, cucumber, eggplant, and tomato and keeps the vineyard. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Astghik needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and wire for the vineyard and pay labor costs. It will help her maintain and develop her agribusiness. Astghik and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticide, wire for her vineyard and labor costs

loans.name: Meri

texts.en: Meri is an experienced agronomist from the village of Griboyedov in the Ararat region. Meri is involved in agriculture. She lives with her husband and little son. Her husband helps her in selling the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is an important source of the family's income and plays an essential role in their lives. Meri cultivates tomatoes, cucumber and watermelon. Now she and her family want to expand the cultivation of the fruits and vegetables. A loan of $2,000 will be a great support for the hardworking family for purchasing fertilizer, pesticide, and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. They rely on the lenders' support to gather the needed amount of financial resources and to continue their hard work.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticide, and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse

loans.name: Kouboalem Group

texts.fr:
Mme ADISSA est la responsable du groupe KOUBOALEM. Sur la photo, sa voisine de droite tient sa marchandise. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme fait la coiffure et vend des gâteaux  depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques. 
Mme veut s’acheter 01sac de farine de blé et 01bidon d’huile de 20l pour faire ses gâteaux.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mme Adissa is the representative from the group called Kouboalem. In the photo, her neighbor on the right is holding her merchandise. Married, she is the mother of three children. The oldest is 13 and the youngest is 5. Two go to school. She is supporting four persons. 

Mme Adissa has been doing hair-dressing and selling little cakes for 13 years. She buys her supplies in shops. She wants to buy one sack of wheat flour and one jerrycan of 20 liters of oil to make her cakes. 

She wants to reinvest her profit in her business. Her ambition is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of wheat flour and 1 jerrycan of 20 liters of oil to make her little cakes

loans.name: Kobelo

texts.en:
Kobelo has been a businessman since 2007, running a shop selling general items. He has learned this business from his friends who also manage the same type of enterprise. Kobelo has been with Tujijenge for a long time now due to his good repayment history. He is now requesting his tenth loan.   Kobelo is a married man and has three sons who are at school. He is in his late 30s and wishes to grow his business. Kobelo is so thankful for everyone who will find time to support his business. His business is open from 6:00 am to 9:30 pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is his tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans, since repaid, to improve his business. He bought items missing from his shop but commonly demanded by his customers. Kobelo managed to receive extra income, which he used to build a house and buy a motorbike for his shop (easy to carry shop stock from big sellers). As a father, he also covered school fees and home food expenses. He is now requesting a new loan, which he will use to replenish his shop with dry food items such as rice, sugar, maize, and baking flour. Kobelo dreams of being a successful businessman. He will be accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his shop with dry food items such as rice, sugar, maize and baking flour.

loans.name: Fernando José

texts.es:
Tomates rojos y frescos, cebollas recién cortadas, aguacates y papas son algunas de las frutas y verduras de excelente calidad  que ofrece don Fernando en su pequeño puesto en el mercado central de su ciudad. Todos los días, con mucho ánimo y entusiasmo, sale de su casa para ir al trabajo, dispuesto a vender toda la mercadería y a ganar nuevos clientes. Es un hombre amable, humilde y trabajador. Tiene 27 años, está soltero y tiene dos hijos, quienes son su fuente de motivación para seguir trabajando arduamente. Hace dos años inició en el negocio vendiendo trucha, luego se paso a los productos que vende actualmente.
Fernando solicita el crédito con el objetivo de incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, papas, chayote, ayote,  zanahoria, quequisque, remolacha, entre otras frutas y verduras. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela ganar nuevos clientes, de manera que logré aumentar sus ganancias y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Es un hombre con muchos sueños y metas, una de ellas es expandir su negocio, estar ubicado en local más grande y vender más productos. Luchara hasta lograrlo, con la finalidad de brindarles  a sus hijos salud y educación de calidad, para que estos sean personas de éxito.
texts.en:
Red and fresh tomatoes, freshly cut onions, avocados, and potatoes are some of the high quality fruits and vegetables that Fernando offers in his small stand in his city's central market. Every day, with high energy and enthusiasm, he leaves his house to go to work, ready to sell all the merchandise and gain new customers. He is a friendly, humble and hard-working man. He is 27 years old, single, and has two children who are is source of motivation to continue working hard. Two years ago he got into the business of selling trout. Later he proceeded with the products he is currently selling. 

Fernando is requesting a loan with the objective of increasing capital production. This requires him to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, potatoes, chayote, pumpkins, carrots, quequisque, and beets among other fruits and vegetables. He puts his trust in the funding. Since he aspires to gain new customers, the way to achieve this is increasing his earnings and likewise improving his living conditions. He is a man with many dreams and goals. One of these is to expand his business, to be located in a larger premise, and to sell more products. He will fight until he achieves this, with the intention of providing his children with quality health and education so that they can be successful people.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, potatoes, chayote, pumpkins, carrots, quequisque, and beets among other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Elvis Arturo

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 21 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, vive con su familia en casa propia en el distrito de Nueva Arica en la provincia de Chiclayo, en la región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; en este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y también a criar y vender animales de corral.

Elvis es comerciante, él criá y vende animales de corral tiene varios años en el negocio solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 1000 nuevos soles los que invertirá en el mejoramiento del corral en donde tiene a sus animales y obtener mejores resultados a la hora de venderlos, ya que los podrá vender a un mejor precio, lo que le permitira aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvis is 21 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two dependent children. He and his family live in their own home in the District of Nueva Arica in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. Those who live in this district engage in agriculture, as well as raising and selling farm animals.

Elvis is a merchant who has been raising and selling domesticated animals for several years. He is requesting a loan for his business from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 PEN so that he can invest in improvements to the pens where the animals are kept. As a result, he will achieve better results from his sales by commanding a higher price. This will increase his profits, improve his income, and eventually lead to a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to his animal pens.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
El joven José de 24 años de edad es soltero, no tiene  hijos  que depende de él vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, no  tiene casa propia , vive con sus padres y se dedica desde hace 08 años  a la venta de leche, su venta es de forma ambulante.
José viaja en su bicicleta todos los días de el tular a San Lorenzo, este muchacho es un joven luchador que desea salir adelante además tiene dos vendedores más que lo acompañan todos los días de lunes a domingo.
José está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de mas leche ya que la demanda es buena y tiene buena oferta también desea comprar cuajada para revenderla en los mercados de la zona,  con el apoyo de este crédito espera mejorar su ingreso y por ende su calidad de vida.
 Su sueño es prosperar más en su negocio y tener una casa propia.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
José is a young man who is 24 years of age. He is single and has no children who are dependent on him. José lives in a community in southern Honduras. He does not own a home, so he lives with his parents. José has been selling milk for the past eight years as a traveling merchant. He travels on a bicycle every day from El Tular to San Lorenzo. This determined young man wants to get ahead, so he also has two other sellers who accompany him every day, Monday through Sunday.

José is requesting a loan in order to buy more milk since there is a good level of demand. Since he has good offers, he also wants to buy curds that he can resell at the local markets. With the help of this loan, he hopes to improve his earnings and eventually his quality of life.

His dream is to prosper his business even more and have a house of his own.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: to buy milk and curds to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making soap

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more tea leaves. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a better person.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, generator, embroidery machine, and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a widowed woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 16 to 22 years old. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, oranges, and bananas. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor roads. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more tea leaves. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful person.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a married man with 3 children; he describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes and shoes, and has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive location and his customers are of all types. 

Benard describes his biggest business challenge as lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and clothes. His business goal is to have a big shop within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and generator, and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a married man. He describes himself to be adventurous. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the 15,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap and other items. His business goal is to have high returns within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful and thriving business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man with 6 children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, salt, and other items, and has been involved in this business for 17 years. 

His primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, and other items. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a better business person.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, and other items

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Gloria, tiene 55 años de edad, vive  en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside con su familia  en una comunidad el municipio de Santa cruz de Yojoa. Se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas. Este negocio lo tiene hace 2 años en su casa donde vende baleadas, pastelitos con carne, pollo frito con tajadas, pupusas, etc. Esta solicitando el quinto ciclo de préstamo que es por 5,000 lempiras este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carnes, harina, manteca, arroz, condimentos, frijoles, etc. Y podrá mantener surtido de materia prima su negocio. Su meta es mejorar el negocio y la compra de mejor inmobiliario para brindar mejor servicio al cliente.
texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, with whom she has three children. She lives with her family in a community in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. She earns her living selling quick-service meals. She has had this business in her house for two years; she sells "baleadas" [flour tortillas stuffed with beans and other ingredients], "pastelitos con carne" [meat-filled pastries], fried chicken with plantain slices, "pupusas" [thick, filled corn tortillas], etc. 

She is requesting her fifth loan, which is for 5,000 lempiras [HNL]. She will invest this money in the purchase of ingredients like meats, flour, shortening, rice, condiments, beans, etc., and she will be able to keep her business stocked with ingredients. Her goal is to improve her business and to buy better furnishings in order to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meats, flour, shortening, rice, condiments, beans, etc., for making foods

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man with 6 children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a farm where he keeps cows and sells their milk, and has been involved in this business for 16 years. 

Julius' business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more milk to sell. His business goal is to excel within 5 years, and he hopes that in the future, he will be a better business person.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Desde muy niña Irene mostró su aptitud por la estética y el emprendimiento, por eso cuando veía a su tía haciendo manicure, la ayudaba y así fue como aprendió. Hace 10 años, previo al nacimiento de su primogénita, Irene inició este mismo tipo de negocio, al que agregó mercancía variada, aprovechando que tenía una clientela fija y un gran potencial de ventas. Su negocio está establecido en su propia vivienda y le produce ingresos diariamente, iniciando desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Ella ha recibido un crédito anteriormente, que le sirvió de mucho porque logró hacer un mejoramiento al local y ubicarlo de manera independiente e hizo crecer el surtido de su oferta. Hoy Irene, es madre de dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 3  meses y su mayor anhelo es apoyarlos,  junto a su cónyuge, creándoles condiciones que mejoren su vida. Su meta inmediata es hacer un mejoramiento a su vivienda y mejorar la vida económica de su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pinta-uñas, removedores, accesorios y papelería,  con ello mejorará rápidamente su negocio especialmente en la presentación y en una mayor oferta, que impactará a su clientela, para obtener nuevas ventas.
texts.en:
Since she was a young girl, Irene has showed her aptitude for style and business, such that when she saw her aunt doing manicures she helped her, and learned in this way.  Ten years ago, before the birth of her first-born daughter, Irene started this same type of business, to which she added various merchandise, progressing so that she had a stable clientele and great sales potential.

Her business is located in her own home and she conducts business daily, starting at 7 in the morning, until 4 in the afternoon.  She has received a loan before, that helped her a lot because she was able to make improvements to her premises and to situate it independently, as well as increase the stock of her offering.  

Today Irene is the mother of two children, ages 9 years and 3 months. Her greatest longing is to support them, and together with her partner, is creating conditions that better their life.  Her immediate goal is to make a home improvement and better the financial life of her family.  

At present she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase nail-polish and removers, accessories, and stationery.  This will quickly improve her business, especially in presentation and in having a greater offering. This will impact her clientele, and help her gain new sales.

loans.use: To purchase nail-polish and removers, accessories, and stationery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is an Indonesian artisan who specializes in sterling silver and leather jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and leather for his designs.

Henry has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"I used to live in Jakarta, but it was difficult to find jewelry that was specifically designed for men. So I decided to leave the hustle and bustle of Jakarta and move to Bali in 2002. There, I could pursue my dreams and create my own collections. Designing jewelry for men has become an intrinsic part of my lifestyle. In my designs I'm often funky and chunky and I like to mix different materials such as sterling silver, leather and bone. My goals in life are to raise my three kids, be a good partner for the artisans that work with me, and keep focused on designing men's silver jewelry.

"Many thanks for this interest-free microcredit. It is a helpful boost, and I sincerely appreciate it. To me it means that I can continue working, and I'll enjoy presenting my new collections to all of you!"

Use the link below to view Henry's sterling silver and leather jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7116

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and leather for his jewelry designs.

loans.name: El Clavel Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario El Clavel está integrado por cuatro mujeres microempresarias emprendedoras, quienes a diario se ganan el pan de cada día para su familia, el grupo solidario es coordinado por la señora Keyrin quien tiene la edad de 22 años y casada, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva en su comunidad, este negocio lo emprendió hace tres con ayuda de su familia y esposo, es primera vez que trabaja con los financiamientos de la institución y solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones para damas y caballeros, camisetas, camisolas, blusas, brazier, bóxer, blúmer, vestidos, shorts, etc. Otra de las socias es la señora Arelis de 42 años de edad quien ofrece el servicio de comida en su domicilio y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, aceite, frijol, verduras, frutas, etc., la señora Viviana quien tiene la edad de 35 años y es propietaria de un taller de zapatería en su domicilio y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cuero, cuero sintético, pega blanca, pega amarilla, hebillas, hilo, y mantenimiento a las maquinarias, la señora Carolina de 20 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva en su domicilio. Este grupo es primera vez que trabajaran con el financiamiento de la institución.
texts.en:
The El Clavel group is made up of four women. They are enterprising small business owners who bring home the daily bread for their families. 

This group is coordinated by Keyrin, who is 22 years old and married. She makes a living selling new clothing in her community. She started this business three years ago with the help of her family and her husband. This is the first time she is working with financing from the institution. She has applied for a loan to buy pants for men and women, T-shirts, sports shirts, blouses, bras, boxers, underwear, dresses, shorts, etc.

Another one of the members is Arelis, 42, who offers a food service from her home. She will use this loan to buy rice, oil, beans, vegetables, fruit, etc. Viviana, 35, owns a footwear workshop in her home. She has applied for this loan to buy leather, synthetic leather, white glue, yellow glue, buckles, thread, and to maintain her equipment. Carolina, 20, sells new clothing in her home. This is the first time that this group is working with financing from the institution.

loans.use: to buy pants for men and women, T-shirts, sports shirts, blouses, bras, boxers, underwear, dresses, shorts, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a farm where he rears sheep. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sheep. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a better businessperson.

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
This is Meriam. She is 40 years old and currently resides with her husband, Ibrahim, in Taguig City, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than two years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one packet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and then selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To improve sales, Meriam would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With the 20,000 PHP loan she will purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Meriam hopes to increase her inventory and product sales. She also wants to save money for her children and give them a better future. She meets each week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hard working entrepreneur from Taguig, Philippines. She is 53 years old and has children who are currently in school. She oversees the operation of their Jeepney (small bus) unit, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) Jeepney, from which she is paid boundary* (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 PHP every day. Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippine.

Margarita is requesting 10,000 PHP in loan assistance to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her Jeepney unit. She will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she wants to progress through her business and hopes that there will be improvement in their life through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the Jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es: Elsa, tiene  43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, cerca de Peña Blanca. Elsa anteriormente realizaba actividades agrícolas y hace 3 años estableció una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, manteca, arroz, frijoles, pan, harina, huevos, condimentos, churros, dulces etc. Además vende ropa por encargos. El préstamo que solicita es por 8,500 lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de más productos alimenticios para vender en la pulpería y satisfacer a sus clientes. Su plan es seguir ampliando el negocio para tener mejores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Elsa is 43 years old. She is a single mother who has four children. She lives in a small town in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, close to Peña Blanca. 

Previously, Elsa did agricultural work; three years ago, she established a small grocery store where she sells staple grains, shortening, rice, beans, bread, flour, eggs, condiments, "churros" [sweet fried pastries], sweets, etc. She also sells clothing by order. 

The loan she is requesting is for 8,500 lempiras [HNL]. She will invest it in the purchase of more food products to sell in her grocery to satisfy her customers. Her plan is to continue expanding the business in order to have more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell in her small grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric, and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
This is Cristina, 38, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo and is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cristina operates a buy-and-sell business. She buys scrap materials then sells them to collectors.  She also makes income through offering rental service of her laundry machines.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She will also use the loan for the maintenance of her clothes washers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cristina aspires to give her children a better future through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials needed in her business and improve her laundry service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Handaru

texts.en:
Handaru is a Javanese artisan who specializes in handcrafted batik art. He would like to invest in a purchase of wood, for his masks and sculptures.

Handaru has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I come from a region renowned for batik artistry. We transfer traditional textile batik techniques to wood. I specialize in Indonesian batik ornaments, but focus more in the classic styles of Yogya and Solo. The color I use is 'sogan,' or brown, a trademark of the Yogya-Solo style. I enjoy my work greatly, and hope that my customers take pleasure in sharing our rich cultural heritage.

"I want to share and sell my Javanese batik works that we hand-paint on wood. The crafting process can be long, and sometimes it fails due to the extreme weather. This microcredit will help me sell my works and allow the Javanese batik technique to be known in other continents."

Use the link below to view Handaru's handcrafted batik art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1572

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of wood for his masks and sculptures.
